burrito.review:
I recently went to Tia Margerita having heard great things about it. I ordered the sampler plate with one burrito, one taco and one quesadilla. the burrito was good but I was  sadly disappointed by the taco and quesadilla especially for this price. My friend had a carne asada taco for $13 and a carne asada burrito for $14. In my opinion definitely overpriced for the food that it was.
Even though I did not order it, I hear that the one thing to try from this place is the Chimichangas...

excerpts: The plate also came with a carne Asada burrito, a chicken enchilada, and a tamale.
All of the food was very tasty and very filling.
burrito.author: Tony N.
burrito.review:
Came here with a few friends about an hour before closing. Seated very quickly. We sat in the room with the bar and were able to watch the Giants game while we ate. 

I ordered a house margarita on the rocks and it was really good. The pictures on yelp of the margarita are accurate. 

I ordered the Combination Plate (Large). This plate came with a Chile Relleno that is possibly the best I have ever had, highly recommended. The plate also came with a carne Asada burrito, a chicken enchilada, and a tamale. All of the food was very tasty and very filling. So much so, had to take some of it home for breakfast in the morning. 

The service was good. We had a waiter that took out orders and was prompt with everything we needed and the hostess kinda backed him up and made sure when he was busy at other tables, we were taken cared of. 

If you like good quality food and great service I would recommend this place. I'm sure I'll be back again to visit soon.

excerpts: I wanted the shrimp burrito, and the waiter asked if I wanted one or two....
I'm so glad I ordered one.
The shrimp was perfectly marinated, but didn't overwhelm the other flavors.
Yes, this burrito was more than the average burrito.
But I will come back again if I ever have a burrito craving.
burrito.author: Vira P.
burrito.review:
Wow, big portions!  I wanted the shrimp burrito, and the waiter asked if I wanted one or two.... I'm so glad I ordered one.  The shrimp was perfectly marinated, but didn't overwhelm the other flavors.  Yes, this burrito was more than the average burrito.

I'm allergic to tequila, so unfortunately I couldn't try the margaritas.  But I will come back again if I ever have a burrito craving.

excerpts: Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered.
Wasn't a huge fun.
Overall experience was great
and I would def go back to try some more items.
Oh also the alcohol is strong.
Yum.
Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!!
Haha!!
burrito.author: Mandi K.
burrito.review:
I have to say that this place was a bit surprising! They must be a popular joint because the restaurant got pretty crowded very quickly. At first when you walk in all you see is the bar, it literally takes up most of the room and there are a few booths that surround the line the rest of the place. Also has a weird musty smell to it when you walk in. ( they need to air this place more often) now the servers and everyone are friendly and quite attentive. The decor is pretty old and I noticed duct tape to patch up certain parts of the furniture. 
     Now for the food! They start you off with the chips and two kinds of salsa. One was spicy and one mild and I have to say the mild seemed like ketchup with bits of tomato and onion to make it seem like salsa. However the spicy salsa was on point! Next the food, HUGE portions. Def worth the price of what you are getting. Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered. Wasn't a huge fun. Overall experience was great and I would def go back to try some more items. Oh also the alcohol is strong. Yum. Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!! Haha!!

excerpts: And who can say no to a deep fried burrito?
Drool!
burrito.author: Sarah B.
burrito.review:
My partner and I have been fans of Tia's for 2+ years. 

2 doubles on the rocks with salt. Split a Chimichanga plate with shredded beef, refried beans, and jalapeños on side. Sit at the bar.  Totally worth the drive from Berkeley!  Parking can be difficult on weekend nights but usually we find something along Geary. Arriving shortly before 6pm and paying a bit on the metered parking spots is a good way to do it. 

Their margaritas are the best I've had, nice and strong with freshly squeezed lime. No bogus drink mixes. And who can say no to a deep fried burrito? Drool!

excerpts: The rice and beans were full of flavor as was the entire dish (Shredded Beef Burrito and a Chile Relleno).
The Margaritas are as original as you can get.
Our meals came with a Double Top Shelf Margaritas; a few sips of that
and you are on cloud 9!
A little too strong at first but
burrito.author: Jennifer D.
burrito.review:
I'm always looking to try new and exciting off the beaten path. I had purchased some half off dinner vouchers for Tia Margarita online months ago and completely forgot about them.  Since the vouchers expired yesterday, I went with a friend to try the place out. Each voucher was good for 2 small (not small by any means) combo dishes and 2 margaritas.  We could only use one of the vouchers last night.  The Manager, Jennifer, kindly extended the second voucher it so that I could either come back or give it to someone else to enjoy.  

This place was great!  A pleasant find; I will recommend and return to with family and friends. We were greeted right away and provided a table.  Chips and 2 types of salsa were brought to our table. Showed our friendly server our vouchers and he told us what was included.  Made us feel very welcomed.  Portion sizes are very generous...plenty for lunch left over's.  The small combo dish came with two main dish choices, black beans, rice and green salad.  The rice and beans were full of flavor as was the entire dish (Shredded Beef Burrito and a Chile Relleno).  The Margaritas are as original as you can get.  Our meals came with a Double Top Shelf Margaritas; a few sips of that and you are on cloud 9!  :)  A little too strong at first but as the ice melted, it was fine and fully enjoyed!  

The horseshoe shaped bar is very inviting.  By the time we were half way through our meal, the place was busy inside for a Wed. night.  People picking up orders to go, dining in or just grabbing a drink and chat at the bar.  We never felt rushed to leave yet not forgotten either.  

A fantastic first experience to a well hidden gem off the beaten path!  Looking forward to my return!  :)

excerpts: The best thing I've found, is to order the 3 item and include a beef burrito - and take home the burrito for another day.
It is definitely worth more than just an item on the plate.
If you break the cost down, it is a $7 "Gordo's" burrito for around $5 ...
yeah,
I sounded cheap just then but $2 is a bus ride.
burrito.author: Andrea K.
burrito.review:
Parking is bad.  As for the food... nice (not great) staple and priced well.  I've been here for more than 10 times and it's satisfying cause it's a sit down place that is decent and dark.  Old school tables and chairs and decor.  Unlimited flour tortillas and butter. The best thing I've found, is to order the 3 item and include a beef burrito - and take home the burrito for another day.  It is definitely worth more than just an item on the plate. If you break the cost down, it is a $7 "Gordo's" burrito for around $5 ... yeah, I sounded cheap just then but $2 is a bus ride.  But that's my take on Tia Margarita.

The barflies seems like a lot of locals and they seem happy.

excerpts: Hopefully in 20 years when we pass the 1000 burrito mark, we'll have a permanent booth reserved for us with our names engraved on a commemorative plate-shaped plaque.
burrito.author: Laura And Adam F.
burrito.review:
We LOVE Tia's.  Chips & salsa + double margaritas + chicken burritos = happy us.  All the employees are very friendly (Tony is awesome) and always try to find us a spot in the bar area.  Hopefully in 20 years when we pass the 1000 burrito mark, we'll have a permanent booth reserved for us with our names engraved on a commemorative plate-shaped plaque.

P.S. I don't understand why people even compare Tia's and Tommy's.  The food and service are much better at Tia's, and yes Tommy's has tequila but I believe the Tia's margaritas contain that as well.

excerpts: But when it is open and you are still treating my late dinner as a total inconvenience for you when this is supposed to be the service you provide it doesn't really make me want to get my burrito dinner here.
burrito.author: Theresa C.
burrito.review:
This place is alright.

Cute and classic, but the food is definitely nothing special. If anything, it's extremely salty and quite expensive for what it is. Yeah the margaritas can be strong-ish, but if you ask me, they are small (TONS of ice) and expensive too. My main qualm with this place really is that it seems to cost a lot more than it should. 

I've also found the staff to be quite unfriendly and impatient. Every time we have eaten here they seem more annoyed than anything that they have to be there at all. They are especially grumpy toward the end of the night, but i'm sorry, if your kitchen is open, it's open. And if it's not, it's not. But when it is open and you are still treating my late dinner as a total inconvenience for you when this is supposed to be the service you provide it doesn't really make me want to get my burrito dinner here.

excerpts: My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).
It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff
and it's only around $15.
Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.
burrito.author: dave g.
burrito.review:
Tia's Rocks!
I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet because I've eaten here at least 10 times.  I've been with friends, family, co-workers, everyone loves this place.  First thing you need to know is that the food is TASTY!  We've probably gone thru everything on the menu at this point and have never been disappointed.   It's one of our favorite places to eat in the city.

The portions are HUGE!  My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).  It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff and it's only around $15.  Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.  Rockin'!  

My buddy ordered a small combination plate and that came with TWO burritos!  Nice.  I read where some people were bitching about the prices, but, the food you get will feed an army.

Next, the Margaritas are great.  We had a group of 5 there tonight and everyone commented on how tasty they were.  I read a few reviews where people felt they were watered down, but I've never thought that once in all the Margaritas I've had there over the years.  In fact, sometimes I thought they were TOO strong.  (I mean, it can't really ever be TOO strong, but, ya know what I mean). 

The wait staff there is great.  We had chips and salsa on our table within moments of being seated.  They're quick to fill back up your water, they're generous with the chips and salsa and constantly come around to make sure you have everything you need.  After years of going, I finally introduced myself to the same waitress who has waited on us so many times.  Her name is Rosa and she's awesome.  She's got a great sense of humor and we love joking around with her.  I already can't wait to go back....

excerpts: In the "light-eater" section, a small burrito (with some rice and beans) runs you $10.75.
burrito.author: Tom A.
burrito.review:
This is a bit of an upscale Mexican joint, at least in terms of price (that sounds kind of funny - an "upscale Mexican restaurant"...). 

TMMR is a deceptively large restaurant, known for its individually-crafted margaritas. While I didn't have a margarita tonight, I was certainly in the minority, as almost every other patron was (seemingly) enjoying their frosty beverages. 

The food was pretty standard, but I'm still in a bit of a tizzy about the prices. In the "light-eater" section, a small burrito (with some rice and beans) runs you $10.75. In my book, that's too expensive for Mexican food. 

I did, however, find the bartender quite funny and the atmosphere was enjoyable. Regardless, the nice ambiance won't save TMMR from its insanely high prices - I'll be looking elsewhere.

excerpts: The burrito plate comes with 2 burritos and they're big - so much food.
burrito.author: Rachel G.
burrito.review:
Huge portions! Even the plates themselves are massive!

Good chips and salsa. The burrito plate comes with 2 burritos and they're big - so much food.The enchiladas rancheros were only OK.
The beef is ground, ugh, but the chicken is shredded and good. 

Service was fine.

excerpts: 2 beers, a burrito, enchilads, a child's plate, and a side of guacamole was ~$60 before tip.
burrito.author: Debra H.
burrito.review:
I don't think I have one positive thing to say about our experience and that's sad because I love Tex-Mex.  I was so excited that we accidentally "found" this place.  Now I know why I'd never heard of it.

Summary:
* It was around 5 pm, so they weren't busy, but they took forever to seat us.  
* They only had 2 highchairs, both in use by one of the few tables there.  
* The place itself is old & dingy.
* The service was incredibly slow and the waiter was rude.  
* The food's presentation was ok, but the food itself was terrible.

I picked at the edible things on my plate.  Our daughter usually devours Mexican rice, but she took 1 bite of it and no more.  Even the guacamole was gross -- over-onioned and kind of warm.

In the end, we didn't eat most of our food and we didn't take it with us.  2 beers, a burrito, enchilads, a child's plate, and a side of guacamole was ~$60 before tip. The quality was in the $20-$25 range. 

No question: we'll never go back.

excerpts: I ordered the chicken enchiladas and my father ordered the burrito and chili relleno combo.
All were bland and uninspired.
As we worked through our food with sadness and dismay, a crowd of Irish folk developed all around.
This was probably the highlight of the meal listening to them sing and drink loudly.
Always a good time.
burrito.author: Thor M.
burrito.review:
I really wanted to love Tia's. I live 5 blocks from it and there is nothing I enjoy more than great mexican food. I had heard mixed reviews about the place, but decided that I must try it for myself. This was a bad idea. 

After a long day of wild boar hunting with my dad we decided to quell our starving bellies at Tia's. We step into the restaurant, and surprisingly, it is not at all crowded on a Saturday night (bad sign). Nobody helps to seat us at first, but finally the bartender tells us to take any table. 

A sweet, yet awkward Irish waitress (love the accent) brought us menus. However, we then waited 20 minutes to get water and to order. This annoyance was tempered by the moderately good chips and salsa that a busser brought us. The chips were good, seemed fresh, but a little thick for my taste. The spicy salsa (they also have a non-spicy) was quite good, but didn't change the overall experience. 

I ordered the chicken enchiladas and my father ordered the burrito and chili relleno combo. All were bland and uninspired. As we worked through our food with sadness and dismay, a crowd of Irish folk developed all around. This was probably the highlight of the meal listening to them sing and drink loudly. Always a good time. Although, it was quite an odd sight seeing Irish people crowd up a mexican food restaurant. 

Overall, I will probably never go back to Tia's. Not because it was the worst thing I've ever tasted, but because with so many good restaurants in SF there are plenty of places to fill my tummy.

excerpts: I love getting the combos, and nuking my burrito the next day for lunch.
burrito.author: Cherry P.
burrito.review:
The double margaritas are deliciously dangerous, and you get so much food for the price. I love getting the combos, and nuking my burrito the next day for lunch.

No, it's not authentic, but as long as you sit in the bar room, the ambiance is 1,000% better than Tommy's. I've been here twice now with my Mexican-American and Panamanian-American friends and they don't give a crap that it's not authentic cause it's still delicious, and a very fun place to hang. 

One word of caution: don't go too early or you'll be surrounded by kids.

excerpts: Not to mention, when asking the size of a burrito (because they have plates w 2 burritos
.. never seen that in my life) she looked at my boyfriend and said "what do you think?
And then proceeded to tell him he should get the plate w 2 burritos poking fun at this size.
The burritos were normal size, I would be surprised if anyone could eat both.
burrito.author: CK F.
burrito.review:
This restaurant is literally the reason why I've finally made a Yelp account.. to advise you NOT to eat here. Unless you want to get boozed up because that is probably the only reliable thing here, strong drinks. 

Why? Let me explain. 
**Poor service
Rude! Rude! Rude!
Not only did our waitress ignore our request for waters, only concerned with what we wanted from the bar ($), but she literally sat at the table across from our booth watching us while we figured out what we wanted and then stared at us while we ate our meal. She wasn't the only one though, it seemed to be the break area for other servers. Awkward. Not to mention, when asking the size of a burrito (because they have plates w 2 burritos.. never seen that in my life) she looked at my boyfriend and said "what do you think?" And then proceeded to tell him he should get the plate w 2 burritos poking fun at this size. The burritos were normal size, I would be surprised if anyone could eat both. Now onto food. 

**Worst Mexican food I've ever eaten
Let's say everything tasted like it came out of a can. No flavor, sour cream and guacamole smelled rancid and everything with "tomatoes" should really read ketchup. Not to mention the plates are so hot you have to wait a good 5 minutes before anything is tolerable to eat.

**Dinner in the dark
Why would I pay $20 for a plate of Mexican food to eat it in the dark? No thanks.

Needless to say, I will never be coming back to this restaurant. You couldn't pay me to come back.

excerpts: Get a burrito with pollo asada or carne asada or have them as entrees.
burrito.author: Mary F.
burrito.review:
This is our favorite place to go for fresh lime margaritas (do not get me started on the Tommy v. Tia margarita argument). Order the Jenny's salad with gambas dressing or anything with gambas dressing. Get a burrito with pollo asada or carne asada or have them as entrees. The best! 

Go to trivia the first Thursday of every month and realize you are not as smart as you think you are...Ger is tough!

excerpts: and I always get the same thing - enchilada, taco and burrito.
(I have been getting this since I was 10 years old.  :-)
burrito.author: Sean O.
burrito.review:
Okay, I admit I am being super generous with the five stars, but for me Tia Margarita is pure comfort food.  It reminds me of the Mexican restaurants we would get to go to growing up in the suburbs of Southern California.  I always get a combination plate and I always get the same thing - enchilada, taco and burrito.  (I have been getting this since I was 10 years old.  :-)  The plates here are huge, so I always end up taking half of it home.

Another reason I give this place five stars is that we always go with our friends that live near there and it's always a treat to see them.  They, like my partner, grew up in the city and this is a place they have gone to for years.  

So, what I am saying is that there are five very personal stars but well deserved.

excerpts: Grab a Margarita and a beer as a chaser, order some comfort food, and if you are an SF overgroomed metrosexual food-rater attempting to judge a restaurant strictly along cultural guidelines, there's this country just south of here called Mexico, where you can get a great, culturally idiosyncratic burrito.
burrito.author: betty b.
burrito.review:
Indeed it is not authentic Mexican food, but frankly very little of the places in SF are authentic (startle!)...even in the Mission.  Many SF hipsters are apparently expert identifiers of culturally authentic cuisine (it's the SMUG, you can't blame them).  If you are actually from Mexico, there are pray few places in this city where you get the real deal.  Tia's (a-duh!) ain't one of em.  Was it the sports bar look that fooled you?    

That being said, it's mostly good Margaritas and Americanized-Californiazed (whatever the hell that means) comfort food.  For Christ's sake they have Taquitos like out of the oven.  and another downside is the tv only play sports, but you can tune that out.  

Come here on a weeknight after a shitty day at work with a good friend.  Come around 8pm (the screaming food-throwing crotchfruit are gone then).  Grab a Margarita and a beer as a chaser, order some comfort food, and if you are an SF overgroomed metrosexual food-rater attempting to judge a restaurant strictly along cultural guidelines, there's this country just south of here called Mexico, where you can get a great, culturally idiosyncratic burrito.

excerpts: we came here with intentions to eat, but a $12 burrito was just not what we were looking for.
burrito.author: desiree n.
burrito.review:
Most expensive mexican food ever.  we came here with intentions to eat, but a $12 burrito was just not what we were looking for.  So instead we drank liquor and walked around the corner to gordos.

I do have to say that the food did look pretty good...just way too spensive for poor people like me.

excerpts: I got the 3 item combo with the Chile Rellano, Burrito and taco.
The best part about it was the Burrito.
My boyfriend got the chicken tostada.
That was much better than my combo.
burrito.author: Rachel S.
burrito.review:
As a disclaimer, Tia Margarita did have wonderful chips and salsa (red salsa is bomb), and the portions were huge. 

One thing that really bums me out about San Francisco, is the lack of Mexican restaurants. I'm not talking about taquerias. I'm talking about actual Mexican restaurants. Then the ones that are here such as Tia Margarita, are mediocre. 

So I ordered a single Margarita and it tasted like pure tequila. I asked if they could make it less strong and the waitress brought out this sweet and sour mix which then made it WAY too sweet. So I ended up just not drinking it. 

The food was OK but portions were huge. I got the 3 item combo with the Chile Rellano, Burrito and taco. The best part about it was the Burrito. My boyfriend got the chicken tostada. That was much better than my combo. The Spanish rice was just eh. 

Overall, prices are reasonable for the huge portions but the food just isn't that great. Oh how I long for San Diego Mexican food...

excerpts: My friend had a combination with a crispy unsoggy taco and a burrito.
burrito.author: Dan C.
burrito.review:
This is my new favorite Mexican place, and not just because it is also the closest to home.

I had chicken fajitas.  My friend had a combination with a crispy unsoggy taco and a burrito.

It's tough to differentiate yourself in the Mexican food industry of San Francisco.  It mostly comes down to the chips and salsa.  This place's are tops.  

The waitress was very cool and friendly too.  I'm going back soon.

excerpts: Honestly there may be other places that have better burritos or soups or whatever, but in San Francisco most all of those places are hole in the wall spots where you stand in line get your burrito and leave.
burrito.author: Robert S.
burrito.review: I love this place.  Other than really crappy parking I always enjoy eating here.  Honestly there may be other places that have better burritos or soups or whatever, but in San Francisco most all of those places are hole in the wall spots where you stand in line get your burrito and leave.  If you want a nice hot plate of enchiladas with beans, rice, melted cheese with a never ending stream of chips and delicious salsa then this is a place you need to try.  I recommend the Enchiladas with sour cream sauce with a fried egg on top.

excerpts: The price difference for a single burrito and a double burrito plate is $2, so I usually just go for the latter and bring one home.
burrito.author: Casey F.
burrito.review:
Oh my, I love the Carne Asada burritos here.  Usually get that with re fried beans.  The price difference for a single burrito and a double burrito plate is $2, so I usually just go for the latter and bring one home.  These burritos are pretty big, so you probably won't finish both in one sitting unless you're a fatty like my friend Frank (see my friends list).

History:  I used to pretty much live right across the street from this place.  Didn't start coming here until about 6 months before I left (Isn't that how it always is?).

I only like coming here at night.  The place has a different atmosphere during the day.  Parking sucks in this area.  Ok bye.

excerpts: I was just tearing away at my super burrito and didn't give a shiz.
burrito.author: Chris I.
burrito.review: Hell yes! January '11 I moved out here from Seattle and I couldn't find a single place in the city that could compare to the Mexican food up there. This place does. Amazing food with giant portions and a full bar. Drinks seem to take a while if you sit at a booth. The bar actually takes up more room than the restaurant. The people there were nice, even if the company I was with didn't seem to think so but they were blaming out waiter for our drinks coming in the middle of our meal. I was just tearing away at my super burrito and didn't give a shiz.

excerpts: We got the burrito, the relleno, and the enchilada.
The burrito was...
okay.
The chicken inside wasn't great.
but it was huge with a lot of spices.
The Relleno was a little lacking though.
We tend to associate rellenos as being very flavorful, and this in all honesty was one of the duller tasting ones we have had.
The weakest part of the meal was the enchilada.
It tasted kind of the like the ones you would find in a TV dinner... not in terms of being reheated, but the ingredients tasted identical.
burrito.author: Sami R.
burrito.review:
We were craving Mexican food, and picked this area on a random inclination. We opted for this over the better reviewed Tommy's due to the fact that Tia's actually lists their prices online (who doesn't do that?).

In terms of this place it was... okay. It tends to favor quantity over quality, which might appeal to someone that is super hungry... but we tend to prefer it in reverse order. The portions here are very big though, especially for the price. A single entry was more than enough to keep this couple filled, while the chips and salsa kept coming before hand (without us having to ask for it, which was a plus).

The downside was the food itself. To be fair, the female component of this review team is very tough when it comes to Mexican food (a byproduct of a parent who cooks yummy Mexican dishes), so lacking food of the Mexican variety tends to be less tolerated. On the night we went, we ordered the large platter with three different options so as best to sample everything. We got the burrito, the relleno, and the enchilada. The burrito was... okay. The chicken inside wasn't great. but it was huge with a lot of spices. The Relleno was a little lacking though. We tend to associate rellenos as being very flavorful, and this in all honesty was one of the duller tasting ones we have had. The weakest part of the meal was the enchilada. It tasted kind of the like the ones you would find in a TV dinner... not in terms of being reheated, but the ingredients tasted identical. Oh, also we were distraught with the rice, which was simply buttery instead of Spanish.

Overall, the place probably deserves a 2.5, as we have been to far worse locations that have been given a two, but its not quite high enough to earn that three.

excerpts: I usually have a burrito, taco and enchilada.
The burrito: hot damn it is one HUGE burrito!
That's where the idea of "two meals" comes in: eat the taco and enchilada (or any other combo) and then save the burrito for another time.

burrito.author: Heather S.
burrito.review:
Sooooo amazing and suchhhhhh a great deal! You don't have to travel to the Mission or go as far as San Diego for some authentic Mexican food. Not diet friendly! One meal can easily suffice as two especially after diving into refillable chips and salsa. They usually provide you with two types of salsa and don't distinguish between the two, so spicy sensitive peeps be careful! 

To start I would try the shrimp and garlic. Since I discovered my aversion to garlic I haven't tried it again since but from what I remember it was de-lish! Plump shrimp with fresh garlic. 

Now the key to making two meals out of one is to order the 3 item combo plate for a couple bucks more. I usually have a burrito, taco and enchilada. The enchiladas are in a true Mexican red sauce and are oozing with cheese. The burrito: hot damn it is one HUGE burrito! That's where the idea of "two meals" comes in: eat the taco and enchilada (or any other combo) and then save the burrito for another time. Its even more delightful the next day! 

Margaritas are STRONG which often leads to a good time. I'm always groaning from a food baby when I leave this place but am so so so happy :)

God damn does it get any better?
Really... does it?
Help me....
burrito.author: matt l.
burrito.review:
I love this joint!
Is it even possible to eat this much food in one sitting? Don't even answer, I know you can't do it. Even in your Thanksgiving elastic maternity sweats it's just too much food, on a giant plate to take down in one sitting you just can't. so stop... 
But therein lies the beauty, leftovers for the 4am hungover/still drunk stumble to the kitchen. Just picture it, you're starving and feel awful... (check the clock, dear god please don't let it be time to get up for work yet) No! it's only 4am! YES! 2.5 more hours of coma to go before the nasty alarm goes off. 
Open the fridge (blinded momentarily by the 40 Watt bulb) then you see it, the non-biodegradable Styrofoam box inside of the non-biodegradable plastic bag, and it hits you... the leftover burrito from dinner! God damn does it get any better? Really... does it?  Help me....

excerpts: In SF we are lucky enough to have three basic classes of Mexican restaurant loosely defined in the following categories: 1) Classy and expensive, 2) Cheap and Burrito and 3) Family and Margarita Dependent.
burrito.author: Matt C.
burrito.review:
In SF we are lucky enough to have three basic classes of Mexican restaurant loosely defined in the following categories: 1) Classy and expensive, 2) Cheap and Burrito and 3) Family and Margarita Dependent.  I love category number 3, especially when the food is decent, who comes here for the food anymore than you'd put gas in a car without an engine. 

The ideal category 3 Mexican restaurant has ridiculously strong and ridiculously cheap margaritas, fresh and spicy salsa, decent chips, and (in a perfect world) a patio to let the tequila- lime joy unfold on... A triplesec covered, tequila infused proscenium (if you will). 

Getting back to Tia's, it has a few things going for it off the bat: Weird soft white loungey lighting? Check. Huge round bar that seems to take up the entire restaurant? Check.  Hot hostess? Check.  Vaguely Andy Garcia bartender serving extra strong drinks to the ladies at the bar? Check. The margaritas are strong in their own right (especially the doubles) and the enchiladas are really quite good. I actually like these margaritas just as much as Tommy's... They give you two kinds of salsa with your chips too. All in all, I would be completely content here if they had a patio, which they don't. But no place is perfect and Tia Margarita does a really nice job being just what it is.

excerpts: but if what you're in the mood for is a more basic restaurant burrito, taco, etc you might find Tia more appealing.
burrito.author: Ben S.
burrito.review:
People in the Richmond don't have alot of choices for Mexican dining so it's no surprise when we get excited over the average fare at Tia's. Nothing wrong with the food here or the drinks but nothing deserving hyperbole either.

Large, dimly lit and casual, Tia is a fine place to bring a group of mates or your family. If you're alone, sit at the bar and talk to the locals. If you're with friends-of-friends (or worse, with your significant other's co-workers ;) ) asked to be sit up front in a booth. This is so you can see the flat-screen television, where baseball, basketball and other sports spool endlessly.

Regarding Tia vs Tommy's, without question Tommy's makes better margaritas but their food has a Yucatanean bent to it. This wonderful in it's own right but if what you're in the mood for is a more basic restaurant burrito, taco, etc you might find Tia more appealing.

Suggestions: if asked if you want hot or mild salsa get both. The hot is quite hot for some people but the mild has almost no heat (though it's tasty). For a change of pace, try the Guatemalan Tostada. It's topped with chunks of their Pollo Asada and the pineapple/sour dressing they pour over it really works well. You'll be greeted by an enormous mound of lettuce that may make you wonder if you did the right thing by listening to me, but dig deep down and you'll find there's black beans and lots of jack cheese sandwiched between two flour tortillas - more than enough substantial food to fill your tummy and then some.

excerpts: It seemed like all the Mexican places I found on Yelp were either burrito joints or sit-down restaurants with high-dollar interior Mex food.
I wanted a Mexican restaurant like the ones I grew up eating as a SoCal suburb girl.
Americanized Mexican combinations that are REALLY good.
I had a chicken taco, cheese enchilada and shredded beef and bean burrito (for a combo plate, the burrito is was HUGE).
burrito.author: Staci M.
burrito.review:
This place was EXACTLY what I was looking for.  That's why the five stars.  

It seemed like all the Mexican places I found on Yelp were either burrito joints or sit-down restaurants with high-dollar interior Mex food.  I wanted a Mexican restaurant like the ones I grew up eating as a SoCal suburb girl.  Americanized Mexican combinations that are REALLY good.  Nothing fancy; just solid (traditional chile relleno beats out one with goat cheese and pine-nuts in my book).  A sit-down restaurant that served chips and salsa right off the bat.  Has great homemade guacamole.  And an enchilada with good enchilada sauce (not mole sauce or super-mild red sauce).  This place was perfect.  

Well, the rice IS kinda a mystery.  The flavor is like Chicken Rice-a-roni but milder.  But the beans are deliciously topped with that sizzling white cheese.  And I recommend asking them for HOT sauce.  If you mix it with the salsa they give you, it's TOPS.  

I had a chicken taco, cheese enchilada and shredded beef and bean burrito (for a combo plate, the burrito is was HUGE).  I had some of my boyfriend's chile relleno.  Everything was awesome.  The flan was perfect too.

Go here for the best mexican family restaurant I've seen yet in these parts.  It's still a BIT pricey ($15 for my 3-item combo) but I have another meal out of it and it was the bomb.  And their margaritas are nice and strong and not heavy on the mixer.  Damn this place rocks.

excerpts: 1 enchilada, 1 Taco, 1 chile relleno, 1 Fluata or 1 burrito).
burrito.author: Chuy C.
burrito.review:
After hearing many wonderful reviews through word of mouth I decided to finally give Tia Margarita's a try.  I figured the reviews came from trusted friends and how can you go wrong with Mexican after all I am one!

Warning numero uno. If you walk into an authentic Mexican restaurant and you and your friend are the only Mexicans in the place turn and run!

 The food at Tia Margaritas was far from appetizing; in fact it was as far from Mexican as Mexican food could be. I order the combination place (the small combo plate, you have a choice of three), which consisted of Spanish rice, refried beans, 1 enchilada, and 1 chile relleno (you have a choice of two items to go with your sides. 1 enchilada, 1 Taco, 1 chile relleno, 1 Fluata or 1 burrito).

Now I am not sure were the chef went to cooking school but it definitely did not specialize in Mexican cuisine. The Spanish rice was made with Risotto style rice, the salad came covered in Salsa, and the refried beans, basically tasted like a 50 cent can of refried beans.

The chips and so-called salsa did little for me. The salsa seemed to be made from ketchup and cocktail sauce with a hint of chopped onions.

The staff was friendly and nice and was very attending, and polite.

Unfortunately the only thing authentic about Tia Margarita's was there selection of beer.

This place should change there name to Aunt Margaret's and their Menu. Save your money and walk around the block to Gordo's.

excerpts: just go around the corner to gordos and have a burrito.
it is WAY better and cheaper.
burrito.author: Maria G.
burrito.review:
THE WORST MEXICAN FOOD EVER! I ate their yesterday (8-3) for dinner. 

The chips and salsa- chips were okay... they were cold. Salsa was gross way over seasoned; the red salsa tasted like salted garlic. The green salsa was pretty good.

Margarita- single, blended. brought to me watery and tasted like watery tequila with well mix. $4.75

Guacamole- over seasoned and pureed I'm sure. there was no sign of any other ingredient beside avocado and garlic salt.

Chille relleno- tasted okay but they were itty bitty and the representation was very poor. and the sauce tasted like raviolli sauce. $12.50

rice- pretty sure it was not mexican rice but rather some stove top stuff! that's the san francisco treat!

beans- really salty and just did not add to any part of the meal.

salad with tomato sauce- eww didn't even touch it!

so what did i eat with my 25 dollar meal? a gross, watery and weak margarita, 2 lousy, small chile rellenos, half the guacamole, 4 forkfuls of rice, 2 forkfuls of beans, and chips.

I would not recommend going here at all to any body. just go around the corner to gordos and have a burrito. it is WAY better and cheaper.

excerpts: On the other hand, I ordered the 3 item combo which included 2 enchiladas and the burrito and was not disappointed.
The male server from our first visit remembered me and acknowledged that "we had come back" which was nice.
I happened to strike up a conversation with the hostess as I am also in the food business and introduced myself as having been a neighborhood resident.
She told me that her parents opened the business back in the 50's which I knew.
I can't remember her name
but I will definitely be back when I'm in the city!
burrito.author: Richard H.
burrito.review: For whatever reason, I never had the impetus to dine at this restaurant even though I grew up in the Richmond District. I'm now making up for lost time as my family first dined here during the Christmas holidays and we were all amazed at the food that this family run restaurant puts out!. I used to be a La Barca fan back when the food was good 20 plus years ago and had been looking for a family style Mexican restaurnat in this neighborhood. The place was still hopping after 9 pm and the margaritas were a killer as many yelpers can attest! I came back a second time within the past month for dinner again and was not dismayed. Portions are large and my wife and mother in law each ordered a single taco with the works and that was plenty for them. On the other hand, I ordered the 3 item combo which included 2 enchiladas and the burrito and was not disappointed. The male server from our first visit remembered me and acknowledged that "we had come back" which was nice. I happened to strike up a conversation with the hostess as I am also in the food business and introduced myself as having been a neighborhood resident. She told me that her parents opened the business back in the 50's which I knew.  I can't remember her name but I will definitely be back when I'm in the city!

excerpts: The "light eater" burrito is the size of any gigantor 'rito from the Mission.
burrito.author: Sheri E.
burrito.review:
May Tia Margarita live forever. 

It's like the "Mexican" restaurants our parents took us to in the 70's. Heavy on the lard. Huge platters of food. Shredded lettuce everywhere. The "light eater" burrito is the size of any gigantor 'rito from the Mission.

And the Margaritas are delicious. Unfortunately, they don't do pitchers anymore. So make sure you get the double because you'll be wanting more.

excerpts: you get the stuff home only to find that there's refried beans in your "veggie burrito"!
they are pretty good about letting you check your food before you take it, so if you have any specific food wants and needs, be very sure you are getting what you ordered.
HOWEVER.
burrito.author: roz A.
burrito.review:
If you want a "grease infusion" as my mom calls it, this is definitely the place to go.  i have experienced tia margarita's in both sit-down and take out mode, and i must say i prefer take out. it can get hellishly crowded and noisy, especially near the weekends. some of the wait staff is awesome, others just errr....horrible. they have many vegetarian options, but their refried beans have lard in them so you have to be very careful if you do not eat meat or pork. i have had some difficulties in getting take out orders..mainly that the kitchen does not seem to pay attention to what the wait staff has put up on the order...you get the stuff home only to find that there's refried beans in your "veggie burrito"! they are pretty good about letting you check your food before you take it, so if you have any specific food wants and needs, be very sure you are getting what you ordered.
HOWEVER. they use the most excellent salty cheese (their quesadillas...orgasmic), their portions are ENORMOUS, their rice is amazing, their guacamole really excellent. they can cook up an entire meal and have it boxed and ready for you within 15 minutes, no joke. when i have a hankerin for this place, nothing else will satisfy the craving. i give it a 4 instead of a 5 for the kitchen take-out fuck ups and the high prices, but really, this place is take out heaven.

excerpts: Drive a little further and get a take out burrito from Gordos.
It won't be any better, but at least you won't feel used.
burrito.author: r b.
burrito.review: Tia's is in my hood, and as I love Mexican, I'm always on the look out for a one of those rare neighborhood golden nuggets that, despite the worn out 1970's decor, (and I mean that LITERALLY), nevertheless, has food worth the weird ambiance. I was wrong. This is the restaurant that time forgot. It reminds me of one of those musty smelling places my grandparents would drag me to, and since they had completely lost their sense of taste and smell, they were oblivious to the fact that their favorite hot spot had gotten as long in the tooth as they had.  (Ah memories.)   Drive a little further and get a take out burrito from Gordos. It won't be any better, but at least you won't feel used.

excerpts: We also had the burrito with carne asada.
We had a margarita (single shot) and we spent $35.
burrito.author: Brian L.
burrito.review: The food here can not be beat.  We had the quesadilla with carne asada which was so great.  The dough was like philo dough.  So good.  We also had the burrito with carne asada.  We had a margarita (single shot) and we spent $35.

excerpts: She wouldn't let my friend leave without bringing his burrito home
and she brought us ice cream with a candle in it to have with our cupcakes!

The food was exactly what you'd expect, huge servings of yummy mexican food and unlimited chips and salsa.

burrito.review: Just what you want for a fun, mexican restaurant.  I had a birthday gathering here and our waitress was this older woman who was all business.  She wouldn't let my friend leave without bringing his burrito home and she brought us ice cream with a candle in it to have with our cupcakes!  It was so sweet.  The food was exactly what you'd expect, huge servings of yummy mexican food and unlimited chips and salsa.

something to take home
, that's a good deal.
