burrito.review: mediocre mexican food for normal-semi expensive prices. you probably wont be blown away by the food here, but you wont leave saying you hated it. if you get the plate with the burrito and something else, you will get a full burrito and a meal. something to take home, that's a good deal. deal.

excerpts: We came here this last Sunday night at about 8 and I got the Combination plate with a relleno, a tamale, and a flauta.
It was a LOT of food.
Like literally three mails.
Honestly, their rice is not like spanish rice.
I really didn't like the rice.
It kinda seemed like frozen rice and not homemade.
Their refried beans were just OK, kinda tasted to me like they just heated up old beans.
But, they gave the option of black bean as well, which I appreciated.
flauta.author: William R.
flauta.review:
We came here this last Sunday night at about 8 and I got the Combination plate with a relleno, a tamale, and a flauta. It was a LOT of food. Like literally three mails. Honestly, their rice is not like spanish rice. I really didn't like the rice. It kinda seemed like frozen rice and not homemade. Their refried beans were just OK, kinda tasted to me like they just heated up old beans. But, they gave the option of black bean as well, which I appreciated. They were also conscious of our vegetarian diners, and were able to tell us that the rice was made in chicken broth, an important detail that we appreciated. 

All in all, service was slow, took a while, waiter was cool and laid back and got everything right, though.

We were seated immediately, but took 15 mins before we had waters or menus.

Reminiscent of Manuel's Mexican restaurant in Aptos.

excerpts: I ordered the chili relleno, cheese enchilada and chicken flauta.
The portions were huge and everything was absolutely perfect.
The service was quick and friendly too.
Tia Margarita was a random food find, but is a new favorite for us.
We will definitley be back soon!
flauta.author: Michelle A.
flauta.review: Came here with my hubby for dinner tonight and everything was delicious! I ordered a double margarita, it was delicious and strong! We ordered the sampler as an appetizer and both picked combination plates. I ordered the chili relleno, cheese enchilada and chicken flauta. The portions were huge and everything was absolutely perfect. The service was quick and friendly too. Tia Margarita was a random food find, but is a new favorite for us. We will definitley be back soon!

excerpts: My boyfriend liked his beef flauta.
The server, although nice, didn't come check on us at all and
it was right before the dinner rush
so it wasn't that busy yet.
The food was acceptable and filled us up, but we probably won't be going back.
flauta.author: Karissa Q.
flauta.review:
Definitely not authentic Mexican food by any means. I didn't expect much stopping in here during a bike ride considering it was in the Richmond, but we figured we would try it. The margaritas are strong, but not good. I got a chile relleno/taco combo. The relleno was not bad, it seemed fresh which is hard to come by since usually when I order one somewhere it's obviously been prepared ahead of time and microwaved. I would have liked it a lot more if it had Mexican cheese in it instead of jack. Chicken taco was fine. The rice is pretty terrible. It tastes like rice-a-roni or some other premade rice brand. My boyfriend liked his beef flauta.
The server, although nice, didn't come check on us at all and it was right before the dinner rush so it wasn't that busy yet. 
The food was acceptable and filled us up, but we probably won't be going back.

excerpts: The only thing I remember was my flauta, which was very crispy, the way they should be.
flauta.author: Sara K.
flauta.review:
When I walked into this place, I knew right away that I wouldn't like it. Having the bar at the front was a bit confusing, not to mention it reminded me of the Marina (ew, I feel dirty all of a sudden...). The hostess was nice, but she blended right in with the crowd at the bar! We were seated in the back in a very dimly lit room. I have terrific vision according to my eye check up, but I had a difficult time reading the menu. Finally, about half an hour later, the hostess turned the lights on to a brighter setting.

Oh yeah, half an hour after I sat down, I still had my menu. Well, at least I could read it now. Our waitress was an old lady who was moving very slowly. I commend her for still working at her age, but man... sometimes you just gotta know when to hang it up. At a busy, fast-paced restaurant, you need to be quick, not hard of hearing, and not forgetful. Let's face it... you have to be young. I'm not trying to sound harsh, but it's the truth. I know, she probably needs to work, etc. etc. etc. Fine. I'm not against old people working... just find another job, not waitressing at a busy restaurant.

Anyway, needless to say, she was really slow, we had to repeat our orders at least five times, and she continuously forgot to get us drinks. We got our chips right away from the bus boy, but never received any water. The bus boy was friendly and fast. We ended up just asking him for a lot of things. Perhaps the waitress thought it was beneath her to bring us water. It is, after all, a bus boy's job.

Onto the food... it was average. This is as whitewashed of a Mexican restaurant as it gets. The only thing I remember was my flauta, which was very crispy, the way they should be. The salsa was good, and the chips seemed fresh.

I guess if you like the Americanized sour cream drenched, cheese covered enchilada two/three item combos, then this is the place to go. I would think twice before going back.

excerpts: the combination plate (large) which i picked: enchilada, tamale & flauta was kind of a  let-down..it was the dry tamale that made my dining experience kaput.
flauta.author: Nelle A.
flauta.review:
it was a friday  night and the place was already swarming with customers waiting to be seated and drinking to their heart desires.
the first thing you will see here is the bar which is the main focal point at this restaurant.

so just like the others who were waiting for their table, i ordered myself a "one shot top shelf margarita." it was intense & worthy...whoa!..awesome!!!

we did not really waited that long and so funny man cesar called my name and lead us to their medium-sized dining area at the back.
i ordered a bottle of corona for myself again...and this time while waiting for the food.

the combination plate (large) which i picked: enchilada, tamale & flauta was kind of a  let-down..it was the dry tamale that made my dining experience kaput. the rest of the food was mediocre.

his plate of the chef's platter was worst than mine! the beef was chewy, the chicken was dry and the tiny shrimps was just ok...it was really garlicky.

i would say that this place will better off as a drinking establishment and serving just mex  appetizers...really!

excerpts: I finally ordered a combo of chicken tamale and a flauta.
While the flauta was decent, the tamale was surprisingly flavorless.
Surely not worth $13.
Though the lady serving us was very nice, I don't think I'll be coming back here again.
While the flauta was decent, the tamale was surprisingly flavorless.
Surely not worth $13.
Though the lady serving us was very nice, I don't think I'll be coming back here again.
flauta.author: Raymond P.
flauta.review: The best part of eating here was the red salsa that came with the chips. Extremely tasty and delightful. Other than that, Tia Margarita's was a let down. Our drink orders were taken immediately then for the next 15 minutes...nothing. No drinks, no water, no entree orders, nothing. I finally ordered a combo of chicken tamale and a flauta. While the flauta was decent, the tamale was surprisingly flavorless. Surely not worth $13. Though the lady serving us was very nice, I don't think I'll be coming back here again.

excerpts: Really good Flauta and the Margaritas are great!
A good spot to go with a few good friends.
Its not too expensive and you get a lot of free chips!
flauta.author: Gordon L.
flauta.review: WOW, this is some decently good Mexican food. Really good Flauta and the Margaritas are great! A good spot to go with a few good friends. Its not too expensive and you get a lot of free chips!

excerpts: If you must pick a particular item, I recommend the flauta.
It's huge and covered in sour cream and guacamole, not to mention that it's a deep fried flauta.
flauta.author: Dean A.
flauta.review:
Four stars, but three star food. It gets four stars because this place delivers what it promises -- classic over-Americanized Mexicanish food paired with cheap drinks.

Contrary to what others say, it doesn't matter what you order.  Everything you get will be smothered in cheese and taste vaguely of lard.  Besides, you'll be drunk by the time the food comes.  The food tastes good, but how could it not when it's smothered in cheese? If you must pick a particular item, I recommend the flauta.  It's huge and covered in sour cream and guacamole, not to mention that it's a deep fried flauta.

The drinks are awesome here.  The margaritas are great, like everyone says. It's not like that crud they serve you at Chevy's that is filled with crushed ice and no tequila.  However, the house wine is a cheaper option if you are a creep like me.  For $10.50, you get a liter of wine.  Drink it up.

Now, the service.  I almost dropped it down a star.  There's this one old lady waitress who's always there, and she sucks.  She moves slower than you can believe.  The real problem is that she is pure evil.  If you ask her a question that she doesn't want to answer, she ignores it. My friend literally asked "Do you have Carnitas?" five times before awkwardly giving up on getting an answer.  Strangely, however, she actually met our service needs.  I think the alcohol makes me less angry.

excerpts: they were rich in garlic, white wine, and butter and the outside enchilada sauce was to die for.
The tostada was a little plain, I knew I should
of gotten the shrimp tostada-
enchilada.author: Hayley D.
enchilada.review:
We came here around 4pm on a Sunday for an early dinner/late lunch. We were really in the mood for Mexican food and a friend mentioned that this place was good. 

Ambiance: Inside it was dim & clean. It looked super small when you walk in, but when we went to our table we saw how there was a lot more space toward the back of the restaurant. 

Service: Service was great here! We got seated right away- even though we came early. Chips were brought out immediately and waters as well. Our server was really nice and knew every thing about the menu- had a lot to suggest for vegetarian/ pescatarians.

Food: The food here was tasty and the plates were HUGE! We started with margaritas- they were pretty plain, but got the job done ;) They should put more lime juice in them for sure. I got a Tia Tostada with no meat and my boyfriend got enchiladas with shrimp for the filling. I tried a bite and the shrimp had such good flavor- they were rich in garlic, white wine, and butter and the outside enchilada sauce was to die for. The tostada was a little plain, I knew I should of gotten the shrimp tostada- NEXT TIME! 

For sure will be back! :) 4.5 stars!

excerpts: I ordered the Combination Plate 2 ($15.75) with Rellenos and Enchilada (Beef) and a side of refried beans, which I shared
enchilada.author: Nerissa C.
enchilada.review:
I don't know the last time I've been to an actual sit down/serviced mexican place but this was worth it. Usually I'm a hole in the wall kinda person but I came for the double margs. and conquered all the delicious food.

This is my friend's go-to for some refreshing top shelf double margaritas (OH BABY). Came on a Sunday in the afternoon after some soccer and a couple of beers. We ordered a round of double margs and the queso appetizer which were perfect. The salsa they bring out is great, the mild is sweet and good for anyone, the spicy is def. a kicker--if you like a little spice, just mix the two, otherwise stick with the milk. Queso was ooey gooey and warm--magic in a dish to start soaking up those beers from earlier!

I ordered the Combination Plate 2 ($15.75) with Rellenos and Enchilada (Beef) and a side of refried beans, which I shared so I could score half of the Carne Asada Quesadillas ($13.75). Everything was great! I didn't think you could beat the whole in the wall comfort food of all the mission places but for what it was, this was really good. My combination plate was perfect, 10/10 would get it again. The Quesadilla was a not my favorite, since the tortilla was like fried super crispy--I think I would've preferred it to be like the super quesadillas you can get on every corner in the mission, and the portion was pretty small for the price but I guess if you weigh in the sides, it's alright. Overall, the rest of the plates seems to go over well anda decent portions once you tap in the sides. 

This stuff hit the spot and I felt better after eating it all--especially with the previous beers, def. soaked up some of that potential drinking aftermath.

excerpts: so many years ago this place was my first chile relleno experience!), cheese enchilada (this wasn't my favorite item, because I'm not a fan of the flour tortilla and it was all I could taste.
enchilada.author: Fannie S.
enchilada.review:
I haven't been here in at least 9 years and glad to see that it's still around. Established in '63. 

Food = good.

Guacamole = delicious. It's not a large portion for the price but worth it. $5.75** (Some reason they did not charge us for it...must've been because they were busy?!)

Tacos Dorados = two tacos (he chose ground beef, but you can have chicken or shredded beef); comes with salad, rice and beans (black or refried). $14.50

Combination (large, 3 items) = I couldn't decide so I went with this one against my stomach's capacity. Chile relleno (excellent with a to-die-for tomato- based sauce; so many years ago this place was my first chile relleno experience!), cheese enchilada (this wasn't my favorite item, because I'm not a fan of the flour tortilla and it was all I could taste. The cheese is mild and creamy.), beef taco (crispy shell, soft shell upon request; excellent tasting ground beef (shredded available, too) topped with guacamole and salsa. $17.75

Coke = $2.00

Service = friendly and pretty fast once you get a seat. There was a 30-minute wait on a Friday night but not a surprise. They have a handwritten list that they keep track of and yes, you should wait outside, or wait at the bar with drink in hand. FYI: Host desk is inside past the bar, which is hard to see when it's as packed as it was last night. 

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Dinner for two came out to $37.21. Took home leftovers for another meal. 

Noise = boisterous. I don't recall ever being here when it was"quiet" unless it was somewhat empty, which doesn't last for long.

Overall, still a solid place for well-portioned platters, great margaritas & other drinks (didn't imbibe this time but it was prevalent throughout the dining area and the large bar area). And they still have a light eater menu.

excerpts: Everything is bland, from the salsas at the beginning to the chicken chile verde enchilada dish I ordered.
Plus the service stinks.
Don't waste your time here.
You're in San Francisco, go eat Mexican food at one of the many delicious restaurants around the city.
enchilada.author: Adriana G.
enchilada.review: Sitting here trying to think about my favorite part of this meal... Unfortunately, I can't come up with anything. This is probably the worst Mexican food I've ever had. Everything is bland, from the salsas at the beginning to the chicken chile verde enchilada dish I ordered. Plus the service stinks. Don't waste your time here. You're in San Francisco, go eat Mexican food at one of the many delicious restaurants around the city.

excerpts: The cheese enchiladas were stuffed thick with some foreign kind of salty cheese then smothered with some orange-colored paste (their enchilada sauce).
(Sent it back for another cheese enchilada -- big mistake!)
enchilada.author: Larry H.
enchilada.review: What's wrong with the food at Tia Margarita's?  It's SLOP, not fit for a trough!  Typical Mexican restaurant microwaved soup (refried beans), tasteless rice, and some shredded lettuce.  The cheese enchiladas were stuffed thick with some foreign kind of salty cheese then smothered with some orange-colored paste (their enchilada sauce).  My tamale was a gigantic, cold lump of off-colored corn meal about 2-3 inches thick and I could barely find the meat.  (Sent it back for another cheese enchilada -- big mistake!)  The tamale had its own horrible sauce, too.  I can't describe what they called a chile relleno --some greasy, soggy pancake that had a chile in it somewhere.  Horrible!  About an hour after eating, I was so bloated -- like I swallowed a salt lick -- it was unbelievable.  I suffered from severe gas all night long and the next morning, then suffered from constipation for the next full day.  The margaritas were delicious, however.  Go there (if you can ever find a parking place) only for a couple margaritas, friendly bartenders, and some chips and salsa but pass on any food!

excerpts: I had a small combo plate of shredded chicken enchilada and chile relleno which came with yummy refried beans, rice and that shredded iceberg lettuce that no one ever eats.
enchilada.author: Ada C.
enchilada.review:
If you are looking for that old school Mexican American restaurant that serves enchiladas smothered in sauce and cheese on a heated plate, this is it.  Tia Margarita reminded me of the Mexican food I grew up with. I have no idea if it's authentic but who cares. It tastes good and the margaritas are top notch!

I had a small combo plate of shredded chicken enchilada and chile relleno which came with yummy refried beans, rice and that shredded iceberg lettuce that no one ever eats. Very tasty and totally hit the spot. 

Definitely worth stopping by if you are in the area!

excerpts:
Review on: combination plate which consisted of cheese enchilada, chicken taco, rice & black beans. 

The chicken in my "Taco Bell" shell it came in, was super dry and needed salt. 
The enchilada sauce was nothing special. 
Plus, the tortilla was still semi hard.
Rice was good.
enchilada.author: Worldwide ..
enchilada.review:
Review on: combination plate which consisted of cheese enchilada, chicken taco, rice & black beans. 

1.) The chicken in my "Taco Bell" shell it came in, was super dry and needed salt. 
2.) The enchilada sauce was nothing special. Plus, the tortilla was still semi hard.
3.) Rice was good.
4.) Black beans were okayish.

On the plus side, they do give you a nice big serving, on a huge plate. My food LOOKED good but unfortunately was not. 

I really want to give this restaurant another chance and perhaps order something else. But from experience, it seems as though, if this restaurant can't even get the most basic dishes taste good, what makes me think that their other dishes would be any better.

excerpts: Combo plate: chile relleno, taco and enchilada.
All three were above average.
Refried beans and rice were great.
This place might not win a Michelin star but I'd definitely come back and am very happy it is close to my neighborhood.
enchilada.author: D B.
enchilada.review: For what it is, this place is awesome.   The atmosphere was lively and fun.   Chips and salsa to start.   Habanero salsa is delicious.   Combo plate: chile relleno, taco and enchilada.  All three were above average.  Refried beans and rice were great.   This place might not win a Michelin star but I'd definitely come back and am very happy it is close to my neighborhood.

excerpts: I ordered the chili relleno, cheese enchilada and chicken flauta.
The portions were huge and everything was absolutely perfect.
The service was quick and friendly too.
Tia Margarita was a random food find, but is a new favorite for us.
We will definitley be back soon!
enchilada.author: Michelle A.
enchilada.review: Came here with my hubby for dinner tonight and everything was delicious! I ordered a double margarita, it was delicious and strong! We ordered the sampler as an appetizer and both picked combination plates. I ordered the chili relleno, cheese enchilada and chicken flauta. The portions were huge and everything was absolutely perfect. The service was quick and friendly too. Tia Margarita was a random food find, but is a new favorite for us. We will definitley be back soon!

excerpts: I'm more partial to the quesdilla myself, though the gf prefers the enchilada.
What really impressed me was the service.
Almost the moment I finished the salsa they replaced the salsa and refilled the chips
(chips and salsa are complementary btw).
That's really what prompted this review was that simple little event.
My only complaint is there is a split entree charge so just be aware of that.
All in all, I was impressed considering I eat mexican food once a year at most lol
enchilada.author: Wil S.
enchilada.review: My girlfriend always passed this place and thought this was the "poppin'" place to be! Me not being a huge fan of Mexican food I was a bit hesitant but we went and at first I thought, "okay fine..." I was pleasantly surprised. I would recommend the quesdilla and the enchiladas. I'm more partial to the quesdilla myself, though the gf prefers the enchilada. What really impressed me was the service. Almost the moment I finished the salsa they replaced the salsa and refilled the chips  (chips and salsa are complementary btw). That's really what prompted this review was that simple little event. My only complaint is there is a split entree charge so just be aware of that. All in all, I was impressed considering I eat mexican food once a year at most lol

excerpts: I ordered the "light eater" plate - MUCH smaller than those huge combo plates - one chicken enchilada with red sauce (no cheese or sour cream) which came with black beans, rice, and salad.
It was the perfect portion and didn't make me sick!
Yay!
I also had to watch myself with their tasty chips and salsa; very easy to go overboard with those.
My boyfriend, card-carrying member of the clean plate club, wolfed down his carne asada enchilada combo plate in no time.
enchilada.author: Liz G.
enchilada.review:
We have come back a few times since the bad experience previously and have had better service. We walked in around 8:30pm on a Friday and it was busy as usual! The hostess said 30 minute wait, totally understandable. So we ordered drinks at the bar with Francisco before our table was ready. The hostess really stepped up her game (or the people ahead of us walked out) because a table was freed up in the bar after about 10 minutes.

I had gallbladder surgery recently and was worried if I'd be able to find anything to stomach on the menu. I ordered the "light eater" plate - MUCH smaller than those huge combo plates - one chicken enchilada with red sauce (no cheese or sour cream) which came with black beans, rice, and salad. It was the perfect portion and didn't make me sick! Yay! I also had to watch myself with their tasty chips and salsa; very easy to go overboard with those. Everything tasted fresh and flavorful. 

My boyfriend, card-carrying member of the clean plate club, wolfed down his carne asada enchilada combo plate in no time. My friend really enjoyed her shredded beef chimichanga combo plate too. Full bellies and content tastebuds all around.

excerpts: Ordered Chicken Enchilada and chef's special combo plate.
Good for 2 sharing.
enchilada.author: Unyo N.
enchilada.review: Good place for Mexican food. Casual and Not too fancy place for friends and family. Food quality good and helpful staff. Ordered Chicken Enchilada and chef's special combo plate. Good for 2 sharing.

excerpts: The plate also came with a carne Asada burrito, a chicken enchilada, and a tamale.
All of the food was very tasty and very filling.
enchilada.author: Tony N.
enchilada.review:
Came here with a few friends about an hour before closing. Seated very quickly. We sat in the room with the bar and were able to watch the Giants game while we ate. 

I ordered a house margarita on the rocks and it was really good. The pictures on yelp of the margarita are accurate. 

I ordered the Combination Plate (Large). This plate came with a Chile Relleno that is possibly the best I have ever had, highly recommended. The plate also came with a carne Asada burrito, a chicken enchilada, and a tamale. All of the food was very tasty and very filling. So much so, had to take some of it home for breakfast in the morning. 

The service was good. We had a waiter that took out orders and was prompt with everything we needed and the hostess kinda backed him up and made sure when he was busy at other tables, we were taken cared of. 

If you like good quality food and great service I would recommend this place. I'm sure I'll be back again to visit soon.

excerpts: My wife had the combo of a taco and enchilada and was also excellent.
The service was great, one guy was really friendly, he looked like John Travolta as he looked in the movies Swordfish and Pulp Fiction.
He even shook my hand before we left.
Great guy !
Just dont fill up on the chips - as you near the end of one bowl of chips
another will wind up on your table.
You can easily fill up on the chips so be careful, or like us, you will be bloated and simply float home.
A little green tea will help the digestion !

Great food
Great service
Great atmosphere
We will return !!
Although I will probably not eat anything on the day we go..
enchilada.author: David S.
enchilada.review:
Dont fill up on the tortilla chips as the portions here will blow your mind. My wife and I decided to give it a try. Actually it was MY idea. I pat myself on the back.  When we entered, we had no idea where to go or wait to be seated, as it wasnt clear which way to walk. After being a little confused about where to go once inside, we got a nice table away from the bar. Yes its a bar and grill kind of a place, it was very lively and had a party like atmosphere. It was pretty noisy, but it was fun. Well it is a bar after all, not a public library. The food to me was excellent, possibly the best Mexican food Ive ever eaten. I had the Chimichonga which was just out of this world delicious, fresh, hot food, with rice and beans on a huge plate. Certainly NOT greasy. My wife had the combo of a taco and enchilada and was also excellent. The service was great, one guy was really friendly, he looked like John Travolta as he looked in the movies Swordfish and Pulp Fiction. He even shook my hand before we left. Great guy ! 
Just dont fill up on the chips - as you near the end of one bowl of chips another will wind up on your table. You can easily fill up on the chips so be careful, or like us, you will be bloated and simply float home. A little green tea will help the digestion !
Great food
Great service
Great atmosphere
We will return !! Although I will probably not eat anything on the day we go..

excerpts: Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered.
Wasn't a huge fun.
Overall experience was great
and I would def go back to try some more items.
Oh also the alcohol is strong.
Yum.
Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!!
Haha!!
enchilada.author: Mandi K.
enchilada.review:
I have to say that this place was a bit surprising! They must be a popular joint because the restaurant got pretty crowded very quickly. At first when you walk in all you see is the bar, it literally takes up most of the room and there are a few booths that surround the line the rest of the place. Also has a weird musty smell to it when you walk in. ( they need to air this place more often) now the servers and everyone are friendly and quite attentive. The decor is pretty old and I noticed duct tape to patch up certain parts of the furniture. 
     Now for the food! They start you off with the chips and two kinds of salsa. One was spicy and one mild and I have to say the mild seemed like ketchup with bits of tomato and onion to make it seem like salsa. However the spicy salsa was on point! Next the food, HUGE portions. Def worth the price of what you are getting. Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered. Wasn't a huge fun. Overall experience was great and I would def go back to try some more items. Oh also the alcohol is strong. Yum. Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!! Haha!!

excerpts: I ordered the combination plate with a chicken enchilada, chili relleno, and a beef taco.
The food was served hot, however for me there could have been more chicken in the enchilada, more beef in the taco, and more cheese in the chili relleno.
Furthermore, the relleno was mostly batter.
The food was served hot, however for me there could have been more chicken in the enchilada, more beef in the taco, and more cheese in the chili relleno.
Furthermore, the relleno was mostly batter.
The sauce on the enchilada did not have much flavor.
Have had much better in the Mission, and elsewhere.
enchilada.author: Robin A.
enchilada.review:
I was craving a chili relleno, and wanted to try some place new. So I plugged in the keyword Chili Relleno," and the location parameters of Inner/Outer Sunset/Richmond. This place came up with 4.5 stars.  After reading what other yelpers had to say, I decided to give this place a try.   One of the reviewer's makes indicates lack of attention to incoming patrons.  There was no host/hostess podium at the entrance.  I waited for a couple of minutes before communicating to the bartender that I'd like of be seated for dinner.  He pointed to a podium situated at the other end of the room.  There was no on standing there.  I made my way there, and was eventually seated by the hostess.

The ambiance is very dark, and did nothing for me.  I ordered the combination plate with a chicken enchilada, chili relleno, and a beef taco.  The food was served hot, however for me there could have been more chicken in the enchilada, more beef in the taco, and more cheese in the chili relleno.  Furthermore, the relleno was mostly batter.  The sauce on the enchilada did not have much flavor.  Have had much better in the Mission, and elsewhere.

excerpts:
We split an enchilada verde bit dull
Way to much sour creme to me

Next time in the area
enchilada.author: Michael F.
enchilada.review:
Went last night. 
Place is not really high on my scale
Margarita not bad have had far better.
We split an enchilada verde bit dull
Way to much sour creme to me

Next time in the area it's Tommy's again.

excerpts: A enchilada plate for me, drinks, guacamole and chips.
Because my kids split the carne asada they charged me extra!
What!
Rude and slow service.
Never going back.
enchilada.author: Michelle Z.
enchilada.review: Went there with my two children 9 and 11. Ordered a carne asada plate, which was $20 bucks for my children to share! A enchilada plate for me, drinks, guacamole and chips. Because my kids split the carne asada they charged me extra! What! Rude and slow service. Never going back.

excerpts: I guess if you like the Americanized sour cream drenched, cheese covered enchilada two/three item combos, then this is the place to go.
I would think twice before going back.
enchilada.author: Sara K.
enchilada.review:
When I walked into this place, I knew right away that I wouldn't like it. Having the bar at the front was a bit confusing, not to mention it reminded me of the Marina (ew, I feel dirty all of a sudden...). The hostess was nice, but she blended right in with the crowd at the bar! We were seated in the back in a very dimly lit room. I have terrific vision according to my eye check up, but I had a difficult time reading the menu. Finally, about half an hour later, the hostess turned the lights on to a brighter setting.

Oh yeah, half an hour after I sat down, I still had my menu. Well, at least I could read it now. Our waitress was an old lady who was moving very slowly. I commend her for still working at her age, but man... sometimes you just gotta know when to hang it up. At a busy, fast-paced restaurant, you need to be quick, not hard of hearing, and not forgetful. Let's face it... you have to be young. I'm not trying to sound harsh, but it's the truth. I know, she probably needs to work, etc. etc. etc. Fine. I'm not against old people working... just find another job, not waitressing at a busy restaurant.

Anyway, needless to say, she was really slow, we had to repeat our orders at least five times, and she continuously forgot to get us drinks. We got our chips right away from the bus boy, but never received any water. The bus boy was friendly and fast. We ended up just asking him for a lot of things. Perhaps the waitress thought it was beneath her to bring us water. It is, after all, a bus boy's job.

Onto the food... it was average. This is as whitewashed of a Mexican restaurant as it gets. The only thing I remember was my flauta, which was very crispy, the way they should be. The salsa was good, and the chips seemed fresh.

I guess if you like the Americanized sour cream drenched, cheese covered enchilada two/three item combos, then this is the place to go. I would think twice before going back.

excerpts: I ordered the enchilada and it was very good.
My boyfriend ordered the fajitas and had to ask for tortillas even though they came with the meal.
All in all the food was very good, but the ambience was very uninviting, probably will not return.
enchilada.author: K T.
enchilada.review: From walking in on people (owners?) yelling at one another in the doorway to having the waitress awkwardly stare us down our dining experience was not off to a good start. We were seated in the bar area and waited quite awhile before a friendly waiter came and took our order. He was prompt in getting our drink order but, kind of forgot about us when it came to our food and chips and salsa. It was pretty noisy and it was obvious that this is a locals spot and wish the staff was more friendly. Our food arrived hot and smelled amazing! I ordered the enchilada and it was very good. My boyfriend ordered the fajitas and had to ask for tortillas even though they came with the meal. All in all the food was very good, but the ambience was very uninviting, probably will not return.

excerpts: We were treated rudely by the bartender, the food was both too salty (beans and margaritas (seriously, it got in the drinks, not just the rim, bleh)) and too bland (chicken enchilada), and I think their tamales are made with wallpaper paste (couldn't get through two bites).
Ugh.
enchilada.author: Marie J.
enchilada.review:
Well, the decor was alright.  
We were treated rudely by the bartender, the food was both too salty (beans and margaritas (seriously, it got in the drinks, not just the rim, bleh)) and too bland (chicken enchilada), and I think their tamales are made with wallpaper paste (couldn't get through two bites). Ugh.

excerpts: My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).
It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff
and it's only around $15.
Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.
enchilada.author: dave g.
enchilada.review:
Tia's Rocks!
I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet because I've eaten here at least 10 times.  I've been with friends, family, co-workers, everyone loves this place.  First thing you need to know is that the food is TASTY!  We've probably gone thru everything on the menu at this point and have never been disappointed.   It's one of our favorite places to eat in the city.

The portions are HUGE!  My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).  It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff and it's only around $15.  Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.  Rockin'!  

My buddy ordered a small combination plate and that came with TWO burritos!  Nice.  I read where some people were bitching about the prices, but, the food you get will feed an army.

Next, the Margaritas are great.  We had a group of 5 there tonight and everyone commented on how tasty they were.  I read a few reviews where people felt they were watered down, but I've never thought that once in all the Margaritas I've had there over the years.  In fact, sometimes I thought they were TOO strong.  (I mean, it can't really ever be TOO strong, but, ya know what I mean). 

The wait staff there is great.  We had chips and salsa on our table within moments of being seated.  They're quick to fill back up your water, they're generous with the chips and salsa and constantly come around to make sure you have everything you need.  After years of going, I finally introduced myself to the same waitress who has waited on us so many times.  Her name is Rosa and she's awesome.  She's got a great sense of humor and we love joking around with her.  I already can't wait to go back....

excerpts: the enchilada wasn't extra cheesy like good ol' tex mex
but i also didn't hear my friend rave about that, either.
she left the tamales alone
enchilada.author: Vicki T.
enchilada.review:
if you're looking for some mexican restaurant that'll do the trick without having to go to the mission and wrestle with parking, this would be the place. portions are large so please consider sharing an order. service was good with our waiter, an older gentleman, being pretty attentive and was very detailed about setting up the placing for the other table even though it was just a cloth napkin and silverware... he's trying. 

had the chips and salsa that's complementary -- good chips, nice and thin like restaurant tortilla chips should be! (not thick and hard); their spicy salsa has a kick and their non-spicy is good. i mixed my eating with 1 bite of spicy with 4 bites of non-spicy. i'd advise you do the same!

my friend's margarita (upgraded to patron) was very strong (per friend's account.) my water was just fine. never empty.

i got my some steak fajitas and they were a-ok. i'm used to tex-mex with the iron cast skillet being brought out and my fajita sizzling. their flour tortillas are good -- thin, chewy, the way it should be. guar was pretty good. didn't skimp out on my pico or my lettuce or my sour cream. :D :D :D i love my onions and bell peppers that were with my meat. 

my friend raves about the rice and beans. i thought they were good, as well. friend had the crispy tacos and initially gave it the stinkeye with its questionable red sauce but then she really liked it... the enchilada wasn't extra cheesy like good ol' tex mex but i also didn't hear my friend rave about that, either. she left the tamales alone so i'm not certain if she didn't care for them or just couldn't make it around to it.

we felt pretty crappy after that meal. neither of us finished and it was a mistake to over-indulge. obviously this has nothing to do with the quality of the food or the service but just a warning to all that you may suffer this fate should you indulge here like we did.

excerpts: We ended up ordering a 3-item combo plate to share: chile relleno, shrimp enchilada, and a shrimp taco...delish!
I seriously am punching myself for not having gone there before last night!!
The missing star is due to beef, chicken, and shrimp being the only options...
i love al pastor!
boohoo!
Despite that,  I will be returning again soon!
enchilada.author: Laura M.
enchilada.review:
I have lived 3 blocks away from this restaurant for over a year and last night was my first AMAZING experience at tia margaritas!!  
  my friend and i sat at the bar and immediately ordered chips, salsa y guacamole to accompany our margaritas.  Not only was the bartender top notch in the entertainment department, he mixed up some fine house margaritas!  
We ended up ordering a 3-item combo plate to share: chile relleno, shrimp enchilada, and a shrimp taco...delish!  
  I seriously am punching myself for not having gone there before last night!! The missing star is due to beef, chicken, and shrimp being the only options... i love al pastor! boohoo!  Despite that,  I will be returning again soon!

excerpts: The only thing is, if you don't like onions, make sure you let them know because my Tia enchilada was very yummy, but had a lot of onions, which, even for this onion loving girl was pretty strong.
enchilada.author: Kathy K.
enchilada.review:
I was fortunate to be taken to this place a couple of days ago and I have to say that the food was pretty decent. For a more authentic taste that doesn't require you to head over to the Mission, I say Tia's hits the spot.
The portions were BIG and the refried beans and rice very good.
The only thing is, if you don't like onions, make sure you let them know because my Tia enchilada was very yummy, but had a lot of onions, which, even for this onion loving girl was pretty strong.
The classic margarita was strong and tasty and the chips and salsa spicy, like I want it.

The atmosphere was nice and cozy and the service attentive.

I will definitely go back.

excerpts: I love the special enchilada.. very cheesy and delicious.
Plus, they're always showing the Giants games in the bar.
If you haven't been here and you love Tex-Mex, you MUST try it out!
You won't be disappointed.
enchilada.author: Turi M.
enchilada.review: I lived in Texas for 4 years and became a Tex-Mex snob. It took me 3 years of living in San Francisco to find this place and now I won't go anywhere else! I LOVE Tia Margarita's. Their margaritas are as fresh as can be- they squeeze the limes before your eyes. NO MIX is used, therefore there's no gross, sweet taste. My husband even likes them and he's not a margarita fan. The food is great as well. I love the special enchilada.. very cheesy and delicious. Plus, they're always showing the Giants games in the bar. If you haven't been here and you love Tex-Mex, you MUST try it out! You won't be disappointed.

excerpts: The waitress was an enchilada Nazi.
As soon as we sat down she asked us for our order, I asked for a minute, she counted out loud "1, 2, 3, 4... your minute is up," and proceeded to stare at me expectantly.
enchilada.author: Taylor E.
enchilada.review:
Don't get me wrong... I love all Mexican food. Throw something hot and cheesy in front of me and I will eat it.

It is, however, because of my deep love of Mexican food, that I am forced to be somewhat more critical of the establishments in which I choose to dine. My waistline, after all, does not authorize them all admittance to my elite list of regulars.

Why Tia's, sadly, will not be making the cut:

* Poor UI. Booth seating aligns the "U" of the bar - no problem there - but the hostess desk is located at the very far corner of said "U". Not at all convenient and very confusing for first timers.

* The chips were stale. Setting the mood with stale chips is not a well thought out move on your part Tia. The chip portion of the meal should be an easy A!

* The waitress was an enchilada Nazi. As soon as we sat down she asked us for our order, I asked for a minute, she counted out loud "1, 2, 3, 4... your minute is up," and proceeded to stare at me expectantly. She was 30% kidding, at most. 

* Tia's strategy seems to focus on quantity versus quality. While the food is only mediocre, you get a shit ton of it for the price. For $12 a pop, our plates were so large I had to ask that the stale chips be taken away to make room for our margaritas!

Also - this is a side note - what is up with every sit down Mexican restaurant in the Sunset being closed on Mondays? Did some secret council convene and decide to torture us by making our favorite comfort food unavailable on the hardest day of the week? This includes Tia Margaritas, Celia's, and Tommy's! Come on guys ...have a heart and rotate your days off as to not leave your loyal patrons without their Monday margs. Don't make me go to Chevy's.

The enchilada sauce was nothing speciall
but they do hook you up with the cheese.
As for the chile relleno - if you have ever had a one from Jimboys it tastes EXACTLY like a Jimboys chile relleno.

Ordered a chile relleno and cheese enchilada combo. The enchilada sauce was nothing speciall but they do hook you up with the cheese. As for the chile relleno - if you have ever had a one from Jimboys it tastes EXACTLY like a Jimboys chile relleno. Dont get me wrong, I liked it. But, knowing I could spend half the price for a similar meal kinda rubs me the wrong way. For me the best part was the rice. I dont know what they do to it but I really liked it and it wasnt even in the style of spanish rice. 

In their defense, I came here with a group of about 15 and most of the people I was with liked their food. They really raved about the Flautas in particular. The margaritas are pretty good too.

excerpts: this review is solely for the chicken enchilada plate, which is what i get here every time.
it comes on a huge plate so that it seems like you're getting a lot, but all the food items are pretty spread out.
i still leave pretty full though!

enchilada.review: this review is solely for the chicken enchilada plate, which is what i get here every time. it comes on a huge plate so that it seems like you're getting a lot, but all the food items are pretty spread out. i still leave pretty full though! it comes with two enchiladas covered in melted cheese, rice, beans, and a salsa salad. i like everything! and i like how this is a neighborhood mexican restaurant that has survived for over fifty years! oh, and their complimentary chips and homemade salsa are also really good, we always ask for seconds (sometimes thirds).

excerpts: The enchilada sauce completely lacked any flavor and the plate was below mediocre.
enchilada.author: Rajeev R.
enchilada.review:
My wife and I decided to try this place out last night...on our hunt for a good Mexican sit down restaraunt.  We were a little wary after reading the reviews on Yelp, but decided to give it a shot.  Not the best idea.

Our waitress was very nice, but really did not explain any of the dishes to us.  We are both vegetarian and it took literally 5 minutes to explain that to her...most of the time we just got a blank stare.  Finally after ordering 2  cheese enchiladas, she walks away and says, 'sounds good...2 CHICKEN enchiladas'!!!  WTF!!!  I ran down and corrected the order and she just laughed it off.

The food arrives pretty quickly and was not very good at all.  The portions were very large, but there seemed to be no flavor in our food.  The enchilada sauce completely lacked any flavor and the plate was below mediocre.  The salsa tasted like spaghetti sauce.

Overall, would not recommend this place to anyone.

I didn't love the margarita, it was okay.

First they were out of tamales, so i ordered an enchilada. I didn't realize that you could screw up an enchilada but apparently you can. I didn't love the margarita, it was okay. Nothing to write home about. 

Skip it.

excerpts: I really enjoyed their special enchiladas and my 5-year-old asked for seconds on her kids cheese enchilada plate.
Husband says his spicy chicken salad was excellent too.

enchilada.author: Marcie M.
enchilada.review: Fun place to have dinner with the family on a Friday night! Great atmosphere and energy. Nice bar and yummy top shelf margaritas at a decent price. Food was solid. I really enjoyed their special enchiladas and my 5-year-old asked for seconds on her kids cheese enchilada plate. Husband says his spicy chicken salad was excellent too. I can see us frequenting this place for years to come:)

excerpts: his relleno, his taco, my tamale and my enchilada.
I fear though that what they splurge on meats, they cut cost in spices-everything was BLAND.
enchilada.author: Sachi T.
enchilada.review:
Let me clarify: this place gets 1 star only because I can't give it zero.

Also, if you want my review in short, here it is: Mexican food for Gringos. Service is for those who enjoy watching a four-year-old tie his shoe.


Aside from the hostess practically leaving us in the dust to show us our table, our next first impression was our server asking us for our beverage order, then walking off before we could say anything...the fuck?

He got a margarita, I got a coke. The margarita was your basic margarita, nothing special. The coke was basically soda water with a splash of syrup. I didn't even know you could screw coca-cola up.

The chips were too thick for my taste, and the salsa basically reminded me of Pace Picante. 

After finishing my water with a splash of coke and my actual water, I watched our server pass our table four times before we had to ask a busser for a refill. (Apparently, they also don't do refills on soda, even though their soda comes from the bar, at the well. Cheapskates.) After finally getting her attention, she leaves our table, and elbow checks my boyfriend in the shoulder. We gave her the benefit of the doubt, that she's old and fat and maybe just lost her balance. There's no way she did that on purpose, right? I mean, seriously, right?

The ONLY redeeming quality to the food was that everything was stuffed to the max...his relleno, his taco, my tamale and my enchilada. I fear though that what they splurge on meats, they cut cost in spices-everything was BLAND. Also, the refried beans were sweet (fucking WEIRD), and I'm pretty sure they were using Uncle Ben's rice.

After we watched her screw up the next table's order, we tried asking for our check, eager to leave the stagnant memory of this shithole behind us as soon as possible. Our server motioned to us that she was going to take someone else's order first, then check us out. You bitch.

Sensing our annoyance, she cut them off in the middle of their order to tally our tab, then, when my boyfriend quickly handed her his card, she had the gall to say, "You sure? I mean, I'm human, I make mistakes." Gee, really?

After contemplating what sort of paltry amount we should leave her for a tip (if anything at all), the hostess comes over, shoves his card back in his face, and goes, "We need a new one." Uh, no bitch, what you need is a new fucking attitude.

We left that old lady no tip. If she is in fact the owner, she should put her happy ass back in the office, because as a server, she fucking blows.

I will not be returning to this pathetic excuse for traditional Mexican fare, and I will most definitely be referring people to other places.

I have never been disappointed by Mexican food (unless I go to Chevy's), but I guess there's a first for everything. 

Bottom line: This place is absolutely mediocre, and the only reason people continue to go back is because the only other option for our neighborhood is Tommy's.

excerpts: and I always get the same thing - enchilada, taco and burrito.
(I have been getting this since I was 10 years old.  :-)
enchilada.author: Sean O.
enchilada.review:
Okay, I admit I am being super generous with the five stars, but for me Tia Margarita is pure comfort food.  It reminds me of the Mexican restaurants we would get to go to growing up in the suburbs of Southern California.  I always get a combination plate and I always get the same thing - enchilada, taco and burrito.  (I have been getting this since I was 10 years old.  :-)  The plates here are huge, so I always end up taking half of it home.

Another reason I give this place five stars is that we always go with our friends that live near there and it's always a treat to see them.  They, like my partner, grew up in the city and this is a place they have gone to for years.  

So, what I am saying is that there are five very personal stars but well deserved.

excerpts: So naturally I was thrilled to get a taco/enchilada combination with a whole lotta beans and rice on quite possibly the largest plate I've ever eaten on in my life.
As D said, the size of a Toyota Corolla tire.
The enchilada was pretty good if the taco was somewhat lackluster, and D was happy with his scrambled eggs with chorizo.

enchilada.author: Tanya N.
enchilada.review:
I've been eating with such a hungry vengeance for the past couple of days that I've half wondered if I have a tater tot in the oven.  Which would be somewhat worrisome if I could stop shoveling food into my mouth long enough to have a bout of serious contemplation.  Although I suppose the fact that it's my womyn/red tent/moon time sort of rules out potential anklebiters for the present.  And also explains why I'm starving.

So, I picked up D from work and was all, "BEANS.  NOW."  All I knew was I needed some big plate of perhaps not wholly authentic Mexican food with some cheesy beans and rice, and luck would have it that we went to Tia Margarita.

Here's the thing about me: I love the real slim shady when it comes to Mexican food, but I also have an abiding love for a tasty semi-whitey approximation of Mexican food.  So naturally I was thrilled to get a taco/enchilada combination with a whole lotta beans and rice on quite possibly the largest plate I've ever eaten on in my life.  As D said, the size of a Toyota Corolla tire.  The enchilada was pretty good if the taco was somewhat lackluster, and D was happy with his scrambled eggs with chorizo.

I had one of their fabled margaritas which I think in multiples would be  happy drunkies in a glass, and the salsa was worthwhile as well: the mild version, if a little too mild for my taste, was still quite good, and I liked that you could taste the flavor of the peppers themselves in the spicy salsa.  It's quite comfy inside Tia Margarita, and as I was trying to figure out what exactly the vibe was, D stopped grazing and pronounced solemnly, "it's like we're not in San Francisco."  Which I don't think was a slam against Tia Margarita or SF - it was a place where we could relax and shovel some good eats into our hungry mouths.

Everything else, from the bland, greasy, unsalted chips, to the boring red salsa, to the ick enchilada plate -- I seriously do not know what they are thinking.  Friendships are based on trust, and I am seriously re-evaluating these relationships.  If you can't ID mediocre-at-best Mex food, then what are you good for?

excerpts: I opted for the veggie enchilada which was basically cheese and and a salad on the side.
The food was very bland.
It lacked the flavors that I am used to having when I go to other Mexican restaurants.
Having lived int the Richmond District for many years, we've always dined at Tommy's and really loved it.
My husband ordered the chicken Tacos combination, and he said his was bland as well.
I tried the rice and the beans and once again no big flavors.
enchilada.author: Arlene D.
enchilada.review:
I really wanted to like this place when my husband and I dined here on Friday night.  We walked in and the place was packed, and we stood at the door hoping that someone would at least acknowledged us, but after about 3 minutes, we decided to walk towards the back and try to seat ourselves. This is when we saw the lady(not very friendly) and we said 2 for dinner, and she said this way, and we hurried behind her to this dark dining room. I am not a fan of dark dining rooms. I love to be able to see outside, or at least see some day light. 

Being a vegetarian, it was difficult to find an item on the menu, so  I opted for the veggie enchilada which was basically cheese and and a salad on the side. The food was very bland. It lacked the flavors that I am used to having when I go to other Mexican restaurants. Having lived int the Richmond District for many years, we've always dined at Tommy's and really loved it. My husband ordered the chicken Tacos combination, and he said his was bland as well. I tried the rice and the beans and once again no big flavors.  The service was excellent once we were seated even though they were crowded. 

I am not sure if we will be going back to Tia's any time soon.  The three stars is for the service. I'd probably give the food a 1 or 2 stars, and the lady that took us to our table a 1 star.

excerpts: We got the burrito, the relleno, and the enchilada.
The burrito was...
okay.
The chicken inside wasn't great.
but it was huge with a lot of spices.
The Relleno was a little lacking though.
We tend to associate rellenos as being very flavorful, and this in all honesty was one of the duller tasting ones we have had.
The weakest part of the meal was the enchilada.
It tasted kind of the like the ones you would find in a TV dinner... not in terms of being reheated, but the ingredients tasted identical.
enchilada.author: Sami R.
enchilada.review:
We were craving Mexican food, and picked this area on a random inclination. We opted for this over the better reviewed Tommy's due to the fact that Tia's actually lists their prices online (who doesn't do that?).

In terms of this place it was... okay. It tends to favor quantity over quality, which might appeal to someone that is super hungry... but we tend to prefer it in reverse order. The portions here are very big though, especially for the price. A single entry was more than enough to keep this couple filled, while the chips and salsa kept coming before hand (without us having to ask for it, which was a plus).

The downside was the food itself. To be fair, the female component of this review team is very tough when it comes to Mexican food (a byproduct of a parent who cooks yummy Mexican dishes), so lacking food of the Mexican variety tends to be less tolerated. On the night we went, we ordered the large platter with three different options so as best to sample everything. We got the burrito, the relleno, and the enchilada. The burrito was... okay. The chicken inside wasn't great. but it was huge with a lot of spices. The Relleno was a little lacking though. We tend to associate rellenos as being very flavorful, and this in all honesty was one of the duller tasting ones we have had. The weakest part of the meal was the enchilada. It tasted kind of the like the ones you would find in a TV dinner... not in terms of being reheated, but the ingredients tasted identical. Oh, also we were distraught with the rice, which was simply buttery instead of Spanish.

Overall, the place probably deserves a 2.5, as we have been to far worse locations that have been given a two, but its not quite high enough to earn that three.

enchilada.author: Heather S.
enchilada.review:
Sooooo amazing and suchhhhhh a great deal! You don't have to travel to the Mission or go as far as San Diego for some authentic Mexican food. Not diet friendly! One meal can easily suffice as two especially after diving into refillable chips and salsa. They usually provide you with two types of salsa and don't distinguish between the two, so spicy sensitive peeps be careful! 

To start I would try the shrimp and garlic. Since I discovered my aversion to garlic I haven't tried it again since but from what I remember it was de-lish! Plump shrimp with fresh garlic. 

Now the key to making two meals out of one is to order the 3 item combo plate for a couple bucks more. I usually have a burrito, taco and enchilada. The enchiladas are in a true Mexican red sauce and are oozing with cheese. The burrito: hot damn it is one HUGE burrito! That's where the idea of "two meals" comes in: eat the taco and enchilada (or any other combo) and then save the burrito for another time. Its even more delightful the next day! 

Margaritas are STRONG which often leads to a good time. I'm always groaning from a food baby when I leave this place but am so so so happy :)

enchilada.author: susan c.
enchilada.review:
Finally a decent place to get good mexican food AND good margaritas in SF for a reasonable price. We stumbled into this place after driving by Pizzetta 211 and seeing it was too packed. Having sworn off trying mexican food in SF after too many disappointing experiences, did I really want to give this place a chance?

I was a little hung over from the night before, and a good mexican dinner with a couple strong, tasty margaritas would really hit the spot so I thought...lets go for it.

From the moment the chips and salsa hit the table, I was sold. We got fresh, warm chips salted perfectly with 2 types of salsa which were very good. I got a 3 item combo, with excellent tasting beans. ( I typically judge a mexican place off its beans, chips, and guac, then the crispy taco, flavor of enchilada sauce, and tortilla quality) All of these things ranged from pretty good to excellent. 

From now on, this is our place when I feel like gorging myself on mexican food and margaritas. It is worth the trip....which actually wasnt too bad from Noe. Plus there is a parking lot right around the corner which only charges $1 per hour. I fundamentally have an issue paying $10 for parking on $12 mexican combo plates so the parking situation coupled with everything else makes this place ideal.

excerpts: And an enchilada with good enchilada sauce (not mole sauce or super-mild red sauce).
I had a chicken taco, cheese enchilada and shredded beef and bean burrito (for a combo plate, the burrito is was HUGE).
enchilada.author: Staci M.
enchilada.review:
This place was EXACTLY what I was looking for.  That's why the five stars.  

It seemed like all the Mexican places I found on Yelp were either burrito joints or sit-down restaurants with high-dollar interior Mex food.  I wanted a Mexican restaurant like the ones I grew up eating as a SoCal suburb girl.  Americanized Mexican combinations that are REALLY good.  Nothing fancy; just solid (traditional chile relleno beats out one with goat cheese and pine-nuts in my book).  A sit-down restaurant that served chips and salsa right off the bat.  Has great homemade guacamole.  And an enchilada with good enchilada sauce (not mole sauce or super-mild red sauce).  This place was perfect.  

Well, the rice IS kinda a mystery.  The flavor is like Chicken Rice-a-roni but milder.  But the beans are deliciously topped with that sizzling white cheese.  And I recommend asking them for HOT sauce.  If you mix it with the salsa they give you, it's TOPS.  

I had a chicken taco, cheese enchilada and shredded beef and bean burrito (for a combo plate, the burrito is was HUGE).  I had some of my boyfriend's chile relleno.  Everything was awesome.  The flan was perfect too.

Go here for the best mexican family restaurant I've seen yet in these parts.  It's still a BIT pricey ($15 for my 3-item combo) but I have another meal out of it and it was the bomb.  And their margaritas are nice and strong and not heavy on the mixer.  Damn this place rocks.

excerpts: The people are nice, the food is good -- not amazing, but good -- and if you want an enchilada, there are so many varieties!
And the plates are HUGE.
enchilada.author: Sapana S.
enchilada.review:
It's a family restaurant -- what are people expecting?! A five-star experience?

It's fine! The people are nice, the food is good -- not amazing, but good -- and if you want an enchilada, there are so many varieties! And the plates are HUGE. If you're hungry, this is THE place to go if you're in the Richmond.

Also, if you're lucky enough to get the crazy older lady as your waitress, you get stories for weeks! She once served us and when we told her that wasn't our food she yelled, "THEN DON"T TOUCH IT, I'll be back!" 
And she did, and she swapped for the right plates and served the correct plates to the right people. It was funny and not a problem at all.

One small thing: I like the food better here and the margaritas at Tommy's. If you're looking for food, come here. If you're looking for a pitcher of margaritas, go to Tommy's. They do Not serve pitchers at Tias.

enchilada.author: Chuy C.
enchilada.review:
After hearing many wonderful reviews through word of mouth I decided to finally give Tia Margarita's a try.  I figured the reviews came from trusted friends and how can you go wrong with Mexican after all I am one!

Warning numero uno. If you walk into an authentic Mexican restaurant and you and your friend are the only Mexicans in the place turn and run!

 The food at Tia Margaritas was far from appetizing; in fact it was as far from Mexican as Mexican food could be. I order the combination place (the small combo plate, you have a choice of three), which consisted of Spanish rice, refried beans, 1 enchilada, and 1 chile relleno (you have a choice of two items to go with your sides. 1 enchilada, 1 Taco, 1 chile relleno, 1 Fluata or 1 burrito).

Now I am not sure were the chef went to cooking school but it definitely did not specialize in Mexican cuisine. The Spanish rice was made with Risotto style rice, the salad came covered in Salsa, and the refried beans, basically tasted like a 50 cent can of refried beans.

The chips and so-called salsa did little for me. The salsa seemed to be made from ketchup and cocktail sauce with a hint of chopped onions.

The staff was friendly and nice and was very attending, and polite.

Unfortunately the only thing authentic about Tia Margarita's was there selection of beer.

This place should change there name to Aunt Margaret's and their Menu. Save your money and walk around the block to Gordo's.

excerpts: The tortillas were soggy and the chile relleno and enchilada were quite bland.

I'd go back to sit at the bar and have a margarita with chips and salsa.
The chips really were pretty good, but wouldn't be ordering a meal again.
enchilada.author: V K.
enchilada.review: The margaritas are okay, but the food isn't. Maybe I lived in the Mission too long, but the food doesn't stack up in any way to San Francisco mexican, and the rice is more like white rice than spanish rice. The tortillas were soggy and the chile relleno and enchilada were quite bland. On top of that it was too pricey for what you're getting. I'd go back to sit at the bar and have a margarita with chips and salsa. The chips really were pretty good, but wouldn't be ordering a meal again.
