The Enchilada's meat tasted like it was soaked in water, and Tamale had no flavor even drenched in that so called sauce they have. The Chile Releno was only ok. After eating that all I wanted to do was leave BUT was again stopped from leaving because our server disappeared into the other room talking to other customers who were her friends, and for some reason the other waitress was useless and couldn't bring us our check. After she brought us the check, I paid cash and she walked to the back and then started to use the phone and took her sweet time coming back.

Horrible food, horrible service, and food not worth the price.

We left paying $55, we should have went to Chevy's.

excerpts: After driving home from a golf outing, we were starving, and my friend Scotty was like, "DUDE lets get some cheese enchi's" (refering to cheese enchilada's)
I was totally down
so we decided to stop in.
Right off the bat chips and two types of salsa were in front of us.
Then our waitress came over to our table, and took our margarita orders.
Let me tell you, my Margarita was flat out BOMB, despite giving me heartburn.
They didnt use the sweet and sour mix, but all fresh ingredients in their margies, which was very evident in the taste.
enchilada.author: Buddy Garrity L.
enchilada.review:
MUCHO BUENO This place was love at first sight.  After driving home from a golf outing, we were starving, and my friend Scotty was like, "DUDE lets get some cheese enchi's" (refering to cheese enchilada's) 
 
I was totally down so we decided to stop in.  Right off the bat chips and two types of salsa were in front of us.  Then our waitress came over to our table, and took our margarita orders.  Let me tell you, my Margarita was flat out BOMB, despite giving me heartburn.  They didnt use the sweet and sour mix, but all fresh ingredients in their margies, which was very evident in the taste.  Not only that, but the margaritas were also very strong, so I felt pretty buzzed after just one.  

Getting back to our waitress - she was the sweetest lady in the entire world.  She rememinded me of my grandma, but a a plump, mexican version.

All in all I would highly recommend this place if you are looking for good sit down mexican and bomb margies.  Plus Grandma Forrest works there!

excerpts: My enchilada was so-so
I would even say that I prefer a Chevy's enchilada.
I would go there again for the atmosphere, but I wasn't blown away by the food.
enchilada.author: Emily W.
enchilada.review: This place was OK. Great chips and salsa, strong margaritas. My enchilada was so-so but I have had some really good enchiladas in SF. My friend from Australia was impressed but as a Mexican food lover, I wasn't too excited. I would even say that I prefer a Chevy's enchilada. I would go there again for the atmosphere, but I wasn't blown away by the food.

excerpts: I ordered the triple combo dinner with the taco/enchilada/tamale deal with the typical sides of beans, salad & rice.
Very tasty food indeed with a ice cold Corona to comfort my tummy..!!!
A def visit if you are in the richmond district vicinity..!
Orale Pues..!
enchilada.author: Sven S.
enchilada.review: First off, the margarita's at this place are pretty strong, being's that in 1st place place in strength would be Puerto Allegre in the mish. I like the fact that they also offer two different types of salsa with your chips-ie:mild and hot. I ordered the triple combo dinner with the taco/enchilada/tamale deal with the typical sides of beans, salad & rice. Very tasty food indeed with a ice cold Corona to comfort my tummy..!!! A def visit if you are in the richmond district vicinity..! Orale Pues..!

excerpts: Simple enchilada plate was a disappointment.
Tasted like boiled hospital food with no flavor.
Rice was yellow like it had saffron - not the traditional mexican rice.
Refries were poor and overdone - should be called reburns.
Maybe I could have filled up on chips but the salsa was terrible as if it was cut with tomato sauce.
Service was underwhelming as well.
enchilada.author: Tom O.
enchilada.review: First time diner...loved the interior but the love stops there.  Simple enchilada plate was a disappointment.  Tasted like boiled hospital food with no flavor.  Rice was yellow like it had saffron - not the traditional mexican rice.  Refries were poor and overdone - should be called reburns. Maybe I could have filled up on chips but the salsa was terrible as if it was cut with tomato sauce.  Service was underwhelming as well.

excerpts: a beef burito and a regular chicken enchilada.
the yellow rice was tasty.
the food was average, kinda meh.
b got a sausage egg thing.
he didnt eat much of it but said it was ok.
s and
j got the 3 combos.
enchilada.author: Merredith L.
enchilada.review: S wanted mexican food, and we all wanted a place with a waiter, instead of having the food behind a counter like most of the places in mission, so we decided to try here. it was saturday, but a weird time, 4 something. at this time, it was predicably dead. you walk in, and it's a bar ish area, and in the back is more restauranty style seating. we sat in back. the whole place looked weird. like a place for old people, or a cheap howard johnsons add on, or some only restaurant in the middle of nowhere if youve been driving forever and come upon a small town. i dont know, just disused and out of date. maybe when its full, it doesnt seem that way. salsa was not spicy, but it was good. we filled up way too much on those chips. s also ordered nachos which they all ate. but i dont like nachos. when the food finally came (it took a lil while...) it was very large portions, so thats good. they have combos with 2 or 3 items. i got the 2 items, which filled me up, so you know its big. a beef burito and a regular chicken enchilada. the yellow rice was tasty. the food was average, kinda meh. b got a sausage egg thing. he didnt eat much of it but said it was ok. s and j got the 3 combos. they had enchiladas, tacos, rellenos. it was too much for them after the apps. so have a big appetite if you order that. the food was eh. i tried the leftovers. s didnt like his really at all. except the rice. the waitress was nice about making changes to j's food. the worst part was the water. water came in TINY glasses. filled too far with ice. and i was thirsty. i didnt drink that day yet... and i had to keep asking a billion times for my glass to be refilled. after begging and begging i'd get a cup. and drink it in 2 sips. then sit there and start begging all over again. its water, its free, dont be stingy! im drinking it, its not being wasted! i was parched the whole meal. so, overall, a meh place. id not drive out here to go again. if i lived around the corner, hmm i still dont think id go back. other better looking restaurants around. it just didnt impress me.

excerpts: Tried the chicken taco and enchilada - good, but not worth 12 bucks.
Beans and rice were...
well...beans and rice.
Never been able to tell the difference no matter where I go.
enchilada.author: Sanjiv B.
enchilada.review: i really like this place for some reason.  The environment is Chi Chi's Mexican restaurant a la 1993.  Needless to say, it struck a chord with me.  The food was good - above average, but not on par with the elite places, especially in San Fran.  The drinks were super good.  Really stiff margarita (not really much more than a beer, scotch or gin drinker).  The service was super good and everything came out very fast.  Tried the chicken taco and enchilada - good, but not worth 12 bucks.  Beans and rice were...well...beans and rice.  Never been able to tell the difference no matter where I go.

excerpts: I ordered the small combination plate again with a chicken tamale, chile relleno, refried beans and rice all on one big platter.
The beans weren't fully cooked and the tamale was bland.
The relleno had a little more flavor, but that's not saying much.
The best thing I had was the chile con queso appetizer.
Melted cheddar cheese with chopped up green chillie's mixed in was heavenly!
The cheese was so stringy every time I scooped some up with chips.
chile relleno.author: Rebecca C.
chile relleno.review:
I was really looking forward to another excellent  meal since the food was delicious the first time. Sad to say, this time around the food and service weren't good. 

I ordered the small combination plate again with a chicken tamale, chile relleno, refried beans and rice all on one big platter. The beans weren't fully cooked and the tamale was bland. The relleno had a little more flavor, but that's not saying much. The best thing I had was the chile con queso appetizer. Melted cheddar cheese with chopped up green chillie's mixed in was heavenly! The cheese was so stringy every time I scooped some up with chips. Check out the photo! 

The service was slow and barely attended our table. We were the only large party and the server took forever to come to our table after we were seated. He wasn't too friendly either. The busser did most of the work by refilling our chips and salsa bowls, refilling our glasses with water, and clearing our plates. I don't think I'll be coming back for awhile.

excerpts: Chile relleno (excellent with a to-die-for tomato- based sauce;
so many years ago this place was my first chile relleno experience!), cheese enchilada (this wasn't my favorite item, because I'm not a fan of the flour tortilla and it was all I could taste.
chile relleno.author: Fannie S.
chile relleno.review:
I haven't been here in at least 9 years and glad to see that it's still around. Established in '63. 

Food = good.

Guacamole = delicious. It's not a large portion for the price but worth it. $5.75** (Some reason they did not charge us for it...must've been because they were busy?!)

Tacos Dorados = two tacos (he chose ground beef, but you can have chicken or shredded beef); comes with salad, rice and beans (black or refried). $14.50

Combination (large, 3 items) = I couldn't decide so I went with this one against my stomach's capacity. Chile relleno (excellent with a to-die-for tomato- based sauce; so many years ago this place was my first chile relleno experience!), cheese enchilada (this wasn't my favorite item, because I'm not a fan of the flour tortilla and it was all I could taste. The cheese is mild and creamy.), beef taco (crispy shell, soft shell upon request; excellent tasting ground beef (shredded available, too) topped with guacamole and salsa. $17.75

Coke = $2.00

Service = friendly and pretty fast once you get a seat. There was a 30-minute wait on a Friday night but not a surprise. They have a handwritten list that they keep track of and yes, you should wait outside, or wait at the bar with drink in hand. FYI: Host desk is inside past the bar, which is hard to see when it's as packed as it was last night. 

Prices = reasonable to moderate. Dinner for two came out to $37.21. Took home leftovers for another meal. 

Noise = boisterous. I don't recall ever being here when it was"quiet" unless it was somewhat empty, which doesn't last for long.

Overall, still a solid place for well-portioned platters, great margaritas & other drinks (didn't imbibe this time but it was prevalent throughout the dining area and the large bar area). And they still have a light eater menu.

excerpts: The chile relleno is my usual order now but the fajitas and enchiladas are total comfort food too.
chile relleno.author: Samantha L.
chile relleno.review:
This is an Outer Richmond gem. Bar is always packed with locals. Walk further in and around the bar to get a seat. You'll see almost every person with a margarita in front of them. You can have it blended or on the rocks (with salt if you like). On a hot day, their ice cold double margarita is best blended.. the best adult slushie in the nieghborhood!

Huge portions and their menu has everything you've ever craved for. Everything is so good. I need the recipe for their complimentary salsas, especially the hot one. The chile relleno is my usual order now but the fajitas and enchiladas are total comfort food too.

excerpts: I can't describe what they called a chile relleno --some greasy, soggy pancake that had a chile in it somewhere.
Horrible!
About an hour after eating, I was so bloated --
like I swallowed a salt lick -- it was unbelievable.
I suffered from severe gas all night long and the next morning, then suffered from constipation for the next full day.
The margaritas were delicious, however.
Go there (if you can ever find a parking place) only for a couple margaritas, friendly bartenders, and some chips and salsa but pass on any food!
chile relleno.author: Larry H.
chile relleno.review: What's wrong with the food at Tia Margarita's?  It's SLOP, not fit for a trough!  Typical Mexican restaurant microwaved soup (refried beans), tasteless rice, and some shredded lettuce.  The cheese enchiladas were stuffed thick with some foreign kind of salty cheese then smothered with some orange-colored paste (their enchilada sauce).  My tamale was a gigantic, cold lump of off-colored corn meal about 2-3 inches thick and I could barely find the meat.  (Sent it back for another cheese enchilada -- big mistake!)  The tamale had its own horrible sauce, too.  I can't describe what they called a chile relleno --some greasy, soggy pancake that had a chile in it somewhere.  Horrible!  About an hour after eating, I was so bloated -- like I swallowed a salt lick -- it was unbelievable.  I suffered from severe gas all night long and the next morning, then suffered from constipation for the next full day.  The margaritas were delicious, however.  Go there (if you can ever find a parking place) only for a couple margaritas, friendly bartenders, and some chips and salsa but pass on any food!

excerpts: I had a small combo plate of shredded chicken enchilada and chile relleno which came with yummy refried beans, rice and that shredded iceberg lettuce that no one ever eats.
chile relleno.author: Ada C.
chile relleno.review:
If you are looking for that old school Mexican American restaurant that serves enchiladas smothered in sauce and cheese on a heated plate, this is it.  Tia Margarita reminded me of the Mexican food I grew up with. I have no idea if it's authentic but who cares. It tastes good and the margaritas are top notch!

I had a small combo plate of shredded chicken enchilada and chile relleno which came with yummy refried beans, rice and that shredded iceberg lettuce that no one ever eats. Very tasty and totally hit the spot. 

Definitely worth stopping by if you are in the area!

excerpts: Combo plate: chile relleno, taco and enchilada.
All three were above average.
Refried beans and rice were great.
This place might not win a Michelin star but I'd definitely come back and am very happy it is close to my neighborhood.
chile relleno.author: D B.
chile relleno.review: For what it is, this place is awesome.   The atmosphere was lively and fun.   Chips and salsa to start.   Habanero salsa is delicious.   Combo plate: chile relleno, taco and enchilada.  All three were above average.  Refried beans and rice were great.   This place might not win a Michelin star but I'd definitely come back and am very happy it is close to my neighborhood.

excerpts: This plate came with a Chile Relleno that is possibly the best I have ever had, highly recommended.
chile relleno.author: Tony N.
chile relleno.review:
Came here with a few friends about an hour before closing. Seated very quickly. We sat in the room with the bar and were able to watch the Giants game while we ate. 

I ordered a house margarita on the rocks and it was really good. The pictures on yelp of the margarita are accurate. 

I ordered the Combination Plate (Large). This plate came with a Chile Relleno that is possibly the best I have ever had, highly recommended. The plate also came with a carne Asada burrito, a chicken enchilada, and a tamale. All of the food was very tasty and very filling. So much so, had to take some of it home for breakfast in the morning. 

The service was good. We had a waiter that took out orders and was prompt with everything we needed and the hostess kinda backed him up and made sure when he was busy at other tables, we were taken cared of. 

If you like good quality food and great service I would recommend this place. I'm sure I'll be back again to visit soon.

excerpts: I got a chile relleno/taco combo.
The relleno was not bad, it seemed fresh which is hard to come by since usually when I order one somewhere
it's obviously been prepared ahead of time and microwaved.
I would have liked it a lot more if it had Mexican cheese in it instead of jack.
Chicken taco was fine.
The rice is pretty terrible.
It tastes like rice-a-roni or some other premade rice brand.
chile relleno.author: Karissa Q.
chile relleno.review:
Definitely not authentic Mexican food by any means. I didn't expect much stopping in here during a bike ride considering it was in the Richmond, but we figured we would try it. The margaritas are strong, but not good. I got a chile relleno/taco combo. The relleno was not bad, it seemed fresh which is hard to come by since usually when I order one somewhere it's obviously been prepared ahead of time and microwaved. I would have liked it a lot more if it had Mexican cheese in it instead of jack. Chicken taco was fine. The rice is pretty terrible. It tastes like rice-a-roni or some other premade rice brand. My boyfriend liked his beef flauta.
The server, although nice, didn't come check on us at all and it was right before the dinner rush so it wasn't that busy yet. 
The food was acceptable and filled us up, but we probably won't be going back.

excerpts: The rice and beans were full of flavor as was the entire dish (Shredded Beef Burrito and a Chile Relleno).
The Margaritas are as original as you can get.
Our meals came with a Double Top Shelf Margaritas; a few sips of that
and you are on cloud 9!
A little too strong at first but
chile relleno.author: Jennifer D.
chile relleno.review:
I'm always looking to try new and exciting off the beaten path. I had purchased some half off dinner vouchers for Tia Margarita online months ago and completely forgot about them.  Since the vouchers expired yesterday, I went with a friend to try the place out. Each voucher was good for 2 small (not small by any means) combo dishes and 2 margaritas.  We could only use one of the vouchers last night.  The Manager, Jennifer, kindly extended the second voucher it so that I could either come back or give it to someone else to enjoy.  

This place was great!  A pleasant find; I will recommend and return to with family and friends. We were greeted right away and provided a table.  Chips and 2 types of salsa were brought to our table. Showed our friendly server our vouchers and he told us what was included.  Made us feel very welcomed.  Portion sizes are very generous...plenty for lunch left over's.  The small combo dish came with two main dish choices, black beans, rice and green salad.  The rice and beans were full of flavor as was the entire dish (Shredded Beef Burrito and a Chile Relleno).  The Margaritas are as original as you can get.  Our meals came with a Double Top Shelf Margaritas; a few sips of that and you are on cloud 9!  :)  A little too strong at first but as the ice melted, it was fine and fully enjoyed!  

The horseshoe shaped bar is very inviting.  By the time we were half way through our meal, the place was busy inside for a Wed. night.  People picking up orders to go, dining in or just grabbing a drink and chat at the bar.  We never felt rushed to leave yet not forgotten either.  

A fantastic first experience to a well hidden gem off the beaten path!  Looking forward to my return!  :)

excerpts: My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).
It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff
and it's only around $15.
Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.
chile relleno.author: dave g.
chile relleno.review:
Tia's Rocks!
I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet because I've eaten here at least 10 times.  I've been with friends, family, co-workers, everyone loves this place.  First thing you need to know is that the food is TASTY!  We've probably gone thru everything on the menu at this point and have never been disappointed.   It's one of our favorite places to eat in the city.

The portions are HUGE!  My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).  It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff and it's only around $15.  Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.  Rockin'!  

My buddy ordered a small combination plate and that came with TWO burritos!  Nice.  I read where some people were bitching about the prices, but, the food you get will feed an army.

Next, the Margaritas are great.  We had a group of 5 there tonight and everyone commented on how tasty they were.  I read a few reviews where people felt they were watered down, but I've never thought that once in all the Margaritas I've had there over the years.  In fact, sometimes I thought they were TOO strong.  (I mean, it can't really ever be TOO strong, but, ya know what I mean). 

The wait staff there is great.  We had chips and salsa on our table within moments of being seated.  They're quick to fill back up your water, they're generous with the chips and salsa and constantly come around to make sure you have everything you need.  After years of going, I finally introduced myself to the same waitress who has waited on us so many times.  Her name is Rosa and she's awesome.  She's got a great sense of humor and we love joking around with her.  I already can't wait to go back....

excerpts: We ended up ordering a 3-item combo plate to share: chile relleno, shrimp enchilada, and a shrimp taco...delish!
I seriously am punching myself for not having gone there before last night!!
The missing star is due to beef, chicken, and shrimp being the only options...
i love al pastor!
boohoo!
Despite that,  I will be returning again soon!
chile relleno.author: Laura M.
chile relleno.review:
I have lived 3 blocks away from this restaurant for over a year and last night was my first AMAZING experience at tia margaritas!!  
  my friend and i sat at the bar and immediately ordered chips, salsa y guacamole to accompany our margaritas.  Not only was the bartender top notch in the entertainment department, he mixed up some fine house margaritas!  
We ended up ordering a 3-item combo plate to share: chile relleno, shrimp enchilada, and a shrimp taco...delish!  
  I seriously am punching myself for not having gone there before last night!! The missing star is due to beef, chicken, and shrimp being the only options... i love al pastor! boohoo!  Despite that,  I will be returning again soon!

excerpts: Ordered a chile relleno and cheese enchilada combo.
The enchilada sauce was nothing speciall
but they do hook you up with the cheese.
As for the chile relleno - if you have ever had a one from Jimboys it tastes EXACTLY like a Jimboys chile relleno.
Dont get me wrong, I liked it.
But, knowing I could spend half the price for a similar meal kinda rubs me the wrong way.
For me the best part was the rice.
I dont know what they do to it
but I really liked it
chile relleno.author: Richard C.
chile relleno.review:
Its just alright...

Ordered a chile relleno and cheese enchilada combo. The enchilada sauce was nothing speciall but they do hook you up with the cheese. As for the chile relleno - if you have ever had a one from Jimboys it tastes EXACTLY like a Jimboys chile relleno. Dont get me wrong, I liked it. But, knowing I could spend half the price for a similar meal kinda rubs me the wrong way. For me the best part was the rice. I dont know what they do to it but I really liked it and it wasnt even in the style of spanish rice. 

In their defense, I came here with a group of about 15 and most of the people I was with liked their food. They really raved about the Flautas in particular. The margaritas are pretty good too.

excerpts: Hubby had the Chile Relleno which he proceeded to scarf along with the warm tortillas, huge side of beans and YUMMY butter rice.
chile relleno.author: I have something to say... A.
chile relleno.review:
My husband did take out last night from TM.  GREAT FOOD.  This is even after the meals traveled a 1 mile distance.  Hubby had the Chile Relleno which he proceeded to scarf along with the warm tortillas, huge side of beans and YUMMY butter rice.  He got me the chicken and beef enchiladas.  Chicken was hand shredded and the beef was ground to a nice texture.  Can't wait to stop by the place for a meal soon.

2 thumbs up Tia Magarita!

excerpts: I don't know if you've ever gone on a chile relleno hunt, but I have, and I can honestly say that Tia's has a dreamy chile relleno.
I could do without the rice pilaf and sitting at a booth around the bar, and the salsa is just a complete Elm Street Nightmare.
And although I can somewhat appreciate the ethnic beauty of their two giant gold masks (are their eyes open or closed?), I have to admit that they kind of frighten me.
But!
-- they serve ginger ale (which I adore!)
and it's hard to complain too much when the staff is so friendly.
Right?
Right.
chile relleno.author: Natasha P.
chile relleno.review: I don't know if you've ever gone on a chile relleno hunt, but I have, and I can honestly say that Tia's has a dreamy chile relleno. I could do without the rice pilaf and sitting at a booth around the bar, and the salsa is just a complete Elm Street Nightmare. And although I can somewhat appreciate the ethnic beauty of their two giant gold masks (are their eyes open or closed?), I have to admit that they kind of frighten me. But! -- they serve ginger ale (which I adore!) and it's hard to complain too much when the staff is so friendly. Right? Right.

excerpts: Nothing fancy; just solid (traditional chile relleno beats out one with goat cheese and pine-nuts in my book).
A sit-down restaurant that served chips and salsa right off the bat.
Has great homemade guacamole.
I had some of my boyfriend's chile relleno.
Everything was awesome.
chile relleno.author: Staci M.
chile relleno.review:
This place was EXACTLY what I was looking for.  That's why the five stars.  

It seemed like all the Mexican places I found on Yelp were either burrito joints or sit-down restaurants with high-dollar interior Mex food.  I wanted a Mexican restaurant like the ones I grew up eating as a SoCal suburb girl.  Americanized Mexican combinations that are REALLY good.  Nothing fancy; just solid (traditional chile relleno beats out one with goat cheese and pine-nuts in my book).  A sit-down restaurant that served chips and salsa right off the bat.  Has great homemade guacamole.  And an enchilada with good enchilada sauce (not mole sauce or super-mild red sauce).  This place was perfect.  

Well, the rice IS kinda a mystery.  The flavor is like Chicken Rice-a-roni but milder.  But the beans are deliciously topped with that sizzling white cheese.  And I recommend asking them for HOT sauce.  If you mix it with the salsa they give you, it's TOPS.  

I had a chicken taco, cheese enchilada and shredded beef and bean burrito (for a combo plate, the burrito is was HUGE).  I had some of my boyfriend's chile relleno.  Everything was awesome.  The flan was perfect too.

Go here for the best mexican family restaurant I've seen yet in these parts.  It's still a BIT pricey ($15 for my 3-item combo) but I have another meal out of it and it was the bomb.  And their margaritas are nice and strong and not heavy on the mixer.  Damn this place rocks.

excerpts:
I order the combination place (the small combo plate, you have a choice of three), which consisted of Spanish rice, refried beans, 1 enchilada, and 1 chile relleno (you have a choice of two items to go with your sides. 
1 enchilada, 1 Taco, 1 chile relleno, 1 Fluata or 1 burrito).

1 enchilada, 1 Taco, 1 chile relleno, 1 Fluata or 1 burrito).
chile relleno.author: Chuy C.
chile relleno.review:
After hearing many wonderful reviews through word of mouth I decided to finally give Tia Margarita's a try.  I figured the reviews came from trusted friends and how can you go wrong with Mexican after all I am one!

Warning numero uno. If you walk into an authentic Mexican restaurant and you and your friend are the only Mexicans in the place turn and run!

 The food at Tia Margaritas was far from appetizing; in fact it was as far from Mexican as Mexican food could be. I order the combination place (the small combo plate, you have a choice of three), which consisted of Spanish rice, refried beans, 1 enchilada, and 1 chile relleno (you have a choice of two items to go with your sides. 1 enchilada, 1 Taco, 1 chile relleno, 1 Fluata or 1 burrito).

Now I am not sure were the chef went to cooking school but it definitely did not specialize in Mexican cuisine. The Spanish rice was made with Risotto style rice, the salad came covered in Salsa, and the refried beans, basically tasted like a 50 cent can of refried beans.

The chips and so-called salsa did little for me. The salsa seemed to be made from ketchup and cocktail sauce with a hint of chopped onions.

The staff was friendly and nice and was very attending, and polite.

Unfortunately the only thing authentic about Tia Margarita's was there selection of beer.

This place should change there name to Aunt Margaret's and their Menu. Save your money and walk around the block to Gordo's.

excerpts: The tortillas were soggy and the chile relleno and enchilada were quite bland.
On top of that it was too pricey for what you're getting.
I'd go back to sit at the bar and have a margarita with chips and salsa.
The chips really were pretty good, but wouldn't be ordering a meal again.
chile relleno.author: V K.
chile relleno.review: The margaritas are okay, but the food isn't. Maybe I lived in the Mission too long, but the food doesn't stack up in any way to San Francisco mexican, and the rice is more like white rice than spanish rice. The tortillas were soggy and the chile relleno and enchilada were quite bland. On top of that it was too pricey for what you're getting. I'd go back to sit at the bar and have a margarita with chips and salsa. The chips really were pretty good, but wouldn't be ordering a meal again.

excerpts: The Quesadilla was a not my favorite, since the tortilla was like fried super crispy--I think I would've preferred it to be like the super quesadillas you can get on every corner in the mission, and the portion was pretty small for the price
but I guess if you weigh in the sides, it's alright.
quesadilla.author: Nerissa C.
quesadilla.review:
I don't know the last time I've been to an actual sit down/serviced mexican place but this was worth it. Usually I'm a hole in the wall kinda person but I came for the double margs. and conquered all the delicious food.

This is my friend's go-to for some refreshing top shelf double margaritas (OH BABY). Came on a Sunday in the afternoon after some soccer and a couple of beers. We ordered a round of double margs and the queso appetizer which were perfect. The salsa they bring out is great, the mild is sweet and good for anyone, the spicy is def. a kicker--if you like a little spice, just mix the two, otherwise stick with the milk. Queso was ooey gooey and warm--magic in a dish to start soaking up those beers from earlier!

I ordered the Combination Plate 2 ($15.75) with Rellenos and Enchilada (Beef) and a side of refried beans, which I shared so I could score half of the Carne Asada Quesadillas ($13.75). Everything was great! I didn't think you could beat the whole in the wall comfort food of all the mission places but for what it was, this was really good. My combination plate was perfect, 10/10 would get it again. The Quesadilla was a not my favorite, since the tortilla was like fried super crispy--I think I would've preferred it to be like the super quesadillas you can get on every corner in the mission, and the portion was pretty small for the price but I guess if you weigh in the sides, it's alright. Overall, the rest of the plates seems to go over well anda decent portions once you tap in the sides. 

This stuff hit the spot and I felt better after eating it all--especially with the previous beers, def. soaked up some of that potential drinking aftermath.

excerpts: but I wouldn't call them that, also I regretted ordering them with the quesadilla as my meal was just all cheese.
quesadilla.author: Hoku L.
quesadilla.review: Atmosphere is nice and servers friendly. The food I would say was a couple steps up from Taco Bell. Very bland and non traditional. Empanadas were good but I wouldn't call them that, also I regretted ordering them with the quesadilla as my meal was just all cheese.

excerpts: I had to send back the chicken quesadilla, the chicken tasted very tough and old.
The sever seemed upset and repeated its chicken, I told him it was not edible.
Definitely we will not return.
quesadilla.author: Dee D.
quesadilla.review: We've been wanting to try this place for a while, finally can on a day when it was open. When we entered the bar area was crowded, we were seated promptly. We tried to order a pitcher of margaritas and were told we could not only a single or double, The strawberry margaritas were very sweet. The chips were awful, maybe some of the worst I've ever had. The only thing that was good was the hotter salsa. I had to send back the chicken quesadilla, the chicken tasted very tough and old. The sever seemed upset and repeated its chicken, I told him it was not edible. Definitely we will not return.

excerpts: I ordered the sampler plate with one burrito, one taco and one quesadilla.
the burrito was good
but I was
sadly disappointed by the taco and quesadilla especially for this price.
sadly disappointed by the taco and quesadilla especially for this price.
My friend had a carne asada taco for $13 and a carne asada burrito for $14.
In my opinion definitely overpriced for the food that it was.
Even though I did not order it, I hear that the one thing to try from this place is the Chimichangas...

In my opinion definitely overpriced for the food that it was.
Even though I did not order it, I hear that the one thing to try from this place is the Chimichangas...
quesadilla.author: Romain D.
quesadilla.review:
I recently went to Tia Margerita having heard great things about it. I ordered the sampler plate with one burrito, one taco and one quesadilla. the burrito was good but I was  sadly disappointed by the taco and quesadilla especially for this price. My friend had a carne asada taco for $13 and a carne asada burrito for $14. In my opinion definitely overpriced for the food that it was.
Even though I did not order it, I hear that the one thing to try from this place is the Chimichangas...

excerpts: House made empanadas, wings, quesadilla, & 4 good size mini burritos (2) Chicken |
(2) Beef... Yum!
quesadilla.author: Sleven M.
quesadilla.review: Stopped in the place for a quick bite... Bs'd w/some regulars that were friendly & full of stories! Bartender was energetic & out going & has been there 20 years! Margarita was tasty & the Sampler was AWESOMELY HUGE.  House made empanadas, wings, quesadilla, & 4 good size mini burritos (2) Chicken | (2) Beef... Yum!

excerpts: Everything on it was deep-fried except for maybe the quesadilla and the burritos, and I didn't even have to choose between chicken or beef because I was brought 2 of each in the form of spinach and tomato tortillas, and when I dropped my taquito in my margarita on accident, I was brought 2 new taquitos (cause 1 on a plate would be lonely) AND a new margarita!
quesadilla.author: Megan A.
quesadilla.review:
WHOA on the harsh reviews!  Complaining that a drink is *too* strong? Get the heck outta here!  And making fun of the sweet elderly waitress with the hearing aid, would you be happier if she were working in the back stuffing empanadas or something? I mean jeez have a little bit of patience and compassion.   

I feel like this is kinda like saying "they had great water!" but their quesadillas are off the hook!!!  I usually scoff at corn tortillas, but they are what MAKE the quesadillas here.  I have never ordered the one with meat, because the cheesy oozy buttery one gives me lady wood every time.  The thing is though, you gotta eat it FAST because it's only "last meal" worthy if you eat it right when they place it on the table...honestly if you could snatch a piece while the waitress/er is placing it on your table that's the sweet spot.  

Per some Yelp recommendations I got the Sampler this time - THANKS GUYS, it was the best idea ever.  Everything on it was deep-fried except for maybe the quesadilla and the burritos, and I didn't even have to choose between chicken or beef because I was brought 2 of each in the form of spinach and tomato tortillas, and when I dropped my taquito in my margarita on accident, I was brought 2 new taquitos (cause 1 on a plate would be lonely) AND a new margarita!

excerpts: Who on earth charges $10 for a quesadilla?
WHO?!
quesadilla.author: Rachel G.
quesadilla.review:
'Well we didn't get sick from it.'

This is what my husband said in response to my 'what did you think of Tia's.' I thought I should throw my 5 cents into the pot of mixed reviews of this place. We went because we were meeting a group and probably wouldn't have eaten there otherwise... I'd never heard of it and hoped that maybe it was a hidden gem. 

Well there's nothing bejeweled about TIa's. If you like rice of the Uncle Ben's microwave variety, beans from a can,  quesadillas oil coated, ketchup-y salsa...then please do come here, you will love it. Sigh. The salad was more an afterthought, limp shredded iceberg struggling to breathe under another layer of salsa. Because the 2 cups of ketch-salsa you gave me with my chips wasn't enough. There was guacamole, it was powdery. WTF how can guac be powdery?! I don't know guys, but it was. At least there wasn't a lot of it. 

The staff were rude. Our server repeatedly told us to move our stuff out the way even though there was plenty of room for her to get past. If I could cram a stroller under a table I would, jeez. 

Here's the deal. If you are local, you might like this place for margs. If you are a bit of a loner, you might like to hang out with the other loners at the bar. If you are anyone else, do. not. go. here. ever. SF has so much more to offer!  

Oh fffff I forgot to mention - it is SO EXPENSIVE. Who on earth charges $10 for a quesadilla? WHO?! It's a plate with beans and rice and salad, but as mentioned before, the sides are all severely sub par canned/bagged crap that don't taste like anything. 

:-(

excerpts: We received small burritos, a quesadilla, empanadas, and a few other assortments that I forget.
Good sizes, easily shared, and good quality.
quesadilla.author: Jason C.
quesadilla.review:
Tia Margarita is easy to miss. It looks like a house, doesn't have loud mariachi music blaring from inside, and doesn't blast the streets with lights. 

I walked in here with a friend after passing by numerous times. We ordered the appetizer combo and a Margarita. While we waited, we sipped on our drinks and ate some chips. They offered two salsas, a mango fruit flavored one and a spicy one. Both were good, but I preferred the fruit flavored one. You can also combine them for the best of both worlds.

When our food arrived, It turned out a lot better than I expected. We received small burritos, a quesadilla, empanadas, and a few other assortments that I forget. Good sizes, easily shared, and good quality. It wasn't the most authentic Mexican I've ever eaten, but for Americanized Mexican, it was pretty darn good -- a LOT better than Chevy's or any of the other chains. 

I left happy and decided I'd go back with more friends. The second time I went, we sat at the bar. I'll admit, I don't remember much. The bartender was nice, the drinks were generous, and the food didn't end up on the street, if you know what I mean.

Update (4/5/08) - I went back and it was a mad house. The waiters forgot our orders,  bartenders ignored us, and it was not quite the same experience. The margaritas were actually pretty bad? So we ordered some top shelf to see if there would be a difference -- nope. The food quality was different, too! Our sampler's empanada's looked like fried cheese bread. Maybe it was a weekend, but this inconsistancy is scary. I'm downgrading my rating...

excerpts: My quesadilla was not a huge slab of oily cheese between a limp tortilla, but crispy and melty with really flavorful salsa and guacamole.
It came with a salad, rice, and beans.
The serving size was just right...
this was not a situation of size over quality.
However, I saw some other patrons with enormous plates, so I must've chosen from the light-eater's section of the menu, then.
quesadilla.author: Suzi G.
quesadilla.review:
I'll have to go back and really pay attention to everything next time so I can write a proper review, but I really liked the place, I have to say. It has a beautifully decorated interior, efficient and polite staff, and good food. My quesadilla was not a huge slab of oily cheese between a limp tortilla, but crispy and melty with really flavorful salsa and guacamole. It came with a salad, rice, and beans. The serving size was just right... this was not a situation of size over quality. However, I saw some other patrons with enormous plates, so I must've chosen from the light-eater's section of the menu, then. They'll keep refilling your chips and salsa, which are actually freshly made.

The margaritas are pretty damn delicious... top shelf, blended... MMMMMGOOD! I don't think I'd get more than one or two drinks per visit, though, or I'd end up broke for the night. Margaritas are sold by the glass (no pitchers) and are about $7 for a single shot and  $10 for a double.

I like this place better than Puerto Allegre. It was busy, but there was plenty of seating and you didn't have to hunt down a waitstaff to take an order. We got our food promptly (and at the same time) and were never rushed to finish up so they could give our table to someone else. I like that Tia Margarita's location isn't on a bustling street... it feels private and cozy... a perfect place to take someone out on a date, to celebrate a birthday, or to just have some drinks with friends.

excerpts: at one stage she said it was $17 for a shrimp quesadilla appetizer.
we thought that was absurd.
she also didn't seem to hear things we requested.
in fairness she was in her golden years, and you could see the relief on her face when she sat down at the end of her shift.
quesadilla.author: Sheri N.
quesadilla.review:
i'm a whiskey gal, but i don't mind indulging in a margarita from here.  they don't saturate the alcohol w/sweet and sour mix, and mainly use fresh lime juice in their margaritas.  i prefer to have mine on the rocks.  

never mind what everyone else ordered, my shrimp enchiladas where insanely delicious.  they don't skimp on the shrimp portions like many restaurants do, and the way they cook the shrimp is just divine.

our server was not consistent w/her prices.  shrimp is an additional cost, but she kept up-ing the price when we asked about different dishes which we wanted to add shrimp to. at one stage she said it was $17 for a shrimp quesadilla appetizer.  we thought that was absurd.   she also didn't seem to hear things we requested.  in fairness she was in her golden years, and you could see the relief on her face when she sat down at the end of her shift.

excerpts: Quesadilla & Burritos.
Food was not bad, but it just doesn't feel the same when you don't eat with your hands.
I was about to dig in with my hands but everyone else in the place were using the forks and knives.
quesadilla.author: Jimmy N.
quesadilla.review:
Excellent waiter/bartender service. Quite friendly.

Chips & Salsa to start. Love the salsa!

Had to start with some margaritas. Excellently blended. Loved it!

Quesadilla & Burritos. Food was not bad, but it just doesn't feel the same when you don't eat with your hands.
I was about to dig in with my hands but everyone else in the place were using the forks and knives. Didn't want to act like a savage, so I refrained.

Overall, it was a good experience. I guess I still prefer the taquerias.

excerpts: We had the quesadilla with carne asada which was so great.
The dough was like philo dough.
So good.
quesadilla.author: Brian L.
quesadilla.review: The food here can not be beat.  We had the quesadilla with carne asada which was so great.  The dough was like philo dough.  So good.  We also had the burrito with carne asada.  We had a margarita (single shot) and we spent $35.

excerpts:
We split an enchilada verde bit dull
Way to much sour creme to me

Next time in the area
enchilada verde.author: Michael F.
enchilada verde.review:
Went last night. 
Place is not really high on my scale
Margarita not bad have had far better.
We split an enchilada verde bit dull
Way to much sour creme to me

Next time in the area it's Tommy's again.

excerpts: A friend had the tamales, I had enchiladas rancheras and my other friend had the pollo asado plate.
Of course none of us could finish their dish.
At 8:50 people were already staring at us like "get the hell out of here", but some of the people that were already in when we came in were still there, so what was the point?
We ate super quick and asked for the check super quick, since we didn't feel welcome at all.
When we left, there were like 10 people still in there, who were already there when we got in.
So whatever.
It's also a little pricey for a Mexican restaurant...
But the portions are reasonable, so it's okay.
Too bad the service wasn't nice to us
, otherwise it would probably be a 5 stars for me.
enchiladas.author: Diana F.
enchiladas.review:
We got here for a late dinner yesterday. It was my friend's birthday and we were actually going to another place, but it turned out to be closed, so we looked for nearby places and found this one. 
The place closes at 9pm and it was 8:20pm when we got in. I totally understand that workers wanna go home on time, I've been there, but that's not a reason to be rude with customers... We really didn't feel like they were happy about seeing us. It was quite the opposite, actually. 
So it was a friend and I and we were expecting another friend to arrive. The hostess came and told us that the kitchen was closing in 5 minutes. Okaaaaaay.... I called my friend who was on his way and took his order through the phone. 
Now, something good about the place (actually worth 5 stars if it wasn't for other details: portions are HUGE. Literally. HUGE! I can't imagine that someone is able to eat all of a complete dinner. That's not  even possible. A friend had the tamales, I had enchiladas rancheras and my other friend had the pollo asado plate. Of course none of us could finish their dish. At 8:50 people were already staring at us like "get the hell out of here", but some of the people that were already in when we came in were still there, so what was the point? We ate super quick and asked for the check super quick, since we didn't feel welcome at all. 
When we left, there were like 10 people still in there, who were already there when we got in. So whatever. 
It's also a little pricey for a Mexican restaurant... But the portions are reasonable, so it's okay. 
Too bad the service wasn't nice to us, otherwise it would probably be a 5 stars for me.

excerpts: I got a Tia Tostada with no meat and my boyfriend got enchiladas with shrimp for the filling.
I tried a bite and the shrimp had such good flavor-
enchiladas.author: Hayley D.
enchiladas.review:
We came here around 4pm on a Sunday for an early dinner/late lunch. We were really in the mood for Mexican food and a friend mentioned that this place was good. 

Ambiance: Inside it was dim & clean. It looked super small when you walk in, but when we went to our table we saw how there was a lot more space toward the back of the restaurant. 

Service: Service was great here! We got seated right away- even though we came early. Chips were brought out immediately and waters as well. Our server was really nice and knew every thing about the menu- had a lot to suggest for vegetarian/ pescatarians.

Food: The food here was tasty and the plates were HUGE! We started with margaritas- they were pretty plain, but got the job done ;) They should put more lime juice in them for sure. I got a Tia Tostada with no meat and my boyfriend got enchiladas with shrimp for the filling. I tried a bite and the shrimp had such good flavor- they were rich in garlic, white wine, and butter and the outside enchilada sauce was to die for. The tostada was a little plain, I knew I should of gotten the shrimp tostada- NEXT TIME! 

For sure will be back! :) 4.5 stars!

excerpts: You know the kind: enchiladas, burritos, tacos, chiles rellenos; the old reliables.
You get a bunch of chips and salsa to your table, and one of them was a bit too hot for me, but it will burn your mouth in the best way.
enchiladas.author: Jeffrey S.
enchiladas.review:
If you're looking for an opinion on the food, read on. Booze? I'm no help.

What I can say, is that while they're not re-defining the bounds of Mexican food, you can find a classic Mexican restaurant menu here. You know the kind: enchiladas, burritos, tacos, chiles rellenos; the old reliables. You get a bunch of chips and salsa to your table, and one of them was a bit too hot for me, but it will burn your mouth in the best way. They don't want to be precious or fancy, they just want to be an old school neighborhood spot.

That's what they are: a neighborhood spot. On a Saturday evening in the neighborhood I noticed a lot of families coming in. Granted, it was early for dinner. Like, embarrassingly early. But they definitely had a full house by 6pm, and it wasn't rowdy, rather neighbors filing in. 

It's simple, they have a really great neon sign out front, and some old school booths as well as a dining area on the non-bar side of the building. the bar is a cool little wrap area, and they were stuffed to the gills with margarita glasses and limes. Even though I'm not a drinker, I can tell they do a serious business of margaritas. They have all the usual suspects on the menu, all the normal Mexican beers, and from the looks of the marg glasses, you can order a bunch and enjoy the night just fine.

I had a chimichanga and it was exactly as you'd expect. But it was well-made, simple, and didn't cost an arm and a leg. 

The comparison to Tommy's is inevitable, so I'll throw in my non-alcoholic two cents: I'd much rather eat here than there. The alco-philes can argue the maragaritas and tequilas all day without my input, but food wise it really was no contest. Neither is really meant to be just about the food, but I'd go here again for the big portions of Mexican food and the hustle of a Richmond neighborhood restaurant setting.

excerpts: The enchiladas, refried beans, rice, guacamole, salsa, etc.
enchiladas.author: Mal L.
enchiladas.review:
Whoever gives this place a bad rating needs a spanking! When I lived in Outer Richmond this was my go to spot. Drinks are reasonable priced and the food is great every time. 

Make reservations! Call the restaurant leave a message and you're set. I always did this and had no problem getting a table. It gets packed on the weekends and it's not the biggest restaurant. Yes, the hostess the older woman is a little feisty but she's running the show alone and she's busy, who cares. 

Drinks are incredibly strong so don't drive to this place, take a cab LOL. The house margs are so simple yet the best I've ever had. Just stick with those you won't be sorry.

Food - being from Southern Cali I miss my Mexican food and this place hits the spot every single time. The enchiladas, refried beans, rice, guacamole, salsa, etc. Everything is tasty and big portions too! 

Great spot for any occasion even parties.

excerpts: The chile relleno is my usual order now but the fajitas and enchiladas are total comfort food too.
enchiladas.author: Samantha L.
enchiladas.review:
This is an Outer Richmond gem. Bar is always packed with locals. Walk further in and around the bar to get a seat. You'll see almost every person with a margarita in front of them. You can have it blended or on the rocks (with salt if you like). On a hot day, their ice cold double margarita is best blended.. the best adult slushie in the nieghborhood!

Huge portions and their menu has everything you've ever craved for. Everything is so good. I need the recipe for their complimentary salsas, especially the hot one. The chile relleno is my usual order now but the fajitas and enchiladas are total comfort food too.

excerpts: The food here is middling - I got chicken enchiladas with red sauce and black beans and rice.
I was really hungry and the portion of food was good enough to tie me over for the rest of the night, maybe because I ate a lot of the tortilla chips they are the best thing here.
The service and food were closer to a 3 but wish they stepped up their margarita game.
enchiladas.author: Matt D.
enchiladas.review: Margaritas are weak here. I can't believe i fell for the top shelf gimmick too, it wasnt any better than a regular margarita, it was more like a low shelf margarita. I was craving a good margarita too and was so disappointed. The food here is middling - I got chicken enchiladas with red sauce and black beans and rice. I was really hungry and the portion of food was good enough to tie me over for the rest of the night, maybe because I ate a lot of the tortilla chips they are the best thing here. The service and food were closer to a 3 but wish they stepped up their margarita game.

excerpts: The cheese enchiladas were stuffed thick with some foreign kind of salty cheese then smothered with some orange-colored paste (their enchilada sauce).
(Sent it back for another cheese enchilada -- big mistake!)
enchiladas.author: Larry H.
enchiladas.review: What's wrong with the food at Tia Margarita's?  It's SLOP, not fit for a trough!  Typical Mexican restaurant microwaved soup (refried beans), tasteless rice, and some shredded lettuce.  The cheese enchiladas were stuffed thick with some foreign kind of salty cheese then smothered with some orange-colored paste (their enchilada sauce).  My tamale was a gigantic, cold lump of off-colored corn meal about 2-3 inches thick and I could barely find the meat.  (Sent it back for another cheese enchilada -- big mistake!)  The tamale had its own horrible sauce, too.  I can't describe what they called a chile relleno --some greasy, soggy pancake that had a chile in it somewhere.  Horrible!  About an hour after eating, I was so bloated -- like I swallowed a salt lick -- it was unbelievable.  I suffered from severe gas all night long and the next morning, then suffered from constipation for the next full day.  The margaritas were delicious, however.  Go there (if you can ever find a parking place) only for a couple margaritas, friendly bartenders, and some chips and salsa but pass on any food!

excerpts: Enchiladas to be exact.
We decided to pick up Tia Margarita on the way home.
I called to place the order when he picked me up downtown.
*Enchiladas (2) $13.75: corn tortillas rolled around shredded beef and covered with a mild red chili sauce and melted jack cheese
The roommate's.
He didn't like this as the sauce was way too thick.
enchiladas.author: Elena N.
enchiladas.review:
The roommate was craving Mexican food. Enchiladas to be exact. We decided to pick up Tia Margarita on the way home. I called to place the order when he picked me up downtown. The order was ready about 10 minutes after we arrive.

*Chips and Salsas
If we ate here, they would have given us chips and salsa, so I'm happy they were nice enough to pack some. There's two different salsa. One is spicy and packs a kick! My mouth actually felt like it was on fire towards the end of our meal. I wasn't expecting that. Mixing the two makes for a good balance.

All orders are served with rice, salad and your choice of refried or black beans (we got refried beans with everything):

*Chef's special combo ($22.75): One third each - Carne asada, Pollo asada, Gambas
This was my order. The shrimp were garlicky and buttery. The chicken had a good char and flavor. The steak was slightly tough, but still good. You can ask for corn or flour tortillas with this plate.

*Enchiladas (2) $13.75: corn tortillas rolled around shredded beef and covered with a mild red chili sauce and melted jack cheese
The roommate's. He didn't like this as the sauce was way too thick. Had the consistency of a lighter peanut butter which just tasted weird.

*Chimichanga (1) $13.25: crisp large flour tortilla rolled around chicken and rice with guacamole (no sour cream)
It's kind of bland with just the rice and chicken filling. Super oily as well.

I'd say the food deserves about 3 stars, but the server taking care of me was super nice! Asked me if I wanted more salsa, utensils and napkins, etc. Most places wouldn't care when it comes to take out orders. But the server that helped me out bumped this review up to 4 stars!

excerpts: If you are looking for that old school Mexican American restaurant that serves enchiladas smothered in sauce and cheese on a heated plate, this is it.
Tia Margarita reminded me of the Mexican food I grew up with.
I have no idea if it's authentic but who cares.
enchiladas.author: Ada C.
enchiladas.review:
If you are looking for that old school Mexican American restaurant that serves enchiladas smothered in sauce and cheese on a heated plate, this is it.  Tia Margarita reminded me of the Mexican food I grew up with. I have no idea if it's authentic but who cares. It tastes good and the margaritas are top notch!

I had a small combo plate of shredded chicken enchilada and chile relleno which came with yummy refried beans, rice and that shredded iceberg lettuce that no one ever eats. Very tasty and totally hit the spot. 

Definitely worth stopping by if you are in the area!

excerpts: Your chicken enchiladas used to be great.
enchiladas.author: Veronica M.
enchiladas.review:
Oh, Tia Margarita,
I used to love you.
But the last few times...
not so much.

I know you're an SF native joint.
I know you're old school style Mexican.
I know you're a classic.
I know you're neighborhood.

You're very generous.  My steak was practically as big as the plate!  Yes, you've certainly induced countless food comas over the years.

But huge portions don't mask mediocrity.  Too much of a bad thing is not a good thing.

Your basics are strong.  Love your salsa, rice & beans.  But entrees are hit or miss.  Your chicken enchiladas used to be great.  Not dry & bland. 

Same goes for your tacos.  But, donde esta el sabor?

Que Paso?

You do make a mean margarita.  I think they're the best thing about you.

Your service is nice.  Sometimes slow, but always nice.  

If only the last couple of times the stench of cleaning fluid or insect repellant wasn't so strong.  It's most unsavory.  Especially for dining.

You're still an institution in SF...

I may have to love you less, but I won't leave you.  

3 stars.

excerpts: The Cheese Enchiladas came with Chicken and no tortillas nor black beans were served as ordered, only re-fried beans.
enchiladas.author: Larry H.
enchiladas.review:
All I can say from the beginning, San Fransisco does not know how to do Mexican Food, especially this establishment.  Situated in a neighborhood where parking is impossible and you need to bay $8 to park just to eat starts you off in a bad mood.

The salsa for the chips have a ketchup y taste to it.  They need to ditch it and use the Pico De Gallo that is used on their black beans as that combination was one of the best I have ever heard.

The orders were late, the orders came out wrong, the service was very long and it is incredibly loud.  I believe people go there for the booze as they were giving very small shots of Tequila to get the mood going.

The fajitas were nothing more than pieces of steak and chicken basically stir fried at best.  The Cheese Enchiladas came with Chicken and no tortillas nor black beans were served as ordered, only re-fried beans.  

That being said, the QC is terrible, the menu should really be tasted with someone with authentic Hispanic culinary skills behind them.  

Lastly, the service was abysmal.  The only reason I do not give this establishment one star, is that the black beans with the pico de gallo were to die for and I would highly recommend that to everyone!

excerpts: I don't expect much from the food at a place like this, but I found my dish, enchiladas rancheras, to be delicious.
I enjoyed my margarita too, but my friend was disappointed to find out he had been given a Double when he didn't specify the size he wanted.
It sounds like if you order a margarita it's on you to specify Single, otherwise the default order placed is for the Double.  :
enchiladas.author: Susan B.
enchiladas.review:
This is the kind of 1970's mexican place you don't see much of anymore, with a pleasant, lively vibe, kind and attentive servers, giant plates covered in starch, cheese and iceberg lettuce, and understated but charming decor.  I don't expect much from the food at a place like this, but I found my dish, enchiladas rancheras, to be delicious.  I enjoyed my margarita too, but my friend was disappointed to find out he had been given a Double when he didn't specify the size he wanted.  It sounds like if you order a margarita it's on you to specify Single, otherwise the default order placed is for the Double.  :\

Tia Margarita's reminds me of Trevino's in El Cerrito.  Same kind of old-school vibe, strong drinks, plates covered in carbs and dairy, plus they have a parking lot!

excerpts: Four of us had tamales, enchiladas x 2, tacos, and beverages for a total of $80-something before tip.
More of a Mexican Applebee's than a Mission satellite.
Sans barefoot wannabe hipsters, too.
I still don't know how the dude from Oaxaqueña bore pedaling with just his feet when I saw him fixie-ing around later on.
enchiladas.author: Dan B.
enchiladas.review:
Abuela is cute. to. death. The scripted English order-taking, the over-politeness, the constant breaking of our table conversation to ask if we wanted stuff, the bringing my friend someone else's order, the getting my order wrong, the hearing aid(?), the limp... instantly endearing. How could anyone not want to give her a big hug every time she materializes tableside?

Funny thing is, a good bit of our server's charm would've been decidedly not cute had it been from anyone else (including my actual abuela).

Four of us had tamales, enchiladas x 2, tacos, and beverages for a total of $80-something before tip. More of a Mexican Applebee's than a Mission satellite. Sans barefoot wannabe hipsters, too. I still don't know how the dude from Oaxaqueña bore pedaling with just his feet when I saw him fixie-ing around later on.

excerpts: We had the fajitas, the gambas, the chiles rellenos, the burritos, the enchiladas, etc and it was all excellent.
enchiladas.author: Emilia G.
enchiladas.review:
Dinner was excellent tonite!  The guacamole was delicious but pricey.  The chips were freshly fried.  They were warm when they got to the table.  The salsas were delicious.  The rice and beans were excellent too.  We had the fajitas, the gambas, the chiles rellenos, the burritos, the enchiladas, etc and it was all excellent.  

OUR WAITER WAS THE BEST!

I've been there in the past and thought the food was meh!  But today it was excellent!  I will definitely go back while they have this chef.  

The Sangrias and Margaritas were excellent, too!

The hostess had it together, too!

Don't change a thing for a long time, please!

excerpts: I would recommend the quesdilla and the enchiladas.
enchiladas.author: Wil S.
enchiladas.review: My girlfriend always passed this place and thought this was the "poppin'" place to be! Me not being a huge fan of Mexican food I was a bit hesitant but we went and at first I thought, "okay fine..." I was pleasantly surprised. I would recommend the quesdilla and the enchiladas. I'm more partial to the quesdilla myself, though the gf prefers the enchilada. What really impressed me was the service. Almost the moment I finished the salsa they replaced the salsa and refilled the chips  (chips and salsa are complementary btw). That's really what prompted this review was that simple little event. My only complaint is there is a split entree charge so just be aware of that. All in all, I was impressed considering I eat mexican food once a year at most lol

excerpts: What we had - steak fajitas, enchiladas, tamales, all with rice and beans
enchiladas.author: Chris D.
enchiladas.review:
"What the f*^$ was that?!" Pretty much the only thing I could say after eating here. Sure as hell isn't very good I can you that much. I've had plain white rice with more flavor than any of their dishes. More love was put into the concept of the movie Gigli then these dishes. Yes the margaritas as strong but it doesn't make them good. Seriously they serve rice pilaf here instead of the traditional. My head almost exploded. 1 star, well because I have to at least, but for their friendly staff.

What we had - steak fajitas, enchiladas, tamales, all with rice and beans

I will continue to have nightmares about this place like I was in 'Nam.

excerpts: I ordered the 2 chicken enchiladas plate, which came within 15 minutes.
The enchiladas were huge, with large side portions too.
enchiladas.author: Shelby R.
enchiladas.review:
Just moved to the Inner Richmond and I'm so excited to have this place nearby!

The chips and salsa come out right away and definitely taste homemade. (Try not to eat too many...) I ordered the 2 chicken enchiladas plate, which came within 15 minutes. The enchiladas were huge, with large side portions too. 

The staff isn't overly friendly but they checked in on us to make sure all was well. I would recommend making a reservation in advance, just to get one of the nice window booths. If not, there's plenty of walk-in tables too.

excerpts: And Tia Special Enchiladas is just like the abuela.
Just stay out of the back room unless you enjoy not watching the game during dinner and lots of little kids.
enchiladas.author: J M.
enchiladas.review:
I really like Tia's.  My criteria for a great Mexican meal is chips & salsa; top shelf margaritas;  order of guacamole. 
Tia's scores on all fronts. A couple of double top shelf margaritas will make you extremely happy. And Tia Special Enchiladas is just like the abuela.
Just stay out of the back room unless you enjoy not watching the game during dinner and lots of little kids.

excerpts: The green cheese enchiladas were excellent.
The atmosphere is light and the conversation at the bar is always enjoyable.
enchiladas.author: Me M.
enchiladas.review: Once again Francisco made the best Margaritas!  The green cheese enchiladas were excellent. The atmosphere is light and the conversation at the bar is always enjoyable.

excerpts: I had the green enchiladas and they are decent with good amount of chicken.
The thing I didn't like was the lettuce side with salsa on top as if it was the dressing.
That is not Mexican.
The margaritas on the other side are very good.
I had the Top Shelf frozen one and it's delish!
Would totally recommend them.
The atmosphere is good, I sat in the dining area behind the bar but the horseshoe bar area had a lively and fun vibe.
I'd say that's the spot to be in.
enchiladas.author: Luis O.
enchiladas.review: The food is very average which sucks because at first it looks very authentic. They lack variety in their menu. I had the green enchiladas and they are decent with good amount of chicken. The thing I didn't like was the lettuce side with salsa on top as if it was the dressing. That is not Mexican. The margaritas on the other side are very good. I had the Top Shelf frozen one and it's delish! Would totally recommend them. The atmosphere is good, I sat in the dining area behind the bar but the horseshoe bar area had a lively and fun vibe. I'd say that's the spot to be in.

excerpts: we decided to both order the Enchiladas Racheras - two enchiladas covered in cheese and salsa, a side of beans (refried or black), rice, and salad.
The enchiladas were very good and actually pretty tasty - I loved the bell peppers and onions.
The rice was a little bland and needed some spice and the beans were pretty standard.
enchiladas.author: Stephanie C.
enchiladas.review:
In the spirit of Cinco de Drinko, we decided to meet some friends for food and margaritas at Tia Margarita's. This was my first time dining here and I was excited to try a new Mexican place. 

However, my excitement turned into disappointment when we learned that we couldn't join our friends since there was an 2 hour time limit per table for Cinco de Mayo (they had already been there awhile). The wait for a table was running an hour and a half, so the boyfriend and I decided to hunt for a spot at the bar. Luckily, about 15 minutes later we found seats at the bar.

The bartenders were extremely fast and efficient with drinks and were very nice. They could definitely keep up with the crowds, so you didn't have to wait long for drinks - always a plus! They also gave us free chips and salsa for starters, which we loved.

We were starving so we decided to both order the Enchiladas Racheras - two enchiladas covered in cheese and salsa, a side of beans (refried or black), rice, and salad. The enchiladas were very good and actually pretty tasty - I loved the bell peppers and onions. The rice was a little bland and needed some spice and the beans were pretty standard. Overall, I enjoyed my meal but felt it was missing 'something'.

While the service was great and the food satisfying, I don't know if I'd make the trek out here for some Mexican food when there are cheaper and closer options for me in the Mission. However, I wouldn't count Tia Margarita's out when I'm in the neighborhood.

excerpts: We were given two dirty plates of our own which we sent back after having to yell "EXCUSE ME" since we were barely checked on by a waitress who didn't even know what types of enchiladas were available.
We were given one clean plate and another dirty plate.
enchiladas.author: Ashley M.
enchiladas.review:
When I looked around for a nice place to grab some margaritas on Cinco De Mayo I thought a place with the name "Margarita" in it would be perfect . I was wrong. When my friend and I walked into the restaurant we were stared at for 20 seconds by the bartender and the waitress. After about 30 seconds of awkwardness in a non crowded room, "Are you here for dinner?" we were finally asked by the waitress. We decided to sit outside, which was nice on a warm day. 

I asked right off about the margaritas and was told, "We have strawberry and regular margaritas. We have well and top shelf on our menu and just so you know we will be serving them in plastic cups because you guys are sitting outside."

No problem I thought. Well margaritas can't be more than 4-5 dollars each. I was wrong about that also. 

First of all no one lets you know that the portions are HUGE. They can easily feed two hungry people and I'm really glad we shared a plate considering it was $15 and there were no options of anything cheaper. We were given two dirty plates of our own which we sent back after having to yell "EXCUSE ME" since we were barely checked on by a waitress who didn't even know what types of enchiladas were available. We were given one clean plate and another dirty plate. Come on....

The food was so-so. I wouldn't consider it authentic Mexican. The rice had cold spots and the sauces weren't even flavorful at all.

When we got the bill we see that the margaritas are 9$ each. "Oh they are double shot margaritas for Cinco De Mayo..." says the waitress after not letting us know when we originally asked. If you have a special that day you need to let the customers know when they sit down! 

I told her I wasn't paying for it and she made the drinks 6 dollars each which was nice but I was still frustrated. I came to find out the woman who seated us was the OWNER!? Wow. Not even the owner could inform us of the specials for Cinco De Mayo in an unpacked restaurant. 

I have no idea if this place is usually good on a non-holiday but I was extremely disappointed. I would have rather grabbed some grub at the taqueria around the corner on Geary and made my own margaritas at home.

excerpts: The margaritas are pretty damned good (and strong), the spicy salsa is actually spicy, and the menu features things like fajitas, chimichangas, and ranchero sauce enchiladas.
Service was great, and the portions were huge.
I'll happily return any time I have a hankering for tex-mex but don't feel like hopping on a plane to Austin or Dallas.
enchiladas.author: Joshua W.
enchiladas.review: Ex-pat Texans listen up.  You know that run of the mill tex-mex place that was in the small town you grew up in?  The one with the vinyl booths, cheesy mexican music, unlimited chips and salsa, and not-great-but-good-enough-tex-mex?  Well Tia Margarita is pretty much that place, but in San Francisco.  Yes, they don't have queso, and yes the food here won't hold a candle to good tex-mex from Texas, but everything here is good enough and close enough to what you're homesick for to scratch that tex-mex itch.  The margaritas are pretty damned good (and strong), the spicy salsa is actually spicy, and the menu features things like fajitas, chimichangas, and ranchero sauce enchiladas.  Service was great, and the portions were huge.  I'll happily return any time I have a hankering for tex-mex but don't feel like hopping on a plane to Austin or Dallas.

excerpts: Ordered the Chili con queso, fajitas, and enchiladas.
Food was terrific, the chili con queso was SUPER stringy.
All the food was good and left full and happy with a doggy bag.
enchiladas.author: AJ L.
enchiladas.review: Our taxi driver recommended this place while dropping us off at our AirBNB. The server brought over some chips and two types of salsa, but didn't tell us that one of them was HOT as hell. Ordered the Chili con queso, fajitas, and enchiladas. Food was terrific, the chili con queso was SUPER stringy. All the food was good and left full and happy with a doggy bag.

excerpts: The meats satisfied, and the chile rellenos and enchiladas were good enough!
enchiladas.author: Luke M.
enchiladas.review:
We loved this place when stopping in the day before my birthday. The mission was nachos and nachos we got! The food is pretty good. The meats satisfied, and the chile rellenos and enchiladas were good enough! 

But seriously, once we got a margarita from an AWESOME bartender, who more than happily tweaked ours because they were a little two sweet to start with, we swore that we'd LOVE the place as long as the food was even remotely good. 

They make a lot of margaritas here, and they seem to really love doing it!

excerpts: I ordered the Enchiladas Verdes plate.
enchiladas.author: Annalise F.
enchiladas.review:
Two girlfriends and I went here last night after discovering Tommy's is currently closed. (I guess we all deserve a vacation from time to time.) We really wanted margaritas, and those are difficult to come by in the Richmond. 

We waited about 20 minutes for a table (this place is deceiving large) and ordered two margaritas on the rocks. Holy shitballs mom- those things were STRONG! Even after a full meal (I only had 1 margarita) I could feel the buzz. Was it the best margarita ever? No. Not even close. Was it bad? No. Best Marg in the city still goes to Velvet Cantina.

Anywho, our server was SUPER nice. The third girl showed up a little late, and he had no problem letting us sit at our table and just wait. Ok, time for food reviews.

Chips and Salsa- our server brought three types of salsa- and one of them was HOT. The other two were on the chunkier side, and tasted pretty standard. (Though they did make the doubt if they were made in the actual restaurant.)

I ordered the Enchiladas Verdes plate. It was fine, but it didn't blow my socks off. 

I'd come back to Tia's in a pinch, but the whole experience was A-V-E-R-A-G-E. 

On a sidenote: I could taste garlic well into the next day. I'm not sure what was so garlicky, but I hate the aftertaste!

excerpts: I tried the tia margarita enchiladas which were amazing.
Be prepared to take home some left overs!
enchiladas.author: Mamta B.
enchiladas.review: This is a great little neighborhood place. The margaritas are strong and the food portions are huge. Great place to go to watch some sports and be slowly induced into a food coma. I tried the tia margarita enchiladas which were amazing. Be prepared to take home some left overs!

excerpts: They can't even make good cheese enchiladas or truly hot salsa.
The pasty refried beans taste canned and the scrimpy combo plate salad has a watery, flavorless dressing.
Finding parking is a nightmare.
Not worth the trip.
Unfortunately, the best Mexican restaurants in San Francisco closed years ago.
enchiladas.author: Pam J.
enchiladas.review: Overpriced, small portions of gringo-style, mediocre food. They can't even make good cheese enchiladas or truly hot salsa. The pasty refried beans taste canned and the scrimpy combo plate salad has a watery, flavorless dressing. Finding parking is a nightmare. Not worth the trip. Unfortunately, the best Mexican restaurants in San Francisco closed years ago.

excerpts: I ordered enchiladas with sour cream and a double top shelf margarita.
enchiladas.author: Andrew M.
enchiladas.review:
I ordered enchiladas with sour cream and a double top shelf margarita.

Every single item on my plate was tasteless. I had to use the salsa that came with the chips for flavor.

excerpts: I ordered the enchiladas and the sauce was so terrible it tasted like bland tomato and had no flavor to it.
enchiladas.author: Lissette L.
enchiladas.review:
As a SoCal native I've been trying to find a decent Mexican establishment and when this one was recommended I was so excited that I'd potentially find my Mexican spot in SF and this definitely was not it. I went on a Friday night and mind you it's a really busy night but it took us an hour to get our food with no updates from our waiter. Our waiter was MIA and I constantly had to hound whoever was around to ask to refill our drinks. When we finally got our food it was mediocre to say the least. I ordered the enchiladas and the sauce was so terrible it tasted like bland tomato and had no flavor to it. If I had to rate this restaurant solely based on food I would give it 2 stars but the reason why I'm giving this establishment one star is because I'm so disappointed by the service. 

My guest had strict religious practices where they are unable to consume beef. Half-way through eating their 'chicken dish' my guest noticed that there were chunks of beef in the 'chicken' dish. We immediately asked to speak to a manager and when my guest stated that they were highly offended by the beef in their dish due to religious practices, the manager rudely said 'that's chicken, there's no beef.'
