I had to pull out the chunks of beef and put them on the side of the plate to show her that there was in fact beef in the dish. And even still, she questioned the fact that it was beef. SO RUDE. The manager's questioning of our rightful accusation was rude and not customer service-oriented at all. Instead of addressing the offensive nature of what had just occurred, she repeatedly insisted we order something else. Why would we want to order anything else when you've lost all the trust of your customer by not taking their concern seriously? At that point, we were so irritated that we asked for the bill, paid, and left. I will never be returning here again.

excerpts: If you like the kind of Mexican food that includes tacos, enchiladas, guacamole and fresh salsa, this is a great place.
Watch out, it will be full of people, including lots of families.
Everyone loves it, so you may have a wait.
You can't go wrong here and the drinks are terrific -- very generous.
Plus, the prices are reasonable.
enchiladas.author: Nancy R.
enchiladas.review: I first went to this place 20 years ago and loved it.  It is equally good now.  If you like the kind of Mexican food that includes tacos, enchiladas, guacamole and fresh salsa, this is a great place.  Watch out, it will be full of people, including lots of families.  Everyone loves it, so you may have a wait.  You can't go wrong here and the drinks are terrific -- very generous.  Plus, the prices are reasonable.

excerpts: I thoroughly enjoyed the enchiladas with shrimp.
It's a great date spot or
just to hang out with some friends.
I think they have a happy hour as well [but don't quote me]
enchiladas.author: Natalie F.
enchiladas.review:
not gonna lie...I got trashed here!
The Margaritas are strong folks....especially if you're drinking doubles like my ass was. Which makes it hard to participate in the Trivia night [first Thursday of each month] that they have. The food is yummy and the portions are huge. I thoroughly enjoyed the enchiladas with shrimp.  It's a great date spot or just to hang out with some friends. I think they have a happy hour as well [but don't quote me]

excerpts: Stick to the basic Mexican staples like tamales, burritos and enchiladas which are very good.
The empanadas are terrible, the taquitos, carne asada and rice are very average.
The fajitas are very good
but you only get maybe
enchiladas.author: Mike L.
enchiladas.review:
Hit & Miss Mexican food (stick to basic staples) but probably the best authentic margaritas in California (no mix).

UPDATE: I am adding a star since I found some of the food to be excellent. Stick to the basic Mexican staples like tamales, burritos and enchiladas which are very good. The empanadas are terrible, the taquitos, carne asada and rice are very average. The fajitas are very good but you only get maybe 3 oz. of steak.

Summary:
-----------------
I give it 4 overall stars: 5 stars for the margaritas, 5 for the bar staff service/attitude but 3 1/2 stars average for food (some great, some meh). I also give it 2 stars for waitress service/attitude (the old lady is the worst) and 3 for the business hours (they close at 10:30 Fridays!). Did I mention the margis rule???


Full Review:
-------------------
I have eaten here a few times and was disappointed with the Mexican food the first few times, having grown up in San Diego and been weaned on the best. After 12 years in SF I know there is much better Mexican restaurants around (La Barca and Tortilla Heights are two great ones) and even many better taquerias (La Taqueria and Nick's are epic). But the basic staples I have discovered to be very good. What has always kept me coming back (probably 15 times now) is the ultra friendly bartender (manager?) Francisco and his truly authentic margaritas. 

The margaritas here are made using only good quality silver tequila, cointreau triple sec and fresh lime juice (so no sugary mix). I rarely drink margaritas because those made with the sweet and sour mix give me brutal heart burn but I have no problem taking down a few authentic margaritas and quite enjoy those served here. Just one of the jumbo margis will smack you in the face and two will make you delightfully toasted and much smarter, funnier and better looking. 

The other cool thing about the place is that most of the patrons (like myself) are locals from the Richmond/Seacliff neighborhoods so on a Friday night you see lots of familiar faces. 

The only other bummer is the place has limited hours (they close at 10:30 Friday and they do not open on weekends until 4PM!). WTF? Anyways, if you go for the margis and basic Mexican staples. Also, definitely sit at the bar as Francisco (the more outgoing, mexi-beach bum bartender) is much friendlier and efficient than the wait staff I have experienced.

excerpts: , I had the chicken enchiladas with a fried egg on top.
Highly recommend the fried egg made for an excellent touch.
Seems like the place is always busy with locals which is a good sign.
Would give more stars if the service was a little friendlier.
enchiladas.author: Zino M.
enchiladas.review: The service is horrible you have to know this going in, but they pour very strong and very good fresh margaritas. A couple of those baby's and you'll be feeling a nice buzz no doubt. The food is pretty standard Mexican food but I really enjoyed my meal, I had the chicken enchiladas with a fried egg on top. Highly recommend the fried egg made for an excellent touch. Seems like the place is always busy with locals which is a good sign. Would give more stars if the service was a little friendlier.

excerpts: I ordered enchiladas rancheros without beans
so I can't comment on those.
The rice tasted and looked  like plain white rice with fake butter.
There was no Mexican seasoning to it at all.
The salad was huge, just shredded lettuce with tasteless salsa.
Huge portions of rice and salad compared to the size of the enchiladas.
The cheese on top of the enchiladas was melted but the inside cheese was not.
The onions and peppers on top of the enchiladas were huge chunks, a little dicing might have helped.
enchiladas.author: Madeline M.
enchiladas.review:
I have to agree with the bad reviews here for the food.

I hadn't eaten here in years although I've lived in the Richmond District since 1977.  I should have stayed away.

I'm giving it 2 stars instead of one because my dining companions had margaritas which they said were excellent.

 We were there around 6 on a Friday and had to wait about ten minutes, not bad and I thought since it was so busy it must be good.  We were put in a room with 5 tables and the other 4 tables all had children at them, One was having a birthday party for a one year old.   So if you have kids this may be the place for you.  The food is very bland, so kids probably like that. It was very noisy even without the children and all the kuds made it worse as when one quieted down another would start shrieking.

My companions ordered their margaritas but after finishing them, the waiter never asked if they'd like another.  This was in spite of the fact that our table was right next to a little window to the bar where all the waiters picked up the drinks.  So they had to ask him when he came by to pick up another order.

The food took a long time to come and although they said the plates were hot they were not.  I ordered enchiladas rancheros without beans so I can't comment on those.  The rice tasted and looked  like plain white rice with fake butter.  There was no Mexican seasoning to it at all.  The salad was huge, just shredded lettuce with tasteless salsa.  Huge portions of rice and salad compared to the size of the enchiladas.  The cheese on top of the enchiladas was melted but the inside cheese was not.  The onions and peppers on top of the enchiladas were huge chunks, a little dicing might have helped.

No one ever came and refilled the water, I had to ask for more water and it took a while for him to bring more.  We had to ask the waiter for the check after our plates had been cleared for at least 15 minutes.  Then he never came back to take the credit card, after another 15 minutes I went looking for him in the hallway where they were coming out with the food.  I couldn't find him so I just gave it to another waiter, the hostess ended up bringing it back to us.

Our waiter spent quite a bit of time laughing and visiting with two others parties in our room, but I guess since we were not regulars he no time for us.

I will not be back.

I guess if you like their margarites have some at the bar.

excerpts: We had enchiladas, tamales, tacos, and flautas.
What a disappointment.
The dishes were bland and tasteless.
We had to add salt to every single serving and that is a no, no in my book.
Although the portions are big, it did not make up for the mediorce options on the menu.
enchiladas.author: Chau H.
enchiladas.review:
The first time I visited this establishment, we were denied because it was 10:40pm and they close at 11:00pm. It was interesting because the hostess gave us a table but a waitress came over and said "No, no. We are closed. The kitchen is closed." No apologies, just flat out denial. 

"If at first you don't succeed, dust yourself off and try again." Right? Right. So now I'm back and this time we arrived earlier and were seated right away. We sat in the back of the restaurant which was quite disappointing because the room was too dark. I struggled to read the menu and enjoy the food since our table was only lit by a tiny candle. One star down.

When it came to the food, the chips and salsa were a-ok. The salsa tasted like a fusion of canned tomatoes and ketchup, which I can assure you is not a good combination. Two stars down. However, the green salsa was good and extra spicy. The chips were super crunchy and highly addictive. 

For starters, we had the chicharrones and I felt it was overpowered with cumin. It was crispy but too salty. The gambas al ajillo (shrimp with garlic and butter sauce) was good but nothing special. It's paired with flour tortillas and that made it fun to eat. 

On to the main courses. We had enchiladas, tamales, tacos, and flautas. What a disappointment. The dishes were bland and tasteless. We had to add salt to every single serving and that is a no, no in my book.  Although the portions are big, it did not make up for the mediorce options on the menu. Three stars down.

As for service, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She always made sure we had our refills on drinks, tortillas, and chips and salsa. We didn't try their margaritas but overheard from the two tables next to us that they were "pretty damn strong." Too bad I won't be coming back to give you an updated review on that.

I should of known that it wasn't meant for me to try the food here when we were already denied the first time around. That was a sign and I should of trusted it instead of shopping for a restaurant on an empty stomach.

excerpts: Went last week , I would not recommend this place , to me the chicken enchiladas had no flavor at all.
I have tasted better.
A waste of my money but never again.
enchiladas.author: Janet V.
enchiladas.review: Went last week , I would not recommend this place , to me the chicken enchiladas had no flavor at all. I have tasted better. A waste of my money but never again.

excerpts: I ended up ordering Tia Margarita Special Enchiladas which were actually pretty tasty.
enchiladas.author: Thea M.
enchiladas.review:
I enjoyed this place but wouldn't be my first choice when trying to pick a place to dine. There wasn't anything particularlly bad about it, I just wasn't over the moon about it.

The service was eh... They rushed us in ordering which I HATE because clearly if I haven't ordered yet I don't know what I want. 

They give you chips and salsa to munch on before the meal which is nice!
I ended up ordering Tia Margarita Special Enchiladas which were actually pretty tasty. 
I also ordered a blended double margarita which was the best part of the meal!!

we sat in the back of the restaurant but in the front they have a bar and TV so I could see myself going there again to watch a Giants game and have some drinks with friends.

excerpts: The enchiladas rancheros were only OK.
enchiladas.author: Rachel G.
enchiladas.review:
Huge portions! Even the plates themselves are massive!

Good chips and salsa. The burrito plate comes with 2 burritos and they're big - so much food.The enchiladas rancheros were only OK.
The beef is ground, ugh, but the chicken is shredded and good. 

Service was fine.

excerpts: The chicken enchiladas are really good!
enchiladas.author: Ryan H.
enchiladas.review: The food is great. I really like the neighborhood feel about this restaurant. I got to say that the margarita's weren't anything to write home about. But I plan to go back for seconds! The chicken enchiladas are really good! :)

excerpts:
just good warm chips, salsa, refried beans, melted cheese, i usually get enchiladas or tamales, and they are both drenched in sauce, which is good to me.  
everything is warm, hearty and scoopy.
i have thrown up in the planters across the street, because the margaritas snuck up on me.  
they do take out.
their bar area is great.  
they have trivia nights that apparantly are pretty challenging and lively.
thanks for reading!
enchiladas.author: yayoi s.
enchiladas.review:
i have seen ed hardy here.  he lives up the street from me.  I live a block away.  and do my laundry across the street.
watch out.  you will get sloshed at this place.  the food is similar to tommys up the street.  just good warm chips, salsa, refried beans, melted cheese, i usually get enchiladas or tamales, and they are both drenched in sauce, which is good to me.  everything is warm, hearty and scoopy.
i have thrown up in the planters across the street, because the margaritas snuck up on me.  
they do take out.
their bar area is great.  they have trivia nights that apparantly are pretty challenging and lively.
thanks for reading!

excerpts: I love the enchiladas they serve there.
They are absolutely delicious!
enchiladas.author: Jennifer C.
enchiladas.review:
I have been going to this place off and on for years.  The staff is always friendly and I remember the portions being rather large.  I love the enchiladas they serve there.  They are absolutely delicious! I always remember the staff members smiling and looking like they're having a good time.  

The place is rather dark and you can enjoy an intimate dinner with a small party.  

It has been a while since I have gone but I think about this place from time to time.  I think its time I go back.

excerpts: The green sauce is nice and zippy if you get the enchiladas.
And the margaritas are just fine.
Overall, I'd give Tia 3.5 estrellas.
enchiladas.author: Andi T.
enchiladas.review:
I do love a good sit-down Mexican restaurant.  This is a good one to hit after you spend an afternoon chasing small people at the CA Academy of Sciences.  The front room is all loungey christmas lights and booths.  The big back room is for those of us with kids and little time to lounge.

Service is fine, unless you get that one really slow (but nice) lady.  The food comes out quickly and it's tasty.  The green sauce is nice and zippy if you get the enchiladas.  And the margaritas are just fine.  Overall, I'd give Tia 3.5 estrellas.

excerpts: it comes with two enchiladas covered in melted cheese, rice, beans, and a salsa salad.
i like everything!
and i like how this is a neighborhood mexican restaurant that has survived for over fifty years!
oh, and their complimentary chips and homemade salsa are also really good
, we always ask for seconds (sometimes thirds).
enchiladas.author: Sabrina L.
enchiladas.review: this review is solely for the chicken enchilada plate, which is what i get here every time. it comes on a huge plate so that it seems like you're getting a lot, but all the food items are pretty spread out. i still leave pretty full though! it comes with two enchiladas covered in melted cheese, rice, beans, and a salsa salad. i like everything! and i like how this is a neighborhood mexican restaurant that has survived for over fifty years! oh, and their complimentary chips and homemade salsa are also really good, we always ask for seconds (sometimes thirds).

excerpts: I ordered the chicken enchiladas and my father ordered the burrito and chili relleno combo.
All were bland and uninspired.
As we worked through our food with sadness and dismay, a crowd of Irish folk developed all around.
This was probably the highlight of the meal listening to them sing and drink loudly.
Always a good time.
enchiladas.author: Thor M.
enchiladas.review:
I really wanted to love Tia's. I live 5 blocks from it and there is nothing I enjoy more than great mexican food. I had heard mixed reviews about the place, but decided that I must try it for myself. This was a bad idea. 

After a long day of wild boar hunting with my dad we decided to quell our starving bellies at Tia's. We step into the restaurant, and surprisingly, it is not at all crowded on a Saturday night (bad sign). Nobody helps to seat us at first, but finally the bartender tells us to take any table. 

A sweet, yet awkward Irish waitress (love the accent) brought us menus. However, we then waited 20 minutes to get water and to order. This annoyance was tempered by the moderately good chips and salsa that a busser brought us. The chips were good, seemed fresh, but a little thick for my taste. The spicy salsa (they also have a non-spicy) was quite good, but didn't change the overall experience. 

I ordered the chicken enchiladas and my father ordered the burrito and chili relleno combo. All were bland and uninspired. As we worked through our food with sadness and dismay, a crowd of Irish folk developed all around. This was probably the highlight of the meal listening to them sing and drink loudly. Always a good time. Although, it was quite an odd sight seeing Irish people crowd up a mexican food restaurant. 

Overall, I will probably never go back to Tia's. Not because it was the worst thing I've ever tasted, but because with so many good restaurants in SF there are plenty of places to fill my tummy.

excerpts: Finally after ordering 2  cheese enchiladas, she walks away and says, 'sounds good...
2 CHICKEN enchiladas'!!!
WTF!!!
enchiladas.author: Rajeev R.
enchiladas.review:
My wife and I decided to try this place out last night...on our hunt for a good Mexican sit down restaraunt.  We were a little wary after reading the reviews on Yelp, but decided to give it a shot.  Not the best idea.

Our waitress was very nice, but really did not explain any of the dishes to us.  We are both vegetarian and it took literally 5 minutes to explain that to her...most of the time we just got a blank stare.  Finally after ordering 2  cheese enchiladas, she walks away and says, 'sounds good...2 CHICKEN enchiladas'!!!  WTF!!!  I ran down and corrected the order and she just laughed it off.

The food arrives pretty quickly and was not very good at all.  The portions were very large, but there seemed to be no flavor in our food.  The enchilada sauce completely lacked any flavor and the plate was below mediocre.  The salsa tasted like spaghetti sauce.

Overall, would not recommend this place to anyone.

excerpts: Granted, if your menu is limited to burritos, enchiladas and fajitas, with obligatory sides of rice and beans, then you're about as Mexican as Panda Express
is Chinese.
But in the meantime, Mrs M likes her enchiladas, and I like my free bottomless chips and salsa, so I figured we'd give this a shot.
Food was good but unmemorable--except that they gave us butter with the tortillas!
enchiladas.author: Wes M.
enchiladas.review:
Lost in the blur of SF taquerias is the fact that there's precious few *sit-down* Mexican restaurants in the city--I could probably count the ones I know of on the fingers of one hand.  If you do find yourself sitting down for south-of-the-border fare, it's probably upscale Peruvian or down-home Salvadoran or some such.  Maybe Mexi-joints have been deemed too suburban?  Granted, if your menu is limited to burritos, enchiladas and fajitas, with obligatory sides of rice and beans, then you're about as Mexican as Panda Express is Chinese.  If only some bold chef would see this as a challenge and open a place specializing in authentic Mexi-dishes (perhaps even limit it to a specific region), I'm confident our pretentious citizenry would eat it up.

But in the meantime, Mrs M likes her enchiladas, and I like my free bottomless chips and salsa, so I figured we'd give this a shot.  Food was good but unmemorable--except that they gave us butter with the tortillas!  I was baffled, but Wes M never turns down free fat (seriously, I brought home some Tennessee bacon grease in a ziploc bag from the presidential debate party I went to--long story).

The other problem is that, for a restaurant that has "Margarita" in the name and a $9+ "double" margarita on the menu, it turned out to be disappointingly small, and I think Maria is right that they're pretty weak too (tasty though).  

So in the end, Velvet Cantina remains the undisputed king of the limited competition in this category.  But TM is very like VC in one way: the restaurant has two rooms, and the one with the bar has by far the superious ambiance (indeed, TM's bar is a bit reminiscent of Zam Zam, don't you think?)

excerpts: My boyfriend had the enchiladas and he enjoyed them just as much as I enjoyed my fajitas.
enchiladas.author: Liz K.
enchiladas.review:
I definitely had to try this restaurant because its a block away from where I dwell. I wasn't disappointed like I anticipated. Which is a great thing! 

When you first walk into the restaurant, you are right in front of the crowded bar area. Crowds are a good sign. You have to wind your way around the bar area to the left to get to the hostess stand.

The dining area is dim, but fits the ambience. The mexican music and decor truly makes you feel like you are in a mexican restaurant. Even the fans twirling over head gives you the feeling that you are in Mexico on a hot, hot day despite being in the foggy outer Richmond.

The margaritas are just what a margarita should be. I had a single on the rocks. Whew! Now, I know why the bar area is crowded. These are great and potent with alcohol. Perfect margaritas. The chips and salsa were great while waiting for the food. They give you two types of salsa, one is hot and one is mild. I liked the hot salsa, but the mild is good, too.

I had the chicken fajitas and was not disappointed. The strips of chicken were full of flavor and the tortillas came nice and steamy hot. My boyfriend had the enchiladas and he enjoyed them just as much as I enjoyed my fajitas. The portions are huge, so you must come here hungry and ready to eat.

Overall: Food is okay and the margaritas are tasty.

excerpts: I ordered the tia margarita special enchiladas.
Absolutely delicious!
I am a connoisseur of enchiladas
so I was glad to find some tasty ones.
The service was a bit lax, but other than that pretty good.
enchiladas.author: Jackie B.
enchiladas.review: Stopped in on a rainy Tuesday evening after a friend had a hankering for some Mexican food. I had never been before, but was excited to give it a try. Definitely seems like a local spot. Family friendly/lots of characters at the bar. Started off our meal by ordering some Margaritas, it's a Tuesday after all. Opted for the single over the double. Our margs were shamed by the doubles when brought to the table on the same tray. Next time will go with the double. Fresh hot chips and salsa came to our table (a little late for our liking) we were looking forward to those. Green(hot) salsa was by far my favorite over the red(mild) option. I ordered the tia margarita special enchiladas. Absolutely delicious! I am a connoisseur of enchiladas so I was glad to find some tasty ones. The service was a bit lax, but other than that pretty good.

excerpts: They use real mexican queso in their enchiladas (none of this melted shredded cheese) which was very nice and the guac was super yummy but the meal as a whole was not super spectacular.
However, I loved feeling like I was completely secluded from Clement Street
enchiladas.author: Maria D.
enchiladas.review:
Infinitely better than that other place up the street (you know what I'm talking about) but still pretty mediocre plated Mexican food. Still, It's an excellent place to bring an East Coaster -aka land of bad mexican food- for some conversation and inside jokes when you don't feel like heading over to La Mision.  They use real mexican queso in their enchiladas (none of this melted shredded cheese) which was very nice and the guac was super yummy but the meal as a whole was not super spectacular. However, I loved feeling like I was completely secluded from Clement Street and I've decided I'm the tackiest person alive because if I could combine the interior of this restaurant with the interior of The Page, I would have my dream house. 

Margs were weak and you know how I know this? It's 1:00am, I'm still awake and I haven't made any humiliating phone calls, text messages or emails. And I had two of them. And I had doubles. I should have at least emailed my Danish ex boyfriend at this point.  "Jeg elkser dig, elksling! Please take me away to your magical land of aquavit and smorgasbord!!!!"

excerpts: I am ALL FOR cheeeeesy enchiladas.
But how do you mess that up??
They tasted really bland.
And the refried beans tasted burnt or something.
If you like your margaritas on the 99.9% tequila side, then you will like the margaritas here.
Sorry, I'm not hardcore enough, I do like a little fresh squeezed lime and flavor with my margs.
The chips were fresh and yummy though.
I liked the huge round plates that the food came on, I just wish I had liked the food more.
I don't really think I'm going to try it again though.
Back to Tommy's!
enchiladas.author: Libbi K.
enchiladas.review: I wanted to like it as much as I like Tommy's, but it just isn't so. I am NOT one of those people who complains about Americanized food- I am ALL FOR cheeeeesy enchiladas. But how do you mess that up?? They tasted really bland. And the refried beans tasted burnt or something. If you like your margaritas on the 99.9% tequila side, then you will like the margaritas here. Sorry, I'm not hardcore enough, I do like a little fresh squeezed lime and flavor with my margs. The chips were fresh and yummy though. I liked the huge round plates that the food came on, I just wish I had liked the food more. I don't really think I'm going to try it again though. Back to Tommy's!

excerpts: I got their "signature enchiladas" and thought they were pretty bland run-of-the-mill cheese enchiladas.
enchiladas.author: Amy A.
enchiladas.review:
Because I'm an avid fan of margaritas and sit-down Mexican restaurants, Tia Margarita had been on my list to try for a while.  

The margaritas were just what I was craving: strong, generous sizes, and in crazy cactus glasses.  Nothing pretentious, here.  They completely hit the spot.  $9 for a large.

The food was just OK--nothing to write home about but certainly nothing to complain about either.  I got their "signature enchiladas" and thought they were pretty bland run-of-the-mill cheese enchiladas.  Any taqueria in the Mish will do better.

The service was excellent.

If I lived in the neighborhood, I'd probably eat here all the time.  But if I'm going to drive all the way out to the Avenues for Mexican Food, I'm going to brave the wait at Tommy's, instead.

excerpts: He got me the chicken and beef enchiladas.
Chicken was hand shredded and the beef was ground to a nice texture.
enchiladas.author: I have something to say... A.
enchiladas.review:
My husband did take out last night from TM.  GREAT FOOD.  This is even after the meals traveled a 1 mile distance.  Hubby had the Chile Relleno which he proceeded to scarf along with the warm tortillas, huge side of beans and YUMMY butter rice.  He got me the chicken and beef enchiladas.  Chicken was hand shredded and the beef was ground to a nice texture.  Can't wait to stop by the place for a meal soon.

2 thumbs up Tia Magarita!

excerpts: I really enjoyed their special enchiladas and my 5-year-old asked for seconds on her kids cheese enchilada plate.
Husband says his spicy chicken salad was excellent too.
I can see us frequenting this place for years to come:)
enchiladas.author: Marcie M.
enchiladas.review: Fun place to have dinner with the family on a Friday night! Great atmosphere and energy. Nice bar and yummy top shelf margaritas at a decent price. Food was solid. I really enjoyed their special enchiladas and my 5-year-old asked for seconds on her kids cheese enchilada plate. Husband says his spicy chicken salad was excellent too. I can see us frequenting this place for years to come:)

excerpts: When she asked me what I wanted, I said "enchiladas.
" 5 seconds go by of her staring at me, so I repeat "the enchiladas, please," thinking that I must mumble.
enchiladas.author: Jared S.
enchiladas.review:
I think Tia served us on Sunday. 

Well, Tia muy Loca sure did. Our waitress, although I'm sure really nice, was kind of all over the place. When she asked me what I wanted, I said "enchiladas." 5 seconds go by of her staring at me, so I repeat "the enchiladas, please," thinking that I must mumble.

(Side note: why can't a single person at a coffee shop spell my name correctly when they ask for it? I'm always Jerry. I HATE the name Jerry.)

(Side note #2: Jerrys of the world... please don't take offense; it's just not my name)

Tia muy Loca then continues to stare at me for 10 seconds. No joke; it was one of those moments where I started to get a nervous grin, like "is this really happening?" and my friends started giggling because they were just as confused. Finally, she speaks: Chicken or beef?

YES. Mission accomplished. 

Mind you, there was no language barrier at play. My friends had ordered right before me with ease. Later she joked with me about understanding me... but as if it was my fault, not hers. Hmm, Tia, not so sure about that.

Anyway, the food was pretty good and one of the other servers/bus boys was EXTREMELY cool and friendly. He made sure we were always stocked with chips and hot salsa, hooked my friend up with a free soda and shook our hands when we left. Why must I be such a sucker for good/genuine customer service?

I will definitely come here again. Partly because it's so close, but partly because I want to see what my next adventure brings.

excerpts: Menu populated with typical Tex-Mex style tacos, burritos, enchiladas.
If I'm in the mood for good Mexican cuisine, I'm gonn'a travel to the Mission to get more authentic food that tastes better.
enchiladas.author: Tom S.
enchiladas.review: I've eaten here a few times in the distant past. For me this place and Tommy's are interchangeable. Food is old school. Pasty textures. Bland flavors. Menu populated with typical Tex-Mex style tacos, burritos, enchiladas. If I'm in the mood for good Mexican cuisine, I'm gonn'a travel to the Mission to get more authentic food that tastes better.

excerpts: If you want a nice hot plate of enchiladas with beans, rice, melted cheese with a never ending stream of chips and delicious salsa then this is a place you need to try.
I recommend the Enchiladas with sour cream sauce with a fried egg on top.
enchiladas.author: Robert S.
enchiladas.review: I love this place.  Other than really crappy parking I always enjoy eating here.  Honestly there may be other places that have better burritos or soups or whatever, but in San Francisco most all of those places are hole in the wall spots where you stand in line get your burrito and leave.  If you want a nice hot plate of enchiladas with beans, rice, melted cheese with a never ending stream of chips and delicious salsa then this is a place you need to try.  I recommend the Enchiladas with sour cream sauce with a fried egg on top.

excerpts: VERY GOOD chimichanga, pretty good enchiladas, good chips and salsa.
enchiladas.author: Gene M.
enchiladas.review:
I love real Mexican food. It should come from a dirty taqueria or a truck, not a sit down restaurant with a waitstaff. Burritos should be served right off the grill wrapped in foil for $5, not served on a plate with a knife and fork for $15. Mexican food is honest, and should be served as such. 

These are the reasons why I choose to never go to any sit down Mexican restaurants. But, keeping an open mind and trying new things are my forte, and I was pleasantly surprised when I was introduced to Tia Margarita.

My first thought was, "Great, another mediocre Mexican restaurant with overpriced burritos on a plate. They better have good margaritas!" The margaritas are made by hand with fresh ingredients, very good. VERY GOOD chimichanga, pretty good enchiladas, good chips and salsa. 

I'd probably only go back if a friend wanted to go there, because I like my food cheap, good, and honest, and you get that from places with a sizzling grill right next to a ringing cash register right next to a big jar of horchata right next to a sticky table top. Check out my full review on my blog, see profile.

excerpts: The enchiladas are in a true Mexican red sauce and are oozing with cheese.
enchiladas.author: Heather S.
enchiladas.review:
Sooooo amazing and suchhhhhh a great deal! You don't have to travel to the Mission or go as far as San Diego for some authentic Mexican food. Not diet friendly! One meal can easily suffice as two especially after diving into refillable chips and salsa. They usually provide you with two types of salsa and don't distinguish between the two, so spicy sensitive peeps be careful! 

To start I would try the shrimp and garlic. Since I discovered my aversion to garlic I haven't tried it again since but from what I remember it was de-lish! Plump shrimp with fresh garlic. 

Now the key to making two meals out of one is to order the 3 item combo plate for a couple bucks more. I usually have a burrito, taco and enchilada. The enchiladas are in a true Mexican red sauce and are oozing with cheese. The burrito: hot damn it is one HUGE burrito! That's where the idea of "two meals" comes in: eat the taco and enchilada (or any other combo) and then save the burrito for another time. Its even more delightful the next day! 

Margaritas are STRONG which often leads to a good time. I'm always groaning from a food baby when I leave this place but am so so so happy :)

excerpts: never mind what everyone else ordered, my shrimp enchiladas where insanely delicious.
enchiladas.author: Sheri N.
enchiladas.review:
i'm a whiskey gal, but i don't mind indulging in a margarita from here.  they don't saturate the alcohol w/sweet and sour mix, and mainly use fresh lime juice in their margaritas.  i prefer to have mine on the rocks.  

never mind what everyone else ordered, my shrimp enchiladas where insanely delicious.  they don't skimp on the shrimp portions like many restaurants do, and the way they cook the shrimp is just divine.

our server was not consistent w/her prices.  shrimp is an additional cost, but she kept up-ing the price when we asked about different dishes which we wanted to add shrimp to. at one stage she said it was $17 for a shrimp quesadilla appetizer.  we thought that was absurd.   she also didn't seem to hear things we requested.  in fairness she was in her golden years, and you could see the relief on her face when she sat down at the end of her shift.

excerpts: Nothing special:fajitas, enchiladas, rellenos, etc.
Obviously people don't go there for the food.
It's for the drinks.
The bar was littered with sloppy drunk old dudes... at 7pm on a Tuesday!!!!!
It must be the local drunk hangout.
I'm all for establishing a local watering hole.
But I am also for cutting off stumbling drunk idiots yelling at the top of their lungs in a family restaurant.
What's worse is you have to walk past the sea of drunk to get to the host stand, where they ignore you for about five minutes  while the employees gossip.
Where is the host you ask?
Why, she is basking in the attention she is getting from the slobs as they all stand around her with their tongues hanging out of their mouthes.
While the slobs at the bar guzzled down their drinks one after another, (getting louder and stupider in an already confined space), we waited 15 mins for 2 bottled beers.
The service?
Pretty sucky.
The staff was all too willing to sit down and shoot the shit with the regulars while completely ignoring everyone else.
Maybe our food took 40 minutes because it was sitting under the heat lamp while the staff jerked off.
Any restaurant where the staff sits down with their friends in the middle of dinner rush is not an establishment I care to visit again.
You would need the best, cheepest food and drinks in the world to get me to put up with that sad excuse for service.
enchiladas.author: Tyler J.
enchiladas.review:
I wasn't expecting much when I heard about a mexican restaurant way out in the Richmond on Clement St.  It seems as though I was right.  The food was mediocre, par for a cheap mexican joint off the beaten path.  Nothing special:fajitas, enchiladas, rellenos, etc.  Obviously people don't go there for the food.  It's for the drinks.  
     The bar was littered with sloppy drunk old dudes... at 7pm on a Tuesday!!!!!  It must be the local drunk hangout.  I'm all for establishing a local watering hole.  But I am also for cutting off stumbling drunk idiots yelling at the top of their lungs in a family restaurant.  What's worse is you have to walk past the sea of drunk to get to the host stand, where they ignore you for about five minutes  while the employees gossip.  Where is the host you ask?  Why, she is basking in the attention she is getting from the slobs as they all stand around her with their tongues hanging out of their mouthes.  
     While the slobs at the bar guzzled down their drinks one after another, (getting louder and stupider in an already confined space), we waited 15 mins for 2 bottled beers.  The service?  Pretty sucky.  The staff was all too willing to sit down and shoot the shit with the regulars while completely ignoring everyone else.  Maybe our food took 40 minutes because it was sitting under the heat lamp while the staff jerked off.
    Any restaurant where the staff sits down with their friends in the middle of dinner rush is not an establishment I care to visit again.  You would need the best, cheepest food and drinks in the world to get me to put up with that sad excuse for service.

excerpts: I went Enchiladas Verde and found it was fine, but really the ample sour cream smothered on top is what saved it.
Black beans are cool, rice is salty, and lettuce/salsa thing is kinda strange.
enchiladas.author: John H.
enchiladas.review:
Not too shabby.  The food here isn't gonna shoot you in to a Mexican orgasm, but those calling it bland American food have never eaten at a Chi-Chi's.  The chips and mild salsa are a great start.  Usually I like hot, but the hot salsa here will leave you hurting.

I went Enchiladas Verde and found it was fine, but really the ample sour cream smothered on top is what saved it.  Black beans are cool, rice is salty, and lettuce/salsa thing is kinda strange.  Good margaritas and service was super, although there were not many there on a Sunday night.

I'd go back for the drinks, chip, and some of the food, so would recommend the bar side of things.

excerpts: and the enchiladas are really quite good.
I actually like these margaritas just as much as Tommy's...
They give you two kinds of salsa with your chips too.
All in all, I would be completely content here if they had a patio, which they don't.
But no place is perfect and Tia Margarita does a really nice job being just what it is.
enchiladas.author: Matt C.
enchiladas.review:
In SF we are lucky enough to have three basic classes of Mexican restaurant loosely defined in the following categories: 1) Classy and expensive, 2) Cheap and Burrito and 3) Family and Margarita Dependent.  I love category number 3, especially when the food is decent, who comes here for the food anymore than you'd put gas in a car without an engine. 

The ideal category 3 Mexican restaurant has ridiculously strong and ridiculously cheap margaritas, fresh and spicy salsa, decent chips, and (in a perfect world) a patio to let the tequila- lime joy unfold on... A triplesec covered, tequila infused proscenium (if you will). 

Getting back to Tia's, it has a few things going for it off the bat: Weird soft white loungey lighting? Check. Huge round bar that seems to take up the entire restaurant? Check.  Hot hostess? Check.  Vaguely Andy Garcia bartender serving extra strong drinks to the ladies at the bar? Check. The margaritas are strong in their own right (especially the doubles) and the enchiladas are really quite good. I actually like these margaritas just as much as Tommy's... They give you two kinds of salsa with your chips too. All in all, I would be completely content here if they had a patio, which they don't. But no place is perfect and Tia Margarita does a really nice job being just what it is.

excerpts: My wife and I shared something involving enchiladas.
One word to describe how I felt afterwards - "bloated".
Luckily, after the 16 block walk home, my condition was downgraded to "really full".
enchiladas.author: Aaron Z.
enchiladas.review: Went last night for the second time. Food/drinks/atmosphere were all sexy. The combination plates are crazy huge - enough for two people. My wife and I shared something involving enchiladas. One word to describe how I felt afterwards - "bloated". Luckily, after the 16 block walk home, my condition was downgraded to "really full".

excerpts: I got the enchiladas which were good.
They came with rice, beans and a small salad.
enchiladas.author: Chili B.

I went to Tia Margarita last night with as a party of three. We started off with maragaritas which were strong and satisfying as well as only $4.95. The chips were good, but the salsa looked and tasted like it had come from a bottle...not bad, just not noteworthy.

The menu is fairly simple Sonoran fare (tacos, enchiladas, etc.). Between the three of us, we had chiles rellenos, enchiladas, tamales, and a chimichanga (not really Mexican, I know). The tamales were excellent: fresh and with lots of carne. The chiles rellenos were about a 7 on a 1-10 scale as were the enchiladas (a bit bland) and the chimichanga.

The rice was odd in that it looked and tasted like rice pilaf. It was definitely not traditional Mexican rice...although it tasted fine. The refried beans were also bit bland.

Good Mexican food in SF is very hard to find, but by SF standards, I would give this place 3.5 stars. (it would get two stars in San Diego). Still, it's worth visiting as the food, although not particularly noteworthy, is satisfying. The lively crowd is also a plus.

The place was still hopping after 9 pm and the margaritas were a killer as many yelpers can attest! I came back a second time within the past month for dinner again and was not dismayed. Portions are large and my wife and mother in law each ordered a single taco with the works and that was plenty for them. excerpts: I enjoy both of these preparations very much and am partial to their salsa verde (tomatillo sauce) enchiladas as well.
For me, Tia does a nice job of satisfying the need for a neighborhood comfort-style restaurant.
As for quality, two comments:
First, the margaritas are disappointing in ways previously mentioned.
The most egregious is that they have NO 100% agave tequilas from which to make a premium drink
(remember, Tia resides in a time warp!).
If you happen to live in the present, you have little choice but to cap your meal off with a walk down to Tommy's for a properly composed margarita.
My second observation about quality is that I suffered through some pretty bad meals at Tia Margarita during 2007 and into 2008.
Most notably food tended toward the salty and soggy, and there were other problems, too.
Then, sometime around mid-year everything got noticeably better.
The food quality has remained consistently up-to-par for the past six or eight months, so I guess it's not a fluke.
They must have fired the cook, and now I needn't apologize to anyone--especially myself--for enjoying the fare.
One tip:
There are some wacky (hard of hearing?
inattentive?
distracted?)
older waitresses who serve the dining rooms.
I suppose one could say these servers are charming in their own way, but for my money I prefer the gracious and attentive food service Antonio provides in the lounge.
Enjoy!
enchiladas.author: Ron L.
enchiladas.review: Okay, here's my two-cents worth (actually $12.50 plus tax).  Someone mentioned "comfort food," and they're right on the money!  This place is something of an iconic holdover from another era, namely its founding date of 1964.  If you happen to have a special place in your heart for fairly homogenous California Mexican "cuisine" (I hesitate a little to use such a dignified term), then Tia delivers the goods in a goodly fashion.  Someone mentioned the chicken breast asada, which I think is really one of their signature dishes.  Someone else mentioned the gambas (prawns) in garlic and butter, which is quite how I remember the dish being served in Mexican coastal towns.  I enjoy both of these preparations very much and am partial to their salsa verde (tomatillo sauce) enchiladas as well.  For me, Tia does a nice job of satisfying the need for a neighborhood comfort-style restaurant.  As for quality, two comments:  First, the margaritas are disappointing in ways previously mentioned.  The most egregious is that they have NO 100% agave tequilas from which to make a premium drink (remember, Tia resides in a time warp!).  If you happen to live in the present, you have little choice but to cap your meal off with a walk down to Tommy's for a properly composed margarita.  My second observation about quality is that I suffered through some pretty bad meals at Tia Margarita during 2007 and into 2008.  Most notably food tended toward the salty and soggy, and there were other problems, too.  Then, sometime around mid-year everything got noticeably better.  The food quality has remained consistently up-to-par for the past six or eight months, so I guess it's not a fluke.  They must have fired the cook, and now I needn't apologize to anyone--especially myself--for enjoying the fare.  One tip:  There are some wacky (hard of hearing?  inattentive? distracted?) older waitresses who serve the dining rooms.  I suppose one could say these servers are charming in their own way, but for my money I prefer the gracious and attentive food service Antonio provides in the lounge.  Enjoy!

I'm actually surprised the stars on this restaurant are only about 3.5. I find them to be at least a 4, and if I was judging purely on the chile rellenos, I would give them a 5! 

Tia Margarita is a delicious neighborhood restaurant and bar. I have been here several times and it is a common suggestion among my friends.  The restaurant looks smaller than it actually is, which is nice because I have never waited for a seat (but I'm sure on weekends it is a bit busier.)  The food is nothing too original (Mexican staples: burritos, tacos, enchilladas, quesadillas, etc) but everything they have is delicious!

I specifically recommend the chile rellenos which are probably the best I have ever had!

The margaritas are delicious as well and if they aren't your thing, they have a full bar.  

The waitstaff is friendly and will refill my chips and salsa until my heart and stomach are content! Prices are reasonable- a little more than you would usually pay if you were going to a taqueria ($11-14 per entree) but they give you an enormous round plate of food. My test for the amount of food is always whether or not it fills up my boyfriend, who has been known to eat his fair share... This place passes the test! 

Bottom line:
-parking is not too bad
-restaurant and bar combined
-not overly crowded
-delicious food
-order the chile rellenos

The chips and salsa- chips were okay... they were cold. Salsa was gross way over seasoned; the red salsa tasted like salted garlic. The green salsa was pretty good.

Margarita- single, blended. brought to me watery and tasted like watery tequila with well mix. $4.75

Guacamole- over seasoned and pureed I'm sure. there was no sign of any other ingredient beside avocado and garlic salt.

Chille relleno- tasted okay but they were itty bitty and the representation was very poor. and the sauce tasted like raviolli sauce. $12.50

rice- pretty sure it was not mexican rice but rather some stove top stuff! that's the san francisco treat!

beans- really salty and just did not add to any part of the meal.

salad with tomato sauce- eww didn't even touch it!

so what did i eat with my 25 dollar meal? a gross, watery and weak margarita, 2 lousy, small chile rellenos, half the guacamole, 4 forkfuls of rice, 2 forkfuls of beans, and chips.

I would not recommend going here at all to any body. just go around the corner to gordos and have a burrito. it is WAY better and cheaper.

quesadillas.review:
I don't know the last time I've been to an actual sit down/serviced mexican place but this was worth it. Usually I'm a hole in the wall kinda person but I came for the double margs. and conquered all the delicious food.

This is my friend's go-to for some refreshing top shelf double margaritas (OH BABY). Came on a Sunday in the afternoon after some soccer and a couple of beers. We ordered a round of double margs and the queso appetizer which were perfect. The salsa they bring out is great, the mild is sweet and good for anyone, the spicy is def. a kicker--if you like a little spice, just mix the two, otherwise stick with the milk. Queso was ooey gooey and warm--magic in a dish to start soaking up those beers from earlier!

I ordered the Combination Plate 2 ($15.75) with Rellenos and Enchilada (Beef) and a side of refried beans, which I shared so I could score half of the Carne Asada Quesadillas ($13.75). Everything was great! I didn't think you could beat the whole in the wall comfort food of all the mission places but for what it was, this was really good. My combination plate was perfect, 10/10 would get it again. The Quesadilla was a not my favorite, since the tortilla was like fried super crispy--I think I would've preferred it to be like the super quesadillas you can get on every corner in the mission, and the portion was pretty small for the price but I guess if you weigh in the sides, it's alright. Overall, the rest of the plates seems to go over well anda decent portions once you tap in the sides. 

This stuff hit the spot and I felt better after eating it all--especially with the previous beers, def. soaked up some of that potential drinking aftermath.

quesadillas.author: Sapna G.
quesadillas.review: I really really had some high expectations from this place. My brother lives about 100 footsteps away from here and while visiting him, I thought I'd make a stop because of all the amazing things I've heard and how amazing their food looks in pictures. My mom and I walked in as soon as they opened on a Thursday afternoon at 4pm. Which by the way their hours are kind of odd and I have no idea why it's set up that way but it has always been very inconvenient. Nonetheless, we were seated right away, our server came to us with our menus, we ordered our beverages, and we didn't want to grub to the max so we wanted to share a plate. We told the server we wanted to share the large combo plate which gave you three items. He immediately stopped me and said there is a $6 charge for splitting a plate which really shocked me. I have NEVER EVER in my entire dining history even at some of the most top notch places in Los Angeles, heard that there is any charge for wanting to share a meal. I told him that was probably the most ridiculous thing I've heard and he was understanding and said that he wanted to let us know before we ordered that way just so we are aware which I'm glad he did. Especially after seeing so many reviews about how they add extra charges on to people's bills. Anyways, we asked him what if we wanted to split an appetizer? He said that's fine, there is no extra charge for that. I just felt like, they shouldn't be the ones deciding how much money we should spend or how much food we should be eating. We just ordered the quesadillas, which were really yummy and their salsas are really delicious as well. I just don't know that I would care to come back, or at least not when they JUST open because it's pretty clear by the attitude and vibe of the whole place that they hate being there, maybe until it gets busy but, I'm a fan of Mexican food so I'm pretty sure I can find another place anywhere else that won't decide how to eat my meal or spend my money.
