I feel like this is kinda like saying "they had great water!" but their quesadillas are off the hook!!!  I usually scoff at corn tortillas, but they are what MAKE the quesadillas here.  I have never ordered the one with meat, because the cheesy oozy buttery one gives me lady wood every time.  The thing is though, you gotta eat it FAST because it's only "last meal" worthy if you eat it right when they place it on the table...honestly if you could snatch a piece while the waitress/er is placing it on your table that's the sweet spot.  

Per some Yelp recommendations I got the Sampler this time - THANKS GUYS, it was the best idea ever.  Everything on it was deep-fried except for maybe the quesadilla and the burritos, and I didn't even have to choose between chicken or beef because I was brought 2 of each in the form of spinach and tomato tortillas, and when I dropped my taquito in my margarita on accident, I was brought 2 new taquitos (cause 1 on a plate would be lonely) AND a new margarita!

excerpts: If you like rice of the Uncle Ben's microwave variety, beans from a can,  quesadillas oil coated, ketchup-y salsa...then please do come here, you will love it.
Sigh.
The salad was more an afterthought, limp shredded iceberg struggling to breathe under another layer of salsa.
Because the 2 cups of ketch-salsa you gave me with my chips wasn't enough.
There was guacamole, it was powdery.
WTF how can guac be powdery?!
I don't know guys, but it was.
quesadillas.author: Rachel G.
quesadillas.review:
'Well we didn't get sick from it.'

This is what my husband said in response to my 'what did you think of Tia's.' I thought I should throw my 5 cents into the pot of mixed reviews of this place. We went because we were meeting a group and probably wouldn't have eaten there otherwise... I'd never heard of it and hoped that maybe it was a hidden gem. 

Well there's nothing bejeweled about TIa's. If you like rice of the Uncle Ben's microwave variety, beans from a can,  quesadillas oil coated, ketchup-y salsa...then please do come here, you will love it. Sigh. The salad was more an afterthought, limp shredded iceberg struggling to breathe under another layer of salsa. Because the 2 cups of ketch-salsa you gave me with my chips wasn't enough. There was guacamole, it was powdery. WTF how can guac be powdery?! I don't know guys, but it was. At least there wasn't a lot of it. 

The staff were rude. Our server repeatedly told us to move our stuff out the way even though there was plenty of room for her to get past. If I could cram a stroller under a table I would, jeez. 

Here's the deal. If you are local, you might like this place for margs. If you are a bit of a loner, you might like to hang out with the other loners at the bar. If you are anyone else, do. not. go. here. ever. SF has so much more to offer!  

Oh fffff I forgot to mention - it is SO EXPENSIVE. Who on earth charges $10 for a quesadilla? WHO?! It's a plate with beans and rice and salad, but as mentioned before, the sides are all severely sub par canned/bagged crap that don't taste like anything. 

:-(

excerpts: too original (Mexican staples: burritos, tacos, enchilladas, quesadillas, etc) but everything they have is delicious!
quesadillas.author: Jean K.
quesadillas.review:
I'm actually surprised the stars on this restaurant are only about 3.5. I find them to be at least a 4, and if I was judging purely on the chile rellenos, I would give them a 5! 

Tia Margarita is a delicious neighborhood restaurant and bar. I have been here several times and it is a common suggestion among my friends.  The restaurant looks smaller than it actually is, which is nice because I have never waited for a seat (but I'm sure on weekends it is a bit busier.)  The food is nothing too original (Mexican staples: burritos, tacos, enchilladas, quesadillas, etc) but everything they have is delicious!

I specifically recommend the chile rellenos which are probably the best I have ever had!

The margaritas are delicious as well and if they aren't your thing, they have a full bar.  

The waitstaff is friendly and will refill my chips and salsa until my heart and stomach are content! Prices are reasonable- a little more than you would usually pay if you were going to a taqueria ($11-14 per entree) but they give you an enormous round plate of food. My test for the amount of food is always whether or not it fills up my boyfriend, who has been known to eat his fair share... This place passes the test! 

Bottom line:
-parking is not too bad
-restaurant and bar combined
-not overly crowded
-delicious food
-order the chile rellenos

excerpts: I do love their flautas, tacos, and quesadillas.
Tia Margarita is the funnest lady to watch and talk to.
quesadillas.author: Ali R.
quesadillas.review:
If my aunt made margarita's like this I'd enjoy family reunions more. 

The margaritas are all top shelf and are very tasty. No mixes. Made with fresh squeezed lime juice. For some reason I think things are cooler when made in front of you. 

I'm not a huge fan of their salsa, but I won't complain too much. I do love their flautas, tacos, and quesadillas. Tia Margarita is the funnest lady to watch and talk to.

excerpts: there's like 4 of everything: two kinds of burritos, empanadas, chicken wings (with soy sauce which was really weird at a mex restaurant but whatever!), quesadillas, etc.
quesadillas.author: Sharonrose B.
quesadillas.review:
the best margaritas in the city. 

MUST ORDER: the sampler plate. it is enough for three adults. seriously. there's like 4 of everything: two kinds of burritos, empanadas, chicken wings (with soy sauce which was really weird at a mex restaurant but whatever!), quesadillas, etc. 

the salsa is great with the double salted margaritas and Francisco makes it better than anyone else in the joint, with a smile! 

it's never too crowded or too loud and the staff is very nice, especially lucy.

excerpts: they use the most excellent salty cheese (their quesadillas...orgasmic), their portions are ENORMOUS, their rice is amazing, their guacamole really excellent.
they can cook up an entire meal and have it boxed and ready for you within 15 minutes, no joke.
when i have a hankerin for this place, nothing else will satisfy the craving.
i give it a 4 instead of a 5 for the kitchen take-out fuck ups and the high prices, but really, this place is take out heaven.
quesadillas.author: roz A.
quesadillas.review:
If you want a "grease infusion" as my mom calls it, this is definitely the place to go.  i have experienced tia margarita's in both sit-down and take out mode, and i must say i prefer take out. it can get hellishly crowded and noisy, especially near the weekends. some of the wait staff is awesome, others just errr....horrible. they have many vegetarian options, but their refried beans have lard in them so you have to be very careful if you do not eat meat or pork. i have had some difficulties in getting take out orders..mainly that the kitchen does not seem to pay attention to what the wait staff has put up on the order...you get the stuff home only to find that there's refried beans in your "veggie burrito"! they are pretty good about letting you check your food before you take it, so if you have any specific food wants and needs, be very sure you are getting what you ordered.
HOWEVER. they use the most excellent salty cheese (their quesadillas...orgasmic), their portions are ENORMOUS, their rice is amazing, their guacamole really excellent. they can cook up an entire meal and have it boxed and ready for you within 15 minutes, no joke. when i have a hankerin for this place, nothing else will satisfy the craving. i give it a 4 instead of a 5 for the kitchen take-out fuck ups and the high prices, but really, this place is take out heaven.

excerpts: A friend had the tamales, I had enchiladas rancheras and my other friend had the pollo asado plate.
Of course none of us could finish their dish.
At 8:50 people were already staring at us like "get the hell out of here", but some of the people that were already in when we came in were still there, so what was the point?
We ate super quick and asked for the check super quick, since we didn't feel welcome at all.
When we left, there were like 10 people still in there, who were already there when we got in.
So whatever.
It's also a little pricey for a Mexican restaurant...
But the portions are reasonable, so it's okay.
Too bad the service wasn't nice to us
, otherwise it would probably be a 5 stars for me.
enchiladas rancheras.author: Diana F.
enchiladas rancheras.review:
We got here for a late dinner yesterday. It was my friend's birthday and we were actually going to another place, but it turned out to be closed, so we looked for nearby places and found this one. 
The place closes at 9pm and it was 8:20pm when we got in. I totally understand that workers wanna go home on time, I've been there, but that's not a reason to be rude with customers... We really didn't feel like they were happy about seeing us. It was quite the opposite, actually. 
So it was a friend and I and we were expecting another friend to arrive. The hostess came and told us that the kitchen was closing in 5 minutes. Okaaaaaay.... I called my friend who was on his way and took his order through the phone. 
Now, something good about the place (actually worth 5 stars if it wasn't for other details: portions are HUGE. Literally. HUGE! I can't imagine that someone is able to eat all of a complete dinner. That's not  even possible. A friend had the tamales, I had enchiladas rancheras and my other friend had the pollo asado plate. Of course none of us could finish their dish. At 8:50 people were already staring at us like "get the hell out of here", but some of the people that were already in when we came in were still there, so what was the point? We ate super quick and asked for the check super quick, since we didn't feel welcome at all. 
When we left, there were like 10 people still in there, who were already there when we got in. So whatever. 
It's also a little pricey for a Mexican restaurant... But the portions are reasonable, so it's okay. 
Too bad the service wasn't nice to us, otherwise it would probably be a 5 stars for me.

excerpts: I don't expect much from the food at a place like this, but I found my dish, enchiladas rancheras, to be delicious.
I enjoyed my margarita too, but my friend was disappointed to find out he had been given a Double when he didn't specify the size he wanted.
It sounds like if you order a margarita it's on you to specify Single, otherwise the default order placed is for the Double.  :
enchiladas rancheras.author: Susan B.
enchiladas rancheras.review:
This is the kind of 1970's mexican place you don't see much of anymore, with a pleasant, lively vibe, kind and attentive servers, giant plates covered in starch, cheese and iceberg lettuce, and understated but charming decor.  I don't expect much from the food at a place like this, but I found my dish, enchiladas rancheras, to be delicious.  I enjoyed my margarita too, but my friend was disappointed to find out he had been given a Double when he didn't specify the size he wanted.  It sounds like if you order a margarita it's on you to specify Single, otherwise the default order placed is for the Double.  :\

Tia Margarita's reminds me of Trevino's in El Cerrito.  Same kind of old-school vibe, strong drinks, plates covered in carbs and dairy, plus they have a parking lot!

excerpts: I got the flautas and my bf got the nachos.
The flautas were drowning in sour cream and the chicken had no flavor at all.
The nachos were both burned and soggy.
flautas.author: Paty O.
flautas.review:
This place is walking distance from home so I really tried to to like it but I've been disappointed time after time. 

The margaritas and staff are great so I'll give them 1 star. 

The food is disgusting and taste like the majority is either frozen or canned. They don't even serve traditional Mexican rice!! Thai visit I got the flautas and my bf got the nachos. The flautas were drowning in sour cream and the chicken had no flavor at all. The nachos were both burned and soggy. Looked as if they sat under a hot lamp too long after being made. 

Sorry guys. I really wanted to like you guys. I love Mexican food and wanted a decent place by my home. =\

excerpts: Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered.
Wasn't a huge fun.
Overall experience was great
and I would def go back to try some more items.
Oh also the alcohol is strong.
Yum.
Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!!
Haha!!
flautas.author: Mandi K.
flautas.review:
I have to say that this place was a bit surprising! They must be a popular joint because the restaurant got pretty crowded very quickly. At first when you walk in all you see is the bar, it literally takes up most of the room and there are a few booths that surround the line the rest of the place. Also has a weird musty smell to it when you walk in. ( they need to air this place more often) now the servers and everyone are friendly and quite attentive. The decor is pretty old and I noticed duct tape to patch up certain parts of the furniture. 
     Now for the food! They start you off with the chips and two kinds of salsa. One was spicy and one mild and I have to say the mild seemed like ketchup with bits of tomato and onion to make it seem like salsa. However the spicy salsa was on point! Next the food, HUGE portions. Def worth the price of what you are getting. Main was GREAT ( burrito, enchilada, flautas)  but the sides were meh...black beans weren't cooked thoroughly, their salad is just shredded lettuce with the mild salsa and the rice is buttered. Wasn't a huge fun. Overall experience was great and I would def go back to try some more items. Oh also the alcohol is strong. Yum. Try the margaritas and they have a good selection of beer!! Haha!!

excerpts: Then I ordered the appetizer sampler, and My Lady ordered her current favorite, flautas.
While I found that by the end of the sampler plate it seemed like I was eating an endless plate of flour tortillas, My Lady said the flautas were the best she'd ever had.
While I found that by the end of the sampler plate it seemed like I was eating an endless plate of flour tortillas, My Lady said the flautas were the best she'd ever had.
flautas.author: David D.
flautas.review:
This place was jumping on Friday night. 

After a reception at the deYoung, we decided to go over to Tia Margarita and have some fun. This was the culmination of years' worth of My Lady's raving about the place. When we walked through the door we discovered the place was packed. Three dining rooms or more, and nearly every seat was filled. 

We started off by ordering a couple of margaritas, naturally. Then I ordered the appetizer sampler, and My Lady ordered her current favorite, flautas. While I found that by the end of the sampler plate it seemed like I was eating an endless plate of flour tortillas, My Lady said the flautas were the best she'd ever had. We settled the bill at $59 + a generous tip, because our waiter was truly interested in making sure we had a good time. 

While we had different opinions about the food, we both agreed that the people-watching was outstanding.

excerpts: We had enchiladas, tamales, tacos, and flautas.
What a disappointment.
The dishes were bland and tasteless.
We had to add salt to every single serving and that is a no, no in my book.
Although the portions are big, it did not make up for the mediorce options on the menu.
flautas.author: Chau H.
flautas.review:
The first time I visited this establishment, we were denied because it was 10:40pm and they close at 11:00pm. It was interesting because the hostess gave us a table but a waitress came over and said "No, no. We are closed. The kitchen is closed." No apologies, just flat out denial. 

"If at first you don't succeed, dust yourself off and try again." Right? Right. So now I'm back and this time we arrived earlier and were seated right away. We sat in the back of the restaurant which was quite disappointing because the room was too dark. I struggled to read the menu and enjoy the food since our table was only lit by a tiny candle. One star down.

When it came to the food, the chips and salsa were a-ok. The salsa tasted like a fusion of canned tomatoes and ketchup, which I can assure you is not a good combination. Two stars down. However, the green salsa was good and extra spicy. The chips were super crunchy and highly addictive. 

For starters, we had the chicharrones and I felt it was overpowered with cumin. It was crispy but too salty. The gambas al ajillo (shrimp with garlic and butter sauce) was good but nothing special. It's paired with flour tortillas and that made it fun to eat. 

On to the main courses. We had enchiladas, tamales, tacos, and flautas. What a disappointment. The dishes were bland and tasteless. We had to add salt to every single serving and that is a no, no in my book.  Although the portions are big, it did not make up for the mediorce options on the menu. Three stars down.

As for service, our waitress was very sweet and attentive. She always made sure we had our refills on drinks, tortillas, and chips and salsa. We didn't try their margaritas but overheard from the two tables next to us that they were "pretty damn strong." Too bad I won't be coming back to give you an updated review on that.

I should of known that it wasn't meant for me to try the food here when we were already denied the first time around. That was a sign and I should of trusted it instead of shopping for a restaurant on an empty stomach.

excerpts: The chicken flautas are the business!!!
flautas.author: Christine Z.
flautas.review:
Tia's was my most favorite Mexican restaurant in my old 'hood (oh, how I miss the Richmond District)

The chips and salsa are yummy!  The chicken flautas are the business!!!  And their fresh margaritas are hands down THE best in the 'hood... made with good quality tequila and FRESH lime juice (not the nasty bottled stuff).  

It's a great neighborhood restaurant where you end up becoming part of the Tia's family... I always make sure to stop by Tia's for my favorite staples whenever I'm back in the 'sco!

excerpts: Very good mexican food, definitly try the flautas, they are so good.
Also their margaritas are very good.
At first sip I thought, 'this is not too great, it seems like it isn't very strong'.
Then....after the halfway mark I realize how loud I am talking, and YES, the margaritas are fabulous!!!!!
flautas.author: Kimberly H.
flautas.review: Very good mexican food, definitly try the flautas, they are so good. Also their margaritas are very good. At first sip I thought, 'this is not too great, it seems like it isn't very strong'. Then....after the halfway mark I realize how loud I am talking, and YES, the margaritas are fabulous!!!!! =)

excerpts: I always order the flautas, yummy.
flautas.author: Jacquelyn M.
flautas.review:
LOVE Tia!  Great neighborhood Mexican restaurant!  I always order the flautas, yummy.  I have ordered the burritos as well and they are delish.  I can always tell a good Mexican restaurant based on the "free" chips and salsa they give to to start with and the salsa is fantastic!  Margaritas are great as well.  You walk in the place and you'll find the game (whatever the season...baseball, football, soccer) on at the bar.  
Again, great neighborhood restaurant and fabulous chips and salsa and margaritas.  I frequent this place....it's the shit!

excerpts: They really raved about the Flautas in particular.
The margaritas are pretty good too.
flautas.author: Richard C.
flautas.review:
Its just alright...

Ordered a chile relleno and cheese enchilada combo. The enchilada sauce was nothing speciall but they do hook you up with the cheese. As for the chile relleno - if you have ever had a one from Jimboys it tastes EXACTLY like a Jimboys chile relleno. Dont get me wrong, I liked it. But, knowing I could spend half the price for a similar meal kinda rubs me the wrong way. For me the best part was the rice. I dont know what they do to it but I really liked it and it wasnt even in the style of spanish rice. 

In their defense, I came here with a group of about 15 and most of the people I was with liked their food. They really raved about the Flautas in particular. The margaritas are pretty good too.

excerpts: I do love their flautas, tacos, and quesadillas.
Tia Margarita is the funnest lady to watch and talk to.
flautas.author: Ali R.
flautas.review:
If my aunt made margarita's like this I'd enjoy family reunions more. 

The margaritas are all top shelf and are very tasty. No mixes. Made with fresh squeezed lime juice. For some reason I think things are cooler when made in front of you. 

I'm not a huge fan of their salsa, but I won't complain too much. I do love their flautas, tacos, and quesadillas. Tia Margarita is the funnest lady to watch and talk to.

excerpts: I ended up ordering the Flautas for dinner which came with beans, rice and some salad.
The beans and rice were totally bland and the meat coming out of the side of my flautas were black!  Not very appetizing.
flautas.author: Jade B.
flautas.review: Went to this place for the first time with my boyfriend on a rainy friday night.  The place is really dim but cozy.   Wasn't in the mood for a cocktail but my boyfriend tried the strawberry margarita, I took a sip and it was pretty good.  I ended up ordering the Flautas for dinner which came with beans, rice and some salad.  The beans and rice were totally bland and the meat coming out of the side of my flautas were black!  Not very appetizing.  My boyfriend got the chimichanga dinner which he said was just alright.  Overall, the food was sub-par, don't know if I'll be back.  Does seem like a popular place for parties, get-togethers and for families.

excerpts: I ended up ordering Tia Margarita Special Enchiladas which were actually pretty tasty.
tia margarita special enchiladas.author: Thea M.
tia margarita special enchiladas.review:
I enjoyed this place but wouldn't be my first choice when trying to pick a place to dine. There wasn't anything particularlly bad about it, I just wasn't over the moon about it.

The service was eh... They rushed us in ordering which I HATE because clearly if I haven't ordered yet I don't know what I want. 

They give you chips and salsa to munch on before the meal which is nice!
I ended up ordering Tia Margarita Special Enchiladas which were actually pretty tasty. 
I also ordered a blended double margarita which was the best part of the meal!!

we sat in the back of the restaurant but in the front they have a bar and TV so I could see myself going there again to watch a Giants game and have some drinks with friends.

excerpts: I ordered the tia margarita special enchiladas.
Absolutely delicious!
I am a connoisseur of enchiladas
so I was glad to find some tasty ones.
The service was a bit lax, but other than that pretty good.
tia margarita special enchiladas.author: Jackie B.
tia margarita special enchiladas.review: Stopped in on a rainy Tuesday evening after a friend had a hankering for some Mexican food. I had never been before, but was excited to give it a try. Definitely seems like a local spot. Family friendly/lots of characters at the bar. Started off our meal by ordering some Margaritas, it's a Tuesday after all. Opted for the single over the double. Our margs were shamed by the doubles when brought to the table on the same tray. Next time will go with the double. Fresh hot chips and salsa came to our table (a little late for our liking) we were looking forward to those. Green(hot) salsa was by far my favorite over the red(mild) option. I ordered the tia margarita special enchiladas. Absolutely delicious! I am a connoisseur of enchiladas so I was glad to find some tasty ones. The service was a bit lax, but other than that pretty good.

excerpts: You know the kind: enchiladas, burritos, tacos, chiles rellenos; the old reliables.
You get a bunch of chips and salsa to your table, and one of them was a bit too hot for me, but it will burn your mouth in the best way.
burritos.author: Jeffrey S.
burritos.review:
If you're looking for an opinion on the food, read on. Booze? I'm no help.

What I can say, is that while they're not re-defining the bounds of Mexican food, you can find a classic Mexican restaurant menu here. You know the kind: enchiladas, burritos, tacos, chiles rellenos; the old reliables. You get a bunch of chips and salsa to your table, and one of them was a bit too hot for me, but it will burn your mouth in the best way. They don't want to be precious or fancy, they just want to be an old school neighborhood spot.

That's what they are: a neighborhood spot. On a Saturday evening in the neighborhood I noticed a lot of families coming in. Granted, it was early for dinner. Like, embarrassingly early. But they definitely had a full house by 6pm, and it wasn't rowdy, rather neighbors filing in. 

It's simple, they have a really great neon sign out front, and some old school booths as well as a dining area on the non-bar side of the building. the bar is a cool little wrap area, and they were stuffed to the gills with margarita glasses and limes. Even though I'm not a drinker, I can tell they do a serious business of margaritas. They have all the usual suspects on the menu, all the normal Mexican beers, and from the looks of the marg glasses, you can order a bunch and enjoy the night just fine.

I had a chimichanga and it was exactly as you'd expect. But it was well-made, simple, and didn't cost an arm and a leg. 

The comparison to Tommy's is inevitable, so I'll throw in my non-alcoholic two cents: I'd much rather eat here than there. The alco-philes can argue the maragaritas and tequilas all day without my input, but food wise it really was no contest. Neither is really meant to be just about the food, but I'd go here again for the big portions of Mexican food and the hustle of a Richmond neighborhood restaurant setting.

excerpts: We had the fajitas, the gambas, the chiles rellenos, the burritos, the enchiladas, etc and it was all excellent.
burritos.author: Emilia G.
burritos.review:
Dinner was excellent tonite!  The guacamole was delicious but pricey.  The chips were freshly fried.  They were warm when they got to the table.  The salsas were delicious.  The rice and beans were excellent too.  We had the fajitas, the gambas, the chiles rellenos, the burritos, the enchiladas, etc and it was all excellent.  

OUR WAITER WAS THE BEST!

I've been there in the past and thought the food was meh!  But today it was excellent!  I will definitely go back while they have this chef.  

The Sangrias and Margaritas were excellent, too!

The hostess had it together, too!

Don't change a thing for a long time, please!

excerpts: I saw someone with not one, but two burritos on their plate!
burritos.author: Michelle W.
burritos.review:
Finally paid a visit to Tia Margarita. It's actually a good restaurant. But, you should know, the portions are HUGE. They have very little salad or veggies, mostly Mexican comfort food. So prepare yourself for a huge plate. I saw someone with not one, but two burritos on their plate!

The food is really good, and the margaritas are strong. The service was exceptional. I'd go back, but probably just for happy hour.

excerpts: House made empanadas, wings, quesadilla, & 4 good size mini burritos (2) Chicken |
(2) Beef... Yum!
burritos.author: Sleven M.
burritos.review: Stopped in the place for a quick bite... Bs'd w/some regulars that were friendly & full of stories! Bartender was energetic & out going & has been there 20 years! Margarita was tasty & the Sampler was AWESOMELY HUGE.  House made empanadas, wings, quesadilla, & 4 good size mini burritos (2) Chicken | (2) Beef... Yum!

excerpts: Chips & salsa + double margaritas + chicken burritos = happy us.
All the employees are very friendly (Tony is awesome) and always try to find us a spot in the bar area.
burritos.author: Laura And Adam F.
burritos.review:
We LOVE Tia's.  Chips & salsa + double margaritas + chicken burritos = happy us.  All the employees are very friendly (Tony is awesome) and always try to find us a spot in the bar area.  Hopefully in 20 years when we pass the 1000 burrito mark, we'll have a permanent booth reserved for us with our names engraved on a commemorative plate-shaped plaque.

P.S. I don't understand why people even compare Tia's and Tommy's.  The food and service are much better at Tia's, and yes Tommy's has tequila but I believe the Tia's margaritas contain that as well.

excerpts: Everything on it was deep-fried except for maybe the quesadilla and the burritos, and I didn't even have to choose between chicken or beef because I was brought 2 of each in the form of spinach and tomato tortillas, and when I dropped my taquito in my margarita on accident, I was brought 2 new taquitos (cause 1 on a plate would be lonely) AND a new margarita!
burritos.author: Megan A.
burritos.review:
WHOA on the harsh reviews!  Complaining that a drink is *too* strong? Get the heck outta here!  And making fun of the sweet elderly waitress with the hearing aid, would you be happier if she were working in the back stuffing empanadas or something? I mean jeez have a little bit of patience and compassion.   

I feel like this is kinda like saying "they had great water!" but their quesadillas are off the hook!!!  I usually scoff at corn tortillas, but they are what MAKE the quesadillas here.  I have never ordered the one with meat, because the cheesy oozy buttery one gives me lady wood every time.  The thing is though, you gotta eat it FAST because it's only "last meal" worthy if you eat it right when they place it on the table...honestly if you could snatch a piece while the waitress/er is placing it on your table that's the sweet spot.  

Per some Yelp recommendations I got the Sampler this time - THANKS GUYS, it was the best idea ever.  Everything on it was deep-fried except for maybe the quesadilla and the burritos, and I didn't even have to choose between chicken or beef because I was brought 2 of each in the form of spinach and tomato tortillas, and when I dropped my taquito in my margarita on accident, I was brought 2 new taquitos (cause 1 on a plate would be lonely) AND a new margarita!

excerpts: Side note from a tourist - the burritos weren't smothered, which is pretty standard where we are from in Colorado.
burritos.author: Mary M.
burritos.review:
Good food, large portions.  Margaritas were strong, but pretty expensive considering the majority of the drink was ice (2 sips of my double margarita and it was gone).

burritos.author: Mike L.
burritos.review:
Hit & Miss Mexican food (stick to basic staples) but probably the best authentic margaritas in California (no mix).

UPDATE: I am adding a star since I found some of the food to be excellent. Stick to the basic Mexican staples like tamales, burritos and enchiladas which are very good. The empanadas are terrible, the taquitos, carne asada and rice are very average. The fajitas are very good but you only get maybe 3 oz. of steak.

Summary:
-----------------
I give it 4 overall stars: 5 stars for the margaritas, 5 for the bar staff service/attitude but 3 1/2 stars average for food (some great, some meh). I also give it 2 stars for waitress service/attitude (the old lady is the worst) and 3 for the business hours (they close at 10:30 Fridays!). Did I mention the margis rule???


Full Review:
-------------------
I have eaten here a few times and was disappointed with the Mexican food the first few times, having grown up in San Diego and been weaned on the best. After 12 years in SF I know there is much better Mexican restaurants around (La Barca and Tortilla Heights are two great ones) and even many better taquerias (La Taqueria and Nick's are epic). But the basic staples I have discovered to be very good. What has always kept me coming back (probably 15 times now) is the ultra friendly bartender (manager?) Francisco and his truly authentic margaritas. 

The margaritas here are made using only good quality silver tequila, cointreau triple sec and fresh lime juice (so no sugary mix). I rarely drink margaritas because those made with the sweet and sour mix give me brutal heart burn but I have no problem taking down a few authentic margaritas and quite enjoy those served here. Just one of the jumbo margis will smack you in the face and two will make you delightfully toasted and much smarter, funnier and better looking. 

The other cool thing about the place is that most of the patrons (like myself) are locals from the Richmond/Seacliff neighborhoods so on a Friday night you see lots of familiar faces. 

The only other bummer is the place has limited hours (they close at 10:30 Friday and they do not open on weekends until 4PM!). WTF? Anyways, if you go for the margis and basic Mexican staples. Also, definitely sit at the bar as Francisco (the more outgoing, mexi-beach bum bartender) is much friendlier and efficient than the wait staff I have experienced.

excerpts: My buddy ordered a small combination plate and that came with TWO burritos!
Nice.
burritos.author: dave g.
burritos.review:
Tia's Rocks!
I can't believe I haven't reviewed it yet because I've eaten here at least 10 times.  I've been with friends, family, co-workers, everyone loves this place.  First thing you need to know is that the food is TASTY!  We've probably gone thru everything on the menu at this point and have never been disappointed.   It's one of our favorite places to eat in the city.

The portions are HUGE!  My wife and I will go and split a large combination plate (which gives you a choice of 3 items - tamale, burrito, enchilada, chile relleno, etc.).  It's perfect because you can try a bunch of stuff and it's only around $15.  Not only have we both been full off of that plate, but we can still bring leftovers home for another meal.  Rockin'!  

My buddy ordered a small combination plate and that came with TWO burritos!  Nice.  I read where some people were bitching about the prices, but, the food you get will feed an army.

Next, the Margaritas are great.  We had a group of 5 there tonight and everyone commented on how tasty they were.  I read a few reviews where people felt they were watered down, but I've never thought that once in all the Margaritas I've had there over the years.  In fact, sometimes I thought they were TOO strong.  (I mean, it can't really ever be TOO strong, but, ya know what I mean). 

The wait staff there is great.  We had chips and salsa on our table within moments of being seated.  They're quick to fill back up your water, they're generous with the chips and salsa and constantly come around to make sure you have everything you need.  After years of going, I finally introduced myself to the same waitress who has waited on us so many times.  Her name is Rosa and she's awesome.  She's got a great sense of humor and we love joking around with her.  I already can't wait to go back....

excerpts: too original (Mexican staples: burritos, tacos, enchilladas, quesadillas, etc) but everything they have is delicious!
burritos.author: Jean K.
burritos.review:
I'm actually surprised the stars on this restaurant are only about 3.5. I find them to be at least a 4, and if I was judging purely on the chile rellenos, I would give them a 5! 

Tia Margarita is a delicious neighborhood restaurant and bar. I have been here several times and it is a common suggestion among my friends.  The restaurant looks smaller than it actually is, which is nice because I have never waited for a seat (but I'm sure on weekends it is a bit busier.)  The food is nothing too original (Mexican staples: burritos, tacos, enchilladas, quesadillas, etc) but everything they have is delicious!

I specifically recommend the chile rellenos which are probably the best I have ever had!

The margaritas are delicious as well and if they aren't your thing, they have a full bar.  

The waitstaff is friendly and will refill my chips and salsa until my heart and stomach are content! Prices are reasonable- a little more than you would usually pay if you were going to a taqueria ($11-14 per entree) but they give you an enormous round plate of food. My test for the amount of food is always whether or not it fills up my boyfriend, who has been known to eat his fair share... This place passes the test! 

Bottom line:
-parking is not too bad
-restaurant and bar combined
-not overly crowded
-delicious food
-order the chile rellenos

burritos.author: Jason C.
burritos.review:
Tia Margarita is easy to miss. It looks like a house, doesn't have loud mariachi music blaring from inside, and doesn't blast the streets with lights. 

I walked in here with a friend after passing by numerous times. We ordered the appetizer combo and a Margarita. While we waited, we sipped on our drinks and ate some chips. They offered two salsas, a mango fruit flavored one and a spicy one. Both were good, but I preferred the fruit flavored one. You can also combine them for the best of both worlds.

When our food arrived, It turned out a lot better than I expected. We received small burritos, a quesadilla, empanadas, and a few other assortments that I forget. Good sizes, easily shared, and good quality. It wasn't the most authentic Mexican I've ever eaten, but for Americanized Mexican, it was pretty darn good -- a LOT better than Chevy's or any of the other chains. 

I left happy and decided I'd go back with more friends. The second time I went, we sat at the bar. I'll admit, I don't remember much. The bartender was nice, the drinks were generous, and the food didn't end up on the street, if you know what I mean.

Update (4/5/08) - I went back and it was a mad house. The waiters forgot our orders,  bartenders ignored us, and it was not quite the same experience. The margaritas were actually pretty bad? So we ordered some top shelf to see if there would be a difference -- nope. The food quality was different, too! Our sampler's empanada's looked like fried cheese bread. Maybe it was a weekend, but this inconsistancy is scary. I'm downgrading my rating...

excerpts: Granted, if your menu is limited to burritos, enchiladas and fajitas, with obligatory sides of rice and beans, then you're about as Mexican as Panda Express
is Chinese.
But in the meantime, Mrs M likes her enchiladas, and I like my free bottomless chips and salsa, so I figured we'd give this a shot.

burritos.author: Wes M.
burritos.review:
Lost in the blur of SF taquerias is the fact that there's precious few *sit-down* Mexican restaurants in the city--I could probably count the ones I know of on the fingers of one hand.  If you do find yourself sitting down for south-of-the-border fare, it's probably upscale Peruvian or down-home Salvadoran or some such.  Maybe Mexi-joints have been deemed too suburban?  Granted, if your menu is limited to burritos, enchiladas and fajitas, with obligatory sides of rice and beans, then you're about as Mexican as Panda Express is Chinese.  If only some bold chef would see this as a challenge and open a place specializing in authentic Mexi-dishes (perhaps even limit it to a specific region), I'm confident our pretentious citizenry would eat it up.

But in the meantime, Mrs M likes her enchiladas, and I like my free bottomless chips and salsa, so I figured we'd give this a shot.  Food was good but unmemorable--except that they gave us butter with the tortillas!  I was baffled, but Wes M never turns down free fat (seriously, I brought home some Tennessee bacon grease in a ziploc bag from the presidential debate party I went to--long story).

The other problem is that, for a restaurant that has "Margarita" in the name and a $9+ "double" margarita on the menu, it turned out to be disappointingly small, and I think Maria is right that they're pretty weak too (tasty though).  

So in the end, Velvet Cantina remains the undisputed king of the limited competition in this category.  But TM is very like VC in one way: the restaurant has two rooms, and the one with the bar has by far the superious ambiance (indeed, TM's bar is a bit reminiscent of Zam Zam, don't you think?)

burritos.author: CK F.
burritos.review:
This restaurant is literally the reason why I've finally made a Yelp account.. to advise you NOT to eat here. Unless you want to get boozed up because that is probably the only reliable thing here, strong drinks. 

Why? Let me explain. 
**Poor service
Rude! Rude! Rude!
Not only did our waitress ignore our request for waters, only concerned with what we wanted from the bar ($), but she literally sat at the table across from our booth watching us while we figured out what we wanted and then stared at us while we ate our meal. She wasn't the only one though, it seemed to be the break area for other servers. Awkward. Not to mention, when asking the size of a burrito (because they have plates w 2 burritos.. never seen that in my life) she looked at my boyfriend and said "what do you think?" And then proceeded to tell him he should get the plate w 2 burritos poking fun at this size. The burritos were normal size, I would be surprised if anyone could eat both. Now onto food. 

**Worst Mexican food I've ever eaten
Let's say everything tasted like it came out of a can. No flavor, sour cream and guacamole smelled rancid and everything with "tomatoes" should really read ketchup. Not to mention the plates are so hot you have to wait a good 5 minutes before anything is tolerable to eat.

**Dinner in the dark
Why would I pay $20 for a plate of Mexican food to eat it in the dark? No thanks.

Needless to say, I will never be coming back to this restaurant. You couldn't pay me to come back.

excerpts: Also good are the burritos, ground beef tacos, and steak picado.
burritos.author: Sarah M.
burritos.review:
Freaking love this place. I come here once a week, and that's only because I don't want to appear overzealous. It's not that the food and drink are the best ever, there's just something about this place that makes you want to be a regular.

The chicken fajita meat is fantastic and used in several of the entree's. Just the right mix of citrus and cumin and some other stuff I can't identify but know it tastes damn good. It's especially yum in the Jenni's Special, which is a salad dish and my jam when I'm trying to feel healthy. Black beans, lettuce, chicken, tiny diced jalapenos, and tons of cheese with some sort of creamy dressing that I never use. Also good are the burritos, ground beef tacos, and steak picado.

Sit at the bar, order a large Margarita - no salt, on the rocks, snack on the chips and tomato-y delicious salsa, order something with fajita meat, and make friends with the bartenders. You'll want to come back every Sunday.

excerpts: Menu populated with typical Tex-Mex style tacos, burritos, enchiladas.

excerpts: Honestly there may be other places that have better burritos or soups or whatever, but in San Francisco most all of those places are hole in the wall spots where you stand in line get your burrito and leave.
burritos.author: Robert S.
burritos.review: I love this place.  Other than really crappy parking I always enjoy eating here.  Honestly there may be other places that have better burritos or soups or whatever, but in San Francisco most all of those places are hole in the wall spots where you stand in line get your burrito and leave.  If you want a nice hot plate of enchiladas with beans, rice, melted cheese with a never ending stream of chips and delicious salsa then this is a place you need to try.  I recommend the Enchiladas with sour cream sauce with a fried egg on top.

I only like coming here at night.  The place has a different atmosphere during the day.  Parking sucks in this area.  Ok bye.

excerpts: Burritos should be served right off the grill wrapped in foil for $5, not served on a plate with a knife and fork for $15.
My first thought was, "Great, another mediocre Mexican restaurant with overpriced burritos on a plate.
They better have good margaritas!
The margaritas are made by hand with fresh ingredients, very good.
burritos.author: Gene M.
burritos.review:
I love real Mexican food. It should come from a dirty taqueria or a truck, not a sit down restaurant with a waitstaff. Burritos should be served right off the grill wrapped in foil for $5, not served on a plate with a knife and fork for $15. Mexican food is honest, and should be served as such. 

These are the reasons why I choose to never go to any sit down Mexican restaurants. But, keeping an open mind and trying new things are my forte, and I was pleasantly surprised when I was introduced to Tia Margarita.

My first thought was, "Great, another mediocre Mexican restaurant with overpriced burritos on a plate. They better have good margaritas!" The margaritas are made by hand with fresh ingredients, very good. VERY GOOD chimichanga, pretty good enchiladas, good chips and salsa. 

I'd probably only go back if a friend wanted to go there, because I like my food cheap, good, and honest, and you get that from places with a sizzling grill right next to a ringing cash register right next to a big jar of horchata right next to a sticky table top. Check out my full review on my blog, see profile.

Quesadilla & Burritos. Food was not bad, but it just doesn't feel the same when you don't eat with your hands.

Overall, it was a good experience. I guess I still prefer the taquerias.

excerpts: The service was quick and the burritos I had were pretty authentic.

burritos.author: Michael E.
burritos.review: It's hard to find good Mexican food outside of the Mission, but a group of us stumbled on this place accidentally and wow, what a cool find. We had 11 people seated in about 40 minutes on a Saturday, and while we waited we drank the strongest margarita I have ever tasted (maybe a little too strong, and not as good as Tommy's nearby). The service was quick and the burritos I had were pretty authentic. I couldn't finish my meal because the portions were sizable and the chips and salsa beforehand were one of a kind.

the best margaritas in the city.

the salsa is great with the double salted margaritas and Francisco makes it better than anyone else in the joint, with a smile!
